loans.name: Hachem

texts.en:
Hachem is a 48-year-old married man and the father of four children. He has been working selling coffee and hot drinks since 1994 and is still working hard to improve his business in order to provide his precious family with the best, healthy living.

Hachem loves his family a lot and plans to meet all of their needs. In addition to providing them with the best education, he was able to finish his Intermediate education and was hoping to have a university degree, but life was harsh for him and he had to help with his family's income.

Hachem is planning to expand his business through buying an additional espresso machine through a loan requested from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner. It's Hachem's first time experiencing Al Majmoua's loans and hopes it will be with positive effect.

Hachem works in a manufacturing city. He doesn't have a coffee shop, but he has a carriage that holds all of his things, and most of the workers look forward to his coffee after hard working hours.

Through the second coffee machine, Hachem can increase his income and fulfill all of his family's dreams and needs, and fulfill his dream of educating his children, too.

loans.use: to buy another espresso machine to increase his business

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with eight children. 

Rebecca has a shop that sells snacks, canned goods & noodles. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 21,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Rebecca has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

loans.name: Damarice

texts.en:
Damarice is 35 years old, married to Stephen and they have one child.

She has operated her Mpesa shop (mobile phone money transfer services) for two years.  She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first  loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy more phone accessories and sell them to boost her Mpesa income.

In future, Damarice hopes to grow her business and become a mobile phones and accessories dealer in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To diversify and start selling mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 24 years old, married and has one child.

Alaa has been a tailor since 2003. He makes and repairs men's, women's and kids' clothing. He has a long experience in this field and has a deep understanding of local consumer and he is becoming well known in his area.


He decided to apply for a $1200 loan in order to buy a tailoring machine and a split air conditioner. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy a tailoring machine and a split air conditioner.

loans.name: Esbon

texts.en:
Esbon is 67 years old, married to Hannah, and they have  five children.  

He has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last twenty-six years. He  was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy two dairy cows.

In future, Esbon hopes to become a leading supplier of milk in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Estrella has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, noodles & detergents. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Estrella has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Estrella hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sameh

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married and has one child.

Sameh has been an owner of a food market since 2008 selling soft drinks, juices, and cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He decided to apply for a $2400 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his market. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his market.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 21 years old, married and has one child.

Sara is an owner for a farm for rearing calves and cows since 2005. She has a long experience in this field and has a deep understanding of local consumers and she is becoming well known in her area.

She decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to buy a dairy cow. She is aiming to gain more profits to offer her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Zeina

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 30 years old, married and has three children.

Zeina has been a tailor since 2008. She makes and repairs women's and kids' clothing. She has a long experience in this field and has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and she is becoming well known in her area.

She decided to apply for $2000 loan in order to buy two tailoring machines and a generator. She is aiming to gain more profits to offer her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy two tailoring machines and a generator.

loans.name: Kisanga Group

texts.en:
Hamdan, who is in his mid 50s, is married and has four children who go to school and college. He has also two grandchildren who are still very young.  

He has had a tailoring business since 1979. He works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to buy more fabrics and sewing equipment and has paid back his loan successfully. He hopes for a loan to buy a modern electrical sewing machine. He has been using a manual sewing machine with which it takes a lot of time to make a dress and has to use a lot of energy. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Kisanga," which has a total of 17 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. 

(For these two days the weather has not been good for photos.)

loans.use: To buy a modern electrical sewing machine.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru:
Хасан женат и имеет 5 детей.  Его жена домохозяйка и он один работает в семье. Он имеет продуктовый магазин, и он продаёт сахар, мука, масло, рис, макароны и другие разные продукты.  Когда впервые он получал кредит с Имон Интернэшнл, он сделал хорошую прибыль и кредит был полезным для него. С помощью предыдущего кредита, который он получал ранее, он расширил свой бизнес и улучшил свой уровень жизни. Теперь он хочет, получит еще кредит для покупки нового ассортимента продуктов питания с целью расширения бизнеса и пополнения оборотного капитала. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Hasan is married and has five children. His wife is a homemaker and he is the sole breadwinner for the family. He has a products store where he sells sugar, flour, butter, rice, pasta and other miscellaneous products. When he first received a loan from IMON International, he made a good profit and the loan was useful to him. With the previous loan he received, he grew his business and improved his quality of life. Now, he wants to receive another loan to buy a new assortment of food products with the goal of expanding his business and working capital.

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of food products

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 28-year-old married man, the father of three children who are his life, as he describes them. He seeks perfection to provide them with the best living.

Ali has worked as a mechanic since 1999. He is a man with good reputation and a hard worker who struggles to improve and expand his business to attract more customers. 

His garage is located on the main road, where he's visible to everyone and especially to passers by. 

Ali is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy new tools and lubricants necessary to improve his business.
 
Through these tools, Ali will be capable of accomplishing his work in a shorter period of time with more technical improvements.
 
Ali is working hard to provide his family with the best, healthful living and the best education he can provide, since he didn't get the chance to finish his own education.

Ali hopes to expand his garage to attract more customers and expand his car-maintenance range as well.

loans.use: To buy new tools and lubricants necessary for his business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose has four children, all of whom are in school. She is married. She has been a charcoal seller for two years now. Rose took a loan from BRAC South Sudan to purchase more charcoal to sell, with the hopes of expanding her business. She will use the profit for building and paying school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries such as assorted biscuits, shampoo, oils, milk, soft drinks and sugar for her retail shop business.

loans.name: Saniata

texts.en:
Saniata is 39 years old and married. She has four children. She works hard to provide the financial needs of her family.

Saniata is business-minded woman, and she runs a retail shop in the village where she lives. She has been able to keep it running for almost two years. Saniata dreams of giving her children a good education and a better quality of life through the income she generates from her business. 

She would like to stock her shop with all types of products such as sugar, oil, bar soap, detergent soap and food ingredients. To do this, she is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 10,000. 

She believes that through her small business she will be able to see her dream come true.

loans.use: to buy sugar, oil, bar soap, detergent soap and food ingredients for her retail shop business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, sugar, oil, canned goods and rice for her retail shop business.

loans.name: Kuul's Group

texts.en:
Kuul is the leader of this group. She is 77 and, unfortunately, she is a widow. She has raised a son who is 49 and works as a builder. The son is married and lives separately with his family. 

In order to earn money to meet her daily needs, Kuul breeds livestock. She started this activity a long time ago. Therefore, she has good experience in this sphere. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase two or three goats in order to increase the number of livestock. 

In the future Kuul wants to build a shed for her livestock.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase goats.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 27 years old and married to Michael. They have two school-going children.  

She has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last seven years. She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her fourth loan. She plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Beatrice hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, wheat flour and maize flour in bulk.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 57 years old, married to Rahab and they have eight school-going children.  

He has practiced farming for the last 11 years. He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan. He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mzaituni Group

texts.en:
Darzen, who is in her late 20s, is married with one daughter. She has been running a clothes shop for two years now. She works from 8 a.m to 6 p.m daily and is able to make fair monthly profit.

This will be her 2nd "Motisha" loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A "Motisha" loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania  given in the middle of the main loan that motivates borrowers with good credit ratings who pay back their  loans  smoothly to receive half the amount of the existing loan before their original loan term has ended. Darzen used the previous loan to increase the shop inventory and has paid back her loan successfully. She wants this loan to buy more clothes from Kariakoo, a business centre which is some few kilometres from the City Centre. Her dream is to one day be an international businesswoman.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Mzaituni" which has a total of 10 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more  clothes from Kariakoo to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes has one child who is in school. She is married. Agnes is a charcoal seller. She has been in this business for one year. She took a loan from BRAC South Sudan to purchase more charcoal to sell. She will use the profit from her business to pay for her child to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul  is 63 years old, married to Grace and blessed with children.

He owns a retail shop. He has been in this business for the last forty years and gets an income of KES.15,000 per month.

He was introduced to KADET by a friend who is a client. He is applying for his second loan of KES.30,000 from KADET LTD. He plans to buy stock like flour, sugar, soap, cereals and also buy farm seedlings.

He will use the extra profit to pay school fees and food for the children. He hopes to own a wholesale shop. He is very hard-working.

loans.use: To buy stock like flour, sugar, soap,  cereals and also farm seedlings.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 28-year-old married man, working since December 2001 at selling used spare parts. His work is unique in his area.

Abdallah buys used appliances and takes them apart to sell each part alone, which people find attractive since most of the time these parts are needed but can't be found easily anywhere.

Abdallah is a man with a good reputation; he is well known in his region and recommended by most of his customers.

Abdallah is working hard on expanding his business and to buy a small plot of land where he can build his dream house for his family to enjoy living in a healthy environment. He is requesting a loan from Al Mjamoua, a Kiva partner, in order to increase his inventory of used spare parts, which will definitely increase his income  and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To increase his inventory of used spare parts.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose  is 50 years old, married to Peter,  and they have  four school-going children.  

She has practiced farming for the last eleven years.  She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her third  loan. She plans to use the loan amount to purchase  a dairy cow.

In future, Rose hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sempati Utara 1 Group

texts.en: Rohani is 46 years old. She is divorced and only lives with her children and grandchildren. To support herself, she sells clothes door to door around her area. Now she is requesting 3,000,000 Indonesia Rupiah to repair her rented house. She hopes that after repairing the house, she can sell the clothes there. She hopes she can continue to expand her business and can support herself without burdening her children.

loans.use: to repair her rented house.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 45 years old, married to Ruth,  and they have four school-going children.  

He has practiced farming for the last eleven years.  He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He plans to use the loan to buy a dairy cow which will supplement his income from farming.

In future, Peter hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is 34 years old and married to David. They have one child who is three years old.

She has a boutique that has been running for five years. She is applying for her first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable her to buy more clothes, socks, bedsheets and blankets to add to her stock.

She hopes to own a big boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, socks, bedsheets and blankets to add to her stock.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last three years.  He is 43 years old, married to Agnes, and they have two school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy one dairy cow and four sheep.

In future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in his town.

loans.use: To buy one dairy cow and four sheep.

loans.name: Djasur

texts.ru:
Джасур честный и целеустремленный муж. Он женат и отец 3 детей. Его жена не работает, она домохозяйка и присматривает за детьми, а Джасур зарабатывает сам, чтобы жить и улучшить уровень жизни семьи в положительную сторону. Вот таким образом он выбрал для себя услуги таксиста, и более 7 лет он занимается перевозкой людей.  Он очень веселый водитель и старается удовлетворить все потребности своих пассажиров и всегда старается создавать уют для них. Его клиенты всегда выходят из машины с довольными лицами и с хорошими настроениями. Джасур хотел бы получит кредит в размере 2500$ США для ремонта своего автомобиля и покупка запчастей, который позволит ему безопасную и комфортную дорогу.

texts.en:
Djasur is an honest and purposeful husband. He is married and is a father of three children. His wife does not work, she is a homemaker and looks after the children and Djasur makes a living himself to improve the quality of life for his family. By doing this he has chosen to provide services as a taxi driver and has been transporting people for more than seven years. He is a very cheerful driver and tries to satisfy all of the needs of his passengers and always tries to provide maximum comfort for them. His customers always leave the car with happy faces and good spirits. Djasur wants to receive a loan in the amount of $2,500USD to repair his vehicle and to buy spare parts which will let him have a safe and comfortable journey.

loans.use: to repair the vehicle and buy spare parts

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: She has no child. She is a widow. She has been operating her small shop for two years selling plastic, salt, soap etc. She took a loan from BRAC South Sudan to purchase more salt, soap and plastics to sell, with the hope of expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase more plastics, salt, and soap to sell

loans.name: Dilbar's Group

texts.en:
Dilbar is the treasurer of this group. She is 52 and married to a builder. Together with her husband she has raised a son, who is 21 and employed. A year ago, with an initial investment of 10,000 soms, Dilbar started to sell products such as fruit and vegetables, macaroni, chocolate, etc. In this way she earns 7000 soms per month. 

With the profits gained from the business, Dilbar built a kiosk and increased the commodity turnover. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase more goods for her inventory and a fridge to keep products cool. In the future Dilbar wants to expand her business and improve the family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a fridge to keep products cool.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine, a 44-year-old widow with three school-going children, is a tailor who also sells clothing materials to her clients. Now applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more materials to add to her stock, she hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more materials to add to her stock.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a resident and farmer in Litein, South Rift, Kenya. He has been in the farming business for the last 10 years producing and selling pineapples, tea and milk. He employs one farmhand. He is married with 5 children, two of whom are still in school.

Henry has requested a loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a chuff cutter (machine to cut corn or hay into small pieces) for his dairy farm. He says it will help him in providing better feed for the animals and improve their output which will go a long way in improving his family living standards. He is also focusing on building a dairy unit for his cows.

He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's interventions on behalf of farmers financial needs.

loans.use: to purchase a chuff cutter

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen is 20 years old, from the Manyatta area, and is married to Keneddy. They have one child who is two years old.
Maureen has a retail shop and is applying for her first loan from Kiva partner, KADET, to enable her buy cooking oil, flour, eggs, rice etc. to add to her stock. She hopes to expand her business in the future and see it become a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cooking oil, flour, eggs, rice etc.

loans.name: Tarek

texts.en:
Tarek is a 32-year-old married man. He has been working in his grocery store since 2006. Tarek is a hardworking man, well known in the region as a man with a good reputation and who offers special customer service.
Tarek wants to keep on improving his business, especially in the Holy Ramadan month. Most people are fasting and they come to buy goods from his shop – he has to be ready for any request. That is why Tarek has requested a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. This is his first loan and he hopes it will reflect positively on both his social and financial situation. Tarek's shop is located in a highly populated area, and his competitors are far away from his shop. That is why he is insisting on improving and increasing his merchandise to keep his customers satisfied.
Tarek used to work as a tailor, but he preferred to work with something that is directly to do with everyday living. Tarek hopes to expand his shop and introduce new products to his customers in the near future.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise for Holy Ramadan.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en: Maurice is 38 years old, married, and has five children. His has a motorcycle business. He is applying for his third loan from Kiva partner, KADET, to buy another motorcycle to add to the one in operation. He will use the profits made to add stock to his wife's retail shop as she also assists him in maintaining the family financially. He hopes to own a transport company in the future.

loans.use: to buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.fr:
Client de 49 ans, marié et père de 6  enfants dont l’âge varie entre 7 et 23 ans.
A la fin de ses études universitaires, étant un diplôme sans emploi, il se lance dans la vente des vivres frais en 2002.
Il achète des saucissons, cartons de poulet, cartons de cuisses et ailes de poulets qu’il vend chez lui à domicile.
A l’octroi de son prêt, il veut renforcer le stock de son stock en achetant 10 cartons de saucissons, 5 cartons de cuisses de poulets, 5 cartons de ailes de poulets, 2 cartons de queue de bœuf et queue de porcs.
Avec ses bénéfices, il veut épargner pour qu’a la longue il achète un groupe électrogène pour palier aux problèmes d’électricité et a la longue construire une chambre froide et devenir grossiste en vivres frais.
texts.en:
This client is 49, married and the father of six children whose ages vary between seven and 23. At the end of his university studies, having a diploma but no job, he got into selling frozen foods in 2002.

He buys sausages, cartons of chicken thighs and wings that he sells at his home. When he receives the loan, he wants to buy 10 cartons of sausages, five cartons of chicken thighs, five cartons of chicken wings, and two cartons of beef and pork tails. 

With his profits he wants to put aside savings so that in the long run he can buy a generator to ease his electricity problems. In the very long run he hopes to build a cold storage room and become a wholesaler for frozen foods.

loans.use: to buy cartons of chicken thighs and wings and of sausages.

loans.name: Damary

texts.en:
Damary is 48 years old and married to Zebby. They have two grandchildren who are under their care. 
Damary has a boutique where she makes and sells clothes. She also has a salon as her second business, She is applying for her first loan from Kiva partner, KADET, to enable her to buy more materials to add to her stock. The profits made will be used to cater for the family's needs. Damary hopes to expand her businesses in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials to add to her stock.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a farmer in the Litein area of South Rift, Kenya, where he lives with his family of six, three of whom are of school-going age. His farm produces tomatoes, tea, eggs and milk. He has two farmhands.
Peter has requested a loan of 80,000 KES from Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase a dairy cow. He says the income will help him in feeding and educating the family as well as improving his farming investment. He is focusing on starting a transport business in the future. Peter is, however, lamenting the poor market prices for farm produce, but is glad that Juhudi Kilimo has made loans available to farmers.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ngoy

texts.fr:
Client de 38 ans, marie et père de 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 1 mois et 2 ans. A la fin de ses études universitaires, il se lance dans la vente des produits divers et manufacturés en 2006 pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
Ses ventes sont de 45.000 à 60.000frs par jour, il a su fidéliser ses clients en leur proposant des prix abordables et de la marchandise de qualité.
A l’octroi de ce nouveau prêt, il va acheter des cartons de margarine, de lait de l’huile, des cartons de savons de lessive et toilette, des conserves telles que sardines, corn bœuf, tomate et bidons d’huile.
Pour l’avenir il pense ouvrir une boutique d’alimentation et avec ses bénéfices, épargner et acheter une parcelle pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
This client is 38 years old, married and the father of two children, one month old and two years old. At the end of his university studies, he got into selling various manufactured products in 2006 to support his family. 

His sales are from 45,000 to 60,000 francs per day. He has been able to establish a client base by offering affordable prices and quality merchandise. Upon receiving this new loan, he is going to buy cartons of margarine, milk, detergents and toilet soap, and tinned foods such as sardines, corned beef, tomatoes, and tins of oil. 

In the future he intends to open a grocery store and with his profit, save to buy a plot of land for his children.

loans.use: to buy cartons of tomato paste, sacks of rice, and tins of oil.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 63 years old and a widow with adult children. She has been running a retail shop for the past six years making a monthly income of 4,500 KES, which she uses to cater for her basic needs.
Agnes is applying for her fifth loan from Kiva partner, KADET. She will use the loan to add stock of sugar, rice and maize meal to her shop. With the anticipated profits from the business she will expand her business. Her hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop, buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to add stock of sugar, rice and maize meal to her shop.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 37 years old, married to Fidelis, and blessed with three children.
Thomas hawks tea leaves, soya, coffee and many other products. He has been in this business for the last seven years and earns an income of 14,500 KES per month. He is applying for his third loan, of 20,000 KES, from Kiva partner, KADET, with which he plans to buy tea leaves, soya and coffee and pay for packaging expenses and other expenses. Thomas will use the anticipated profit to educate his children. In the future, he hopes to start a manufacturing business for said items, packaging them and becoming a wholesale distributor.

loans.use: to buy tea leaves, soya, coffee and other goods.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 67 years old and married to Jacinta. They are blessed with eight children. John has been a farmer for the past 20 years and earns a monthly income of 3,000 KES, which he uses to support his family. He is applying for his fifth loan from Kiva partner, KADET. He will use the loan to buy seedlings, spraying chemicals and watering pipes. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will boost his farming business. His hope is to educate his children up to university level.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, spraying chemicals and watering pipes.

loans.name: Nurlan

texts.ru:
Нурлан – 36-летний фермер, занимающийся разведением скота и полеводством. Опыт в этой сфере,  полученный с самого раннего детства, и упорный каждодневный труд позволили ему стать успешным аграрием. 
Начав свою деятельность в посадки семян картофеля на общую сумму около 2,000 сом (KGS), Нурлан смог развить ферму с ежемесячным доходом в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS). Сегодня, в его хозяйстве насчитывается 3 лошади и 10 баранов, а также 1 га поливной земли, где он выращивает картофель и кормовые культуры. 
Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нурлан обратился в компанию «Бай Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку баранов. Доходы он планирует вложить в реконструкцию своего дома. В ближайшем будущем , Нурлан, являющийся заботливым сыном престарелой матери,  мечтает женится и стать отцом.    
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Nurlan is a 36-year farmer who raises animals and grows crops. Many years of experience, from a very early age on, and  hard daily work have allowed him to   become a successful farmer.

Having launched his business by planting potato seeds for the total sum of about 2,000 KGS, Nurlan has been able to develop a farm with a monthly income of 15,000 KGS. Today he has three horses and 10 sheep, as well as 1 ha [2.5 acres] of workable land, where he  grows potatoes as well as plants used for animal feed.

In order to develop his business further, Nurlan turned to “Bai Tushum and Partners” for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS to buy sheep. He plans to use his earnings in order to rebuild his house. In the near future, Nurlan, who is a loving son to his aged mother, would like to get married and start a family. MFC “Bai Tushum and Partners” offers loans through Kiva to socially vulnerable populations. MFC “Bai Tuhsum and Partners” is a leading microfinance company in Kyrgzystan. “Bai Tushum and Partners” is a reliable financial partner which contributes to the economic development in Kyrgystan through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Cholpon's Group

texts.en:
Cholpon is the leader of this group. She is 44 and married to a tractor driver. Together with her husband she brings up three daughters. The youngest daughter studies at school and the other two are employed. Six years ago, with an initial investment of 10,000 KGS, Cholpon started to breed livestock. Reselling livestock after fattening, she earns 5,000 KGS per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the near future, Cholpon plans to build a shed in the house to keep livestock there. Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen has three children, one of whom is in school. She is married. She is a charcoal seller and has been in this business for two years. Hellen took a loan from BRAC South Sudan to purchase or order charcoal to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a resident and farmer in the Eldoret town area of North Rift, Kenya. She has been in poultry farming for over four years, producing poultry birds and eggs, which she sells to the local market. She is married with four children, all of whom are in school. She owns a grocery business that supplements her farming income.
Sarah has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to expand her poultry business by buying more poultry birds and building a poultry unit. She says the business will enable her to educate her children. She also plans on making an entry into dairy farming. Sarah appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's loan services and says it will raise farmers' living standards.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Mubinakhon

texts.ru:
Мубинахон честная и любящая мать 3 детей.  Она замужем и её муж является бизнесменом. Более 5 лет она занимается сушкой фруктов, и у неё достаточный опыт, чтобы развивать данный бизнес. С прибылью, которая она получила, она обеспечивала свою семью, а часть прибыли использовала на покупку радиоаппаратуры и мебель для своего дома.  Мубинахон хотела бы получить кредит в размере 1200$ США для переработки сухофруктов, чтобы продавать их за прибыльную цену и зарабатывать больше денег. Она хочет заранее поблагодарить всех кредиторов за их поддержку и поощрение.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Mubinakhon is the honest and loving mother of three children. She is married and her husband is a businessman. For more than five years she has working drying fruit, and she has sufficient experience to develop this business. With profits she has received, she has provided for her family.  Part of the profits she used to buy a radio and furniture for her home. Mubinakhon would like to receive a loan of $1200 to process dried fruits to sell them at a profitable price and make more money. She wants to thank all the lenders for their support and encouragement. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to process dried fruit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start selling wedding dresses as a new business

loans.name: Vera

texts.ru:
Вера  - 58-летняя фермерша, живущая со своей семьей в селе Тюп. В 1991 году Вера начала свой бизнес в разведении бычков, кроликов и свиней с начальной суммой в 15,000 сом (KGS).  На сегодняшний день, ферма Веры дает ежемесячную прибыль в сумме около 13.000 сом (KGS). Благодаря своему бизнесу, Вера смогла провести свадьбу сына и помогла ему купить машину для молодой семьи. Для дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Вера обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) для покупки одного бычка и шести поросят для откорма и последующей перепродажи.  На доходы она планирует приобрести необходимые для проведения ремонта дома стройматериалы.  
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Vera is a 58 year old farmer who lives with her family in the village of Tuyp. In 1991 Vera started her own business by breeding calves, rabbits and pigs with the starting capital of 15,000 KGS. Today Vera's farm gives her a monthly profit of around 13,000 KGS. Thanks to her business Vera was able to throw a wedding for her son and helped him buy a car for his young family. For the further growth of business Vera has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 30,000 KGS to buy one calf and six piglets for feeding and selling afterwards. She plans to use the income to buy the necessary building materials for making repairs in her home.

ZAO MFK Bai Tushum & Partners provides loans through Kiva for socially vulnerable population regions. ZAO MFK Bai Tushum & Partners is one of the leading micro financing organizations in Kyrgyzstan. Bai Tushum & Partners is a reliable financial partner which makes an impact in development of the economy in the Republic of Kyrgyzstan, provides affordable micro lending services in the rural towns and cities, helps to create jobs and is responsible for the interests of their clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Nambale Mixed Group

texts.en:
Most people take the plunge into business ventures notwithstanding the risks involved. It goes without saying that most people join business with a mindset inclined towards profit making. Most people invariably take both the rough and the smooth in their journey. Hard work is always of the first magnitude if any business undertaking is to make any kind of headway. The past 15 years have been years of grit, determination and tenacity for 35-year-old Susan as she has gone about her drug sales business in the metropolis of Mityana in central Uganda. Susan is worth her salt in every sense of the word in her pharmacy business at present. The happy-go-lucky mother of four says her business has been in the running with customers as well as seeing profits increasing.
Susan has however had her fair share of adversity. On many occasions, she has been running short on drug supplies at her pharmacy. What in most cases compounds her problem is the lack of capital to purchase more drugs to resell. She says, however, when there are enough drugs at her pharmacy, she rides high on sales income. Susan says she set forth in this business after medical school. On the side, she ekes out a side income from a small farming business. With this Kiva loan, Susan says she will purchase more drugs for resale.

loans.use: to purchase more drugs for resale.

loans.name: Erdenetseteg

texts.en:
Erdenetsetseg is 40 years old and lives with her two children who attend high school, in Govisumber province of Mongolia. Her youngest daughter attends the Institute of Finance and Economics.  Erdenetsetseg started to trade meat in 1996. She purchases meat and animals from countryside people and sells them at the local market place. She manages her business independently. She is a very experienced person who knows her business and market. On daily basis, she sells two thirds sheep or goat meat and one third of horse or beef. 

Besides her sales income, her monthly retirement allowance is 108,000 MNT. She is interested in receiving a low interest rate loan from the bank. She is a hard working person who says, "I want to pay the tuition fee of my daughter's college". She is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase more meats and increase her turnover capital. She received the loan from the bank on the 1st of August, 2011, and she had 320,000 MNT of her own money in cash. Due to the Naadam festival, the demand of meat was very high. Thus, she used the money to purchase 10 sheep/goats from the countryside herder.

loans.use: To purchase more meats

loans.name: Philis

texts.en:
Philis is 32 years old and married to Dennis.  They are blessed with two children.  She sells clothes and bedding.  She has been in this business for the last two years and gets an income of KES.3,500 per month.

She is applying for her first loan of KES10,000 from KADET LTD., with which she plans to buy clothes and bedding for sale.  She will use the anticipated profit to expand the business.  She hopes to boost her business and be able to open a shop.

loans.use: To buy stock like clothes and bedding for sale

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: There are many Cambodians who make a living as rice cultivators; one of them is Mrs. Sam who has been working in this sector since 1999. She and her husband grow rice on their own farmland that they inherited from their grandparents. From this business they can generate an income of around $ 4 per day. This humble couple has no dependent children. This rice-growing season, the family planted rice two months ago but their rice is not growing well due to the lack of fertilizer. Because of this, Mrs. Sam needs a loan from Kiva in order to purchase fertilizer to improve her crops' yield. She is in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Erdenchimeg

texts.en:
Erdenchimeg is 50 years old and lives with her daughters in Gobisumber province of Mongolia. Her two daughters are 18 and 14 years old and are a college student and a high school student, respectively. Erdenchimeg manages a mobile food trading business at the train station in her town. She started her business in 1996 after moving from Erdenet city. Aside from her main business, she is also a salesperson at the Delgereh grocery shop, and her monthly salary is 140,000MNT. She will be retired by the next year. Her oldest daughter also works as a waitress at the Delgereh food court during her summer break.

Erdenchimeg is a diligent and hard working woman who says, "I want to educate my daughters and prepare them to be good professionals". She is requesting a 900,000 MNT loan to pay the her daughter's tuition fee.

loans.use: To pay her daughter's tuition fee

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a farmer in Eldoret, South Rift, Kenya. She has been in mixed farming for two years, producing milk and bananas and selling to the local market.  She has employed one farmhand. She is married, with two children aged 13 and 5 years.

Janet has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  Janet says the farming project will assist her in educating her children as well as providing food for the family. She aspires to be the best dairy farmer in her area.

Janet laments the low market prices for farm produce and the high costs of dairy feeds.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora has seven children, four of whom are in school. She is married. She has been a businesswoman for five years, and has a business of selling firewood. She took a loan from BRAC South Sudan with the hopes buying more firewood to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood for sale

loans.name: Krouch

texts.en:
There are many Cambodians who make a living as rice cultivators. One of them is Krouch, who has been working in this sector since 2005. 

She and her husband grow rice on their own farmland that they inherited from their grandparents. From this business, they can generate an income of around US $4 per day. 

This humble couple has two children who are students. This growing-rice season, the family planted rice two months ago but their rice is not growing well due to the lack of fertilizer. Because of this condition, Krouch would like to borrow a loan from Kiva in order to purchase fertilizer to improve her crops' yield.

She took the photo at rented house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Afi Enyonamé

texts.fr:
Afi est une femme âgée de 27ans. Elle est célibataire. Elle a 02 enfants. 
Afi travaille comme revendeuse de charbons de bois depuis 2006. Elle sert ses  clients  à dans un quartier de la place. Elle achète les produits au méme lieu. 
Afi a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de charbons de bois et des ignames.
texts.en: Afi is a 27 year-old single mother of two. She has sold charcoal for a living since 2006, and serves her customers from the same local quarter from which she buys her goods. She is seeking her first loan cycle from WAGES in order to purchase bags of charcoal and yams.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and yams

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 38 years old and married to Evans.  They have two school-aged children.  She sells clothes as her primary business and also has a taxi as her secondary business.  She has been in this businesses for three years, making a monthly profit of KES.10,000.  

She has requested a loan from KADET LTD of KES.25,000, with which she plans to purchase more clothes for sale.  With the anticipated profit, she plans to educate her children, who are already in secondary school, to higher levels of education.  She hopes that in the near future she can be able to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale

loans.name: Shaher

texts.en:
Shaher is a 28-year-old single man. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Shaher also manages a small advertising office offering the services of newspaper advertising, designing ads and billboards, and producing commercial advertising statues for shops and companies. 

Shaher took out a loan from FATEN as he decided to prepare a space in the company to exhibit the work he has done for clients.

Shaher wants to have a better business in the future and be able to have a company with a good reputation. Shaher is photographed in his shop.

loans.use: to prepare a space for exhibiting advertising work

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is 34 years old and married to George; they have two children aged eighteen and twelve. She has a hotel business which has been in operation for the last two years and which makes a monthly profit of 9,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). She has been loaned 20,000 KES with which she plans to purchase food ingredients for her hotel (rice, sugar, flour, cooking fat etc.).

With the anticipated profits she plans to educate her children. Her hope for the future is to continue running the hotel and maximize profits.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients for her hotel (rice, sugar, flour, cooking fat, etc.)

loans.name: Benkadi A Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI A sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 32   ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Banco ville, chef lieu de commune rurale, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, FATOUMATA MADOU la personne au milieu dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché de Banco et au niveau de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en: The ten members of the Benkadi A group are married women, 32 years old on average, who have on average 5 children. Most live in polygamous families in the city of Banco, the administrative center of the rural village, in the prefecture of Dioïla, in the region of Koulikoro, the second administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in the goal to be able to better organize their businesses for the beginning of winter. They grow, among other things, rice and peanuts. They are on their first collaboration with the institution. With this loan, Fatoumata Madou, the middle person in the row of those standing, plans to buy the resources and small equipment and pay for labor costs to maintain about .5 hectares of rice. The harvest is sold at the Banco market at N’Golobougou to a clientele composed of men and women. They plan to earn on average about 25,000 CFA for each crop cycle.

loans.use: to pay for labor, seed, fertilizer, herbicide and small equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to refit his cafeteria

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en:
Khodor is a 20-year-old single man who rents hookas, which are also known as sheesha or waterpipes. They are a single-or multi-stemmed, often glass-based instruments for smoking, in which the smoke is cooled and filtered by passing through water. It comes with special flavors and it's becoming very popular among people in the Middle East. 

Khodor started his business in 2006, and it's improving a lot. He sends the hookas by delivery to homes or businesses as requested. 

His shop is small but is good enough to handle all the preparations for deliveries. 

Khodor is requesting his first loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase the number of hookas he owns, which will increase his income. 

Kkhodor used to work as a car mechanic--he used to be an employee--but he insisted on making his own business with less capital requirements. He's smart about what he's doing and hopes to improve his business more and more, and to get a larger shop to start expecting clients to visit his cafe.

loans.use: To buy more hookas in order to increase his income

loans.name: Ategbeh Town Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the "Ategbeh Town" group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown city. They are seeking a loan of 4,300,000 Leone (SLL) from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their respective businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

The leader of this group is Mamusu. Mamusu is 33; she was born in a village called Banta. Currently, she resides in Waterloo together with her husband and four children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. Mamusu has been a businesswoman for 12 years now. She sells rice. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy rice and palm-oil in bulk in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rice and palm-oil in bulk to expand her business

loans.name: Benkadi B Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe BENKADI B sont des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Banco ville, chef lieu de commune rurale, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, DIATOU la première  assise à droite, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,25 hectare d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché de Banco et au niveau de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the BENKADI B group are all married. They average 37 years of age and 5 children each.. 
Most of them live in polygamous families in Banco city, administrative center of the rural district, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, second administrative region of the Republic of Mali.
They work with Soro Yiriwaso, a microfinance institution, in order to be able to better organize their activity when the rainy season comes. They grow, among other things, rice and peanuts. This is the first time they collaborate with the institution.
With this loan, DIATOU, first person on the right, sitting, intends to purchase the necessary seeds, fertilizers, herbicide, and small equipment, as well as pay for plowing and weeding to maintain around 0.6 acres of peanuts.
The crops are then sold at the market in Banco and around N'Golobougou to a clientele of men and women. Their goal is an average profit of around 20 000F CFA per harvest.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicide, and small equipment, as well as pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Dek

texts.en:
Fishing is the most important part of 36-year-old Deck’s daily work. She and her husband have been living on a fishing boat on the river for more than nine years. This couple wakes up every morning, drives their boat toward the middle of the river, and then fishes. After the fishing is done, they hurry to bring their fish to the market and sell to their regular buyers on credit. They collect their money after their buyers sell all of the fish that they bought.

Dek and her husband also support their four children who are enrolled in school. 

Dek is not comfortable because her house often needs to be repaired. She would like a loan from Kiva to repair her old house. And in the future, Dek hopes that all of her children study at as high a level as they can.

She took the photo at Hattha Kaksekar Ltd.

loans.use: to repair her old house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more vegetables for sale

loans.name: Tantassama

texts.fr:
Tantassama est une femme  âgée de 40ans. Elle est mariée å un administrateur. Elle a 04 enfants
Tantassama travaille comme revendeuse de boissons depuis 2008. Elle vend à ses clients à Tokoin Wuiti. Elle achète les produits à la Brasserie de Lomé. 
Tantassama a requis son second  cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des boissons.
texts.en:
Tantassama, 40, is married to an administrator and has four children. 

Tantassama has been selling drinks since 2008. She sells to her customers in Tokoin Wuiti. She buys her products from the brewery in Lomé. 

Tantassama has requested her second loan from WAGES to use to buy drinks.

loans.use: to buy drinks.

loans.name: Benkadi C Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe BENKADI C sont toutes mariées ayant en moyenne 29 ans, 4 enfants et vivant dans des familles polygames à Banco ville, chef lieu d’une commune rurale de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, ROKIA deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché de Banco et au niveau de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten women in the Benkadi C group are all married, an average of 29 years old with 4 children, and living in polygamous families in the city of Banco, the seat of the Dioïla rural commune, in Mali’s 2nd administrative region, Koulikoro.

They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI in hopes of better organizing their business at the start of the rainy season.  The crops they work with are rice and peanuts.  This is the group’s first time working with this MFI.

Rokia, the second person from the right in the row of seated women, plans to use this loan to purchase farm inputs and small equipment, and pay costs of labor and hoeing involved to maintain about half a hectare (1.25 acres) of rice and peanuts.

After the harvest, the crops are sold from a stall in the Banco market, and also at N’Golobougou, to customers including both men and women.  The group plans on making an average profit of about 20,000 CFA francs per growing season.

loans.use: to purchase labor (including hoeing), seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and small equipment

loans.name: Peress

texts.en: She has eight (8) children. four of whom are in school. She is a married woman and a mandasi (donut) seller. She has been in this business for two years. She took a loan to purchase more flour to make mandasi to sell, with the hope of expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase more flour to make mandasi to sell

loans.name: Serious Traders Group

texts.en:
Chernoh is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Chernoh was born in the town of Port Loko, in northern Sierra Leone. He is 32 years of age. Chernoh is married to a businesswoman and the couple has two children who are attending primary schools. 

For five years now, Chernoh has been selling cosmetic and provisions. With the help of this loan, Chernoh and his team members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Chernoh will use his share of the loan (SLL 1,500,000) to expand his business by buying cosmetics and provisions in bulk to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and provisions in bulk to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr:
Akoua est une femme âgée de 38 ans. Elle est célibataire. 
Akoua travaille comme revendeuse de céréales depuis 2002. Elle vend seule à ses nombreux clients au marché de HEDZRANAWOE. Elle achète les produits à ANIE. 
Akoua a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales.
texts.en:
Akoua is a woman of 38 and single.  She has been selling cereals since 2002. She works alone, selling to her numerous customers at the market of HEDZRANAWOE. She buys her wares in ANIE. 

Akoua has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy more cereals.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover her husband's taxi license fees.

loans.name: Benkadi D Group

Avec ce premier prêt, DIARATOU, la deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,25 hectare d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché de Banco et au niveau de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000F CFA environs par campagne.

The ten women in the Benkadi D group are all married, and, on average, 35 years old with 4 children.  Most of them live in plural families in the city of Banco, the seat of the Dioïla rural commune, in Mali’s 2nd administrative region, Koulikoro.

Diaratou, the second person from the left in the row of standing women, plans to use this loan to purchase farm inputs and small equipment, and pay costs of labor involved to maintain about a quarter hectare (0.6 acres) of peanuts.

After the harvest, the crops are sold from a stall in the Banco market, and also at N’Golobougou, to customers including both men and women.  The group plans on making an average profit of about 25,000 CFA francs per growing season.

loans.use: to purchase labor, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and small equipment

loans.name: Agbessinou

texts.fr:
Agbessinou est un homme âgée de 30ans. Il est marié å une couturiere. Il a 02 enfants.
Agbessinou travaille comme revendeur de produits géneriques depuis 2006. Il vend à toutes personnes à NUKAFU. Il achète les produits à LOME et ACCRA. 
Agbessinou a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des produits génériques.
texts.en:
Agbessinou, age 30, is married to a seamstress and has two children. 

Agbessinou has been selling generic medicines since 2006. He sells to all comers at NUKAFU. He buys his generic products in LOME and ACCRA. 

Agbessinou has requested his first loan with WAGES to buy more generic medicines.

loans.use: to buy generic medicines.

loans.name: Benkadi  I Group

Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché de Banco et au niveau de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50 000F CFA environs par campagne.

They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI in hopes of better organizing their business at the start of the rainy season.  The crops they work with include rice and peanuts.  This is the group’s first time working with this MFI.

Mariam, the first person on the left in the row of standing women, plans to use this loan to purchase farm inputs and small equipment, and pay costs of labor and hoeing involved to maintain about half a hectare (1.25 acres) of rice and peanuts.

After the harvest, the crops are sold from a stall in the Banco market, and also at N’Golobougou, to customers including both men and women.  The group plans on making an average profit of about 50,000 CFA francs per growing season.

loans.use: to purchase labor (including hoeing), seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and small equipment

loans.name: Akossiwoa

texts.fr:
Akossiwoa est une femme âgée de 44 ans. Elle est mariée å un maintenancier. Elle a 02 enfants. 
Akossiwoa travaille comme revendeuse de pagnes  depuis 2008. Elle coud elle-même les habits et revend à ses clients à ADAWLATO. Elle achète les produits à LOME. Elle travaille avec 02 employé(e)s. 
Akossiwoa a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes.
texts.en: Akossiwoa is a 44-year-old woman who is married to a maintenance technician. She has two children. She has been working as a retailer of pagnes (colorful West African cloth) since 2008. She sews clothing herself and sells them to her customers in ADAWLATO. She purchases her supplies in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She works with two employees. Akossiwoa has requested her first loan cycle at WAGES in order to buy pagne cloth.

loans.use: to buy traditional cloth

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher is a 38-year-old married man, father of two children. Maher has been working in agriculture for 20 years. He has been growing bananas and citrus plants for 20 years. 

Maher is a hard-working man, and he loves his business a lot and seeks to give the best quality produce. He is well-known  in the region, and all wholesale businessmen try hard to buy all his harvest.

To stay updated in his business, Maher is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary tools and plant medicines to make sure his products are of high quality. Maher is also going to pay what's left of the price of his car. He loves his family a lot, and he works hard to keep them comfortable and satisfied. And that all happens through improving and taking good care of his business.

He hopes to buy more land and increase his harvest as much as he can, and also to buy a big truck to pick up his harvest and distribute it to wholesale businessmen.

loans.use: To buy necessary tools and plant medicines and pay off his car.

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

loans.use: to purchase labor, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and small equipment

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Ablavi est une femme  âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée å un agent de la LONATO. Elle a 04 enfants. 
Ablavi travaille comme revendeuse d’alimentations générales depuis 2003. Elle vend à ses clients à HOUNTIGOME Elle achète les produits à LOME et à ACCRA.
Ablavi a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des produits alimentaire(sucre,riz, huile végétale..).
texts.en: Ablavi is a 36-year-old woman who is married to a LONATO representative. She has four children. She has been working as retailer of grocery items since 2003. She makes her sales in HOUNTIGOME. She purchases her supplies from Lomé and from Accra. Ablavi has requested her first loan cycle at WAGES in order to buy supplies (sugar, rice, vegetable oil…)

loans.use: to buy grocery items

loans.name: Benkadi Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  femmes du groupe BENKADI III sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygames à Banco ville, chef lieu d’une commune rurale de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali, et ont une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et en moyenne 4 enfants.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, SOUMBA  première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.

The ten women in the Benkadi III group are all married, mostly in plural families, in the city of Banco, the seat of a rural commune in the Dioïla prefecture, in Mali’s 2nd administrative region, Koulikoro.  On average, they are 43 years old with 4 children.  

They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI in hopes of better organizing their business at the start of the rainy season.  The crops they work with include rice and peanuts.  This is the group’s first time working with this MFI.

Soumba, the first person on the left in the row of seated women, plans to use this loan to purchase farm inputs and small equipment, and pay costs of labor and hoeing involved to maintain about half a hectare (1.25 acres) of rice and peanuts.

After the harvest, the crops are sold from a stall in the Banco market, and also at N’Golobougou, to customers including both men and women.  The group plans on making an average profit of about 35,000 CFA francs per growing season.

loans.use: to purchase labor (including hoeing), seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and small equipment

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua makes fante kenkey (a variety of kenkey wrapped in plaintain or banana leaf, rather than maize leaves) at Benyadze near Elmina. She is currently taking care of 2 children.  As a single parent, taking care of her children has not been easy. The loan will help her buy additional bags of corn to make kenkey for distribution. She feeds, clothes and educates her children. She wishes to reinvest the new profit. In the picture above, she has some fante kenkey on a tray on her lap.

loans.use: The loan will help her buy additional bags of corn to make kenkey for distribution.
