loans.name: Benkadi V Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI V est un groupe composé de  sept membres qui tous des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 43 ans, 5 enfants et vivant dans des familles polygames à Banco ville, chef lieu d’une commune rurale de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, AWA première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,25 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché de Banco et au niveau de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20 000F CFA environs par campagne..
texts.en:
The Benkadi V solidarity group is composed of seven members, all married women who average 43 of years of age and five children each, and who live in polygamous families in Banco, the country seat of a rural town in the prefecture of Dioïla in the Koulikoro region, second administrative region of Mali.

They have partnered with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. Their crops include rice and groundnuts. This is their first time collaborating with the MFI.

With this loan, AWA, seated first from the right, plans to purchase inputs and small equipment, and pay for labor to maintain approximately 0.25 hectare of rice and groundnuts.

After the harvest, the crops are sold locally at the Banco market and in N'Golobougou to a clientele composed of both men and women. The group members intend to earn an average profit of about 20,000 FCFA per season.

loans.use: to buy inputs, seeds, and small equipment, and to  pay for labor

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is a fishmonger at Elmina. She smokes and sells fish. To smoke the fish, you go to the sea shore to buy fresh fish from the fishermen.  When you come home with the fish, you clean them. Once you drain the water from the fish, the fish will be ready to be smoked. Firewood and a traditionally-built oven are prepared to smoke the fish. The cooking time for the fish varies depending on the size of the fish and their arrangement in the oven. 
The most important thing about this process is that it is the smoke, not the fire, that cooks the fish. The smoke gives the fish its dark color. Green leaves are used as coverings for the fish to prevent the smoke from escaping into the air. The heat should also be moderate as too much heat would not allow the fish to cook properly.

Cape Coast is a town in the Central Region of Ghana that is known to be a fishing community. Most women in this region are fishmongers who supply other surrounding villages with fish.  

Ama is married to an electrician and lives together with her three children. She assists her partner to pay the utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to smoke.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua has five children. She makes "gari" (cassava couscous) and "yakeyake" for sale at Elmina. These dishes are both made from cassava. Whilst gari is made by stir-frying, "yakeyake" is steamed. (As seen in the picture above Ekua is in the process of steaming the yakeyake). 

Ekua uses her income to educate her children. She will use the loan to purchase fresh cassava to make yakeyake for sale. Ekua plans to plough back her increased profits into her business.

loans.use: to purchase fresh cassava to make "yakeyake" for sale.

loans.name: Siguitemasson I Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe SIGUITEMASSON I sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et ont en moyenne 7 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Banco ville, chef lieu de commune rurale, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, GNAFIN la personne au milieu dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The seven members of the SIGUITEMASSON I group are married women with an average age of 40 and on average seven children. They mostly live in polygamous families in Banco town,  the county seat, Dioïla prefecture,  Koulikoro region, second administrative region of Mali.

They are working with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops cultivated are, among others, rice and peanuts. They are on their first loan with Soro Yiriwaso. 

With this loan, GNAFIN, the person in the middle in the seated row, intends to buy farm inputs, small agricultural material, and pay for plowing and weeding to maintain 0.5 hectares of rice and peanuts. 

The produce is sold at the markets of Baou, Koula, Banco and N’Golobougou, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. The members of the group expect to make an average profit of 40,000 F CFA more or less per harvest.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and small agricultural material.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice is a single man who lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For the past two years, he has operated a poultry business, selling from home to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of high costs of transportation in his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the Kshs 60,000, he wants to purchase more chicks and chicken feeds. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Siguitemasson Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe SIGUITEMASSON II sont mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles polygames à Banco ville, chef lieu d’une commune rurale de la  préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce  prêt, OUMOU première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The six members of the Siguitemasson II group are all married women , on the average 33 years of age, with five children. They live in polygamous families in the town of Banco, the main locality of a rural community in Doila Prefecture, Koulikoro Region, the second administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution with the goal of better managing their work at the beginning of the winter season. They cultivate rice and peanuts [ground nuts], among others. They are on their first collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso.

With this loan, OUMOU, the first person seated on the left, plans to buy farm inputs [such as fertilizers] and small tools and pay the cost of labor to work about 0.5 ha [about 1.25 acres] of rice and peanuts.

After harvesting, the produce is sold at the markets of Baou, Koula, Banco and N’Golobougou to a customer base composed of both men and women. They group members plan to achieve an average income of 25,000 West African francs per agricultural cycle.

loans.use: to pay for labor,  seeds,  fertilizer, herbicide and small tools

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba sells provisions and fries doughnuts for sale at Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast. She lives together with her husband and four children. Her loan will be used to buy flour, sugar, oil and other ingredients that will enable her to fry doughnuts in larger quantity for sale. She hopes to build a snack bar with the new profit.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, oil and other ingredients.

loans.name: Tukolerewamu Misigi Group

texts.en:
Not by any long shot can a food sales enterprise face long odds. This kind of business invariably pays dividends provided the operating capital is available. Needless to say, diligence, perseverance and proper planning are also pivotal in helping one stay ahead of the pack. Food sales businesses are some of the most profitable in many a metropolis in Uganda.

The list of young entrepreneurs starting to bear a hand in this trade, especially in Mityana where 53-year-old Joseph plies his business, is growing. Many have found their bearings in this lucrative business and have been able to provide better welfare to their families with earnings from it. 

Joseph who is happily married with nine kids says he joined this business with pep talks and persuasion from close friends and relatives. He operates in one of the biggest and busiest food markets in Mityana. He says there have been seasons when business does not go well. This is mostly unfolding now when food prices have been going up and people's incomes are not rising. This has drastically affected many such businesses.

Joseph says monthly this business generates Uganda shillings 160,000.  He says this Kiva loan will come in handy in the purchase of more foods such as maize, potatoes and bananas to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more foods such as maize, potatoes and bananas to resell.

loans.name: Good Luck Group

texts.en:
Abibatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Abibatu was born in Makeni city, about 28 years ago. She is married to a trader and the couple has two children who are still not of school-going age. Abibatu sells palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil) and has been doing business for 10 years now. 

With the help of this loan, Abibatu and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. Abibatu will use her share of the loan (SLL 1,500,000) to buy gallons of palm oil for sale.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil for sale.

loans.name: Joy Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the “Joy” group from Waterloo, a small town near  Sierra Leone’s capital city, Freetown. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL  4,100,000. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Aminata is the leader of this group. The 43-year-old is married to a businessman and they have five children. Aminata has been a businesswoman for more than 20 years now; she sells locally made soap called “Africana”, palm oil, etc.  With her share of this loan, she will buy a large quantity of palm oil in order to expand her business.  

(Also included on the left of the photo is loan officer Edna B. Conteh handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of palm oil.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 33 years old and married to Grace. They are blessed with two children, aged two and six. He owns a bakery and has been operating for the past twelve years, making a monthly profit of KES10,000. He has been loaned KES 80,000 with which he plans to open a new retail shop.

With the anticipated profit, he plans to expand his business and save for the future in order to educate his children.

He hopes in the future to venture into a boutique business, especially selling shoes and clothes.

loans.use: to open a new retail shop.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells different types of frozen meat, fish, and chicken in Elmina, Ghana. She is separated from her husband and has one child. Her husband provides assistance to help care for their child. Her loan will be used to buy additional fresh meat and fish to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy an additional refrigerator.

loans.use: to buy additional fresh meat and fish

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is divorced and has four children. Priscilla bakes pastries and bread in Elmina, Ghana, an activity that she has done for some time now. She uses her income for the care of her home and family. She will use the loan to purchase flour, sugar, oil, and yeast to bake bread on a larger scale for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Priscilla plans to reinvest back into the business.

The picture above is currently showing some of the kneaded dough that has to rise before it can be baked.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, oil, and yeast to bake bread on a larger scale

loans.name: Abrewa

texts.en: Abrewa processes palm oil and palm kernel oil in Elmina, in the Central Region of Ghana. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a mason. With the assistance of her spouse, school fees and utility bills are paid. Her loan will be used to buy palm fruits, from which she will make palm oil. She will also use the nuts for palm kernel oil. She anticipates reinvesting the additional profit back into her business.

loans.use: to buy palm fruits to make palm oil and palm kernel oil.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells fruits, onions, tomatoes, and cassava at Elmina. She is a widow and has six children. She responsibly feeds, clothes, and educates her children. Her loan will be used to acquire different kinds of fruits to resell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for their children.

loans.use: to acquire different kinds of fruits to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more crates of beer, sodas and spirits to resell at her pub.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa sells gari and palm oil at Elmina. The picture above depicts Adjoa standing close to the gallons she uses to store the palm oil. She has five children. Her husband is a farmer. She sees to the well-being of the home. Her loan will be used to buy palm fruits to make oil for distribution. Her future plan towards her business is to buy land.

loans.use: to buy palm fruits to make oil for distribution.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 53 years old and married to Jane. They have four school-going children. He has been in the carpentry business for 11 years, making a monthly profit of KES 15,000. He has been loaned KES 70,000, which he plans to use to purchase more timber to sell.

With the anticipated profit made, he plans to educate his children to higher levels and to expand his business.

He hope to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more timber to sell

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI 1 sont des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles polygame à Konfon, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce premier prêt, AWA première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Klè, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 60 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 1solidarity group are married women who average 41 of years of age and five children each. They live in polygamous families in Konfon, a village in the rural town of Banco, prefecture of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of Mali).

They have partnered with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. Their crops include rice and groundnuts. This is their first time collaborating with the MFI.

With this loan, AWA, standing first from the left, plans to purchase inputs and small equipment, and pay for the labor and weeding needed to maintain approximately 0.50 hectare of rice and groundnuts.

After the harvest, the crops are sold at the markets of Klè, Banco and N'Golobougou to a clientele composed of both men and women. The group members intend to earn an average profit of about 60,000 FCFA per season.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and small equipment, and to pay for labor and weeding

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose has five children. Three of the children are in school. She is a married woman.  She sells tomatoes, eggs and okra. She has been in this business for one year. The loan will be used to purchase more tomatoes for sale.

loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice sells wakye (rice and beans cooked together) at Elmina. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a mason. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy beans and rice to cook wakye for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a restaurant.

Wakye is a traditional rice dish in Ghana. To prepare wakye, she gets her beans, rice, and colored leaves from the market. She cooks the beans until they become tender and adds the colored leaves to give them a reddish color. Then, she adds the rice to the bean mixture. She cooks the rice and beans until they become tender to eat. Wakye is normally eaten with macaroni, wele (cow skin), gari, salad with pepper sauce, tomatoes sauce, fish, or meat.

loans.use: to buy beans and rice to cook wakye for resale.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  femmes du groupe BENKADI 2 sont toutes mariées, qui ont  une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles polygames à Konfon, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, SITAN NADJOLA, la première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout, compte  acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour  et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Klè, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of Benkadi 2 Group ("harmony") are married women who, on average, are 42 years old and have five children. They all live in polygamous families in Konfon, one of the villages in the rural municipality of Banco, prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of Mali). They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to deal more efficiently with their activities when the winter season begins. They grow, among other products, rice and groundnuts. This is their first loan with the institution.

Sitan Nadjola, the first woman standing at the left-hand side of the photo, intends to use her loan to buy agricultural supplies and tools and pay for plowing and weeding. She has around 0.5 hectares of farmland to grow rice and groundnuts. The harvested products will be sold at the markets in Klè, Banco and N'Golobougou to a clientele made up of men and women. The group members expect to make an average profit of around 40,000 CFA francs per season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and weeding, and to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and tools.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama operates a chop bar (a place where different types of food are cooked for sale) at Elmina. She cooks food such as fufu with palm nut soup, banku, kokonte, and rice. She is married to a farmer and has two children. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs to cook. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a better place where her customers can relax to eat.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs to cook.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 35 years old and single with one child. She runs a school. It has been in operation for four years, making a monthly profit of KES 5,800. She has been loaned KES 40,000, which she plans to use to build one more classroom.

With the anticipated profit, she plans to expand the school in the near future. She hopes to build her school up to class eight since it has only classes 1 through 4.

loans.use: To build one more classroom

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 21 years old and single. She runs a salon. Her business has been in operation for three years.

She has been a KADET client and this is her third loan to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to purchase more combs, shampoos and a variety of hair products for her business. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand her business. Her dream is to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: to purchase more combs, shampoos and a variety of hair products

loans.name: Ozyuma

texts.en: She has six children, four of whom are in school. She is a married woman. Ozyuma sells shoes and charcoal. She has been in this business for two years now. She borrowed a loan from BRAC South Sudan with hopes of expanding her business. She will use the profit for her business and to pay for school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and shoes to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 36 years old and married. She runs a food cafe, a business that has been in operation for 12 years. She has been a KADET client and this is her second loan to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to purchase maize meal, wheat flour, sugar, salt, cooking oil and vegetables for her business. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand her business. Her dream is to own a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase maize meal, wheat flour, sugar, salt, cooking oil and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and rent more shambas (plots of land)

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a single woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent.

For the past one year, she has operated a cosmetics shop business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of theft and insecurity. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and soaps for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and soaps for resale.

loans.name: Blanca Lucila

texts.es:
Blanca Lucila tiene 47 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres e hijo de 20 años en el Cantón Chillanes, Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C NUEVE DE ABRIL, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia  San José del Tambo, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz y cacao.

Blanca se dedica al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas. El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar la calidad de su producto. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño es tener una casa propia.

Le gusta jugar escuchar música y realizar labores domésticas.
texts.en:
Blanca Lucila is 47 years old. She is single and lives with her parents and 20 year-old son in the Chillanes canton, in Bolivar province.  The "La Nueve de Abril" (9th of April) village bank is located in the parish of San José del Tambo, in the Chillanes canton. The members of this group are farmers, and grow mainly corn and cacao.  

Blanca grows corn and cacao.  She buys and sells her products in the market of San José del Tambo.  She is applying for the loan to buy seeds, and agricultural inputs.  The loan will help her meet her financial needs, and improve the quality of her product.  The challenges she faces are drops in prices of the products she sells and the middlemen. Her dream is to have her own house. She enjoys listening to music and doing housework.

loans.use: To buy seeds and agricultural inputs

loans.name: Marknaf

texts.en:
Marknaf is 31 years old and married to Christine. They have two-school going children. He has been running a clinic for the last seven years, making a monthly profit of KES 30,000. He has been loaned KES 20,000, which he plans to use to purchase more drugs. With the anticipated, he plans to educate his children to higher levels of education.

In the future, he hopes to expand his business and educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase more drugs for the clinic

loans.name: Mwanaiki

texts.en:
Mwanaiki is a married woman with a child who is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and running water and her greatest monthly expense is food. For the past two years, Mwanaiki has operated a business selling lessos and kikois (traditional African cloth wraps) from home to neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is seasonality. 

Mwanaiki is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase bundles of kikois to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. In the future, she dreams of establishing a retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase kikois (traditional cloth wraps) to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase handbags and clothes to sell

loans.name: Mwanauba

texts.en:
Mwanauba is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and running water and her greatest monthly expense is school fees. For the past six years, she has operated a clothing business and she sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Mwanauba’s major business challenge is theft due to the insecurity of her area of operation. 

Mwanauba is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase bundles of clothing to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. In the future, Mwanauba dreams of having a formal store and business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Celso Ismael

texts.es:
Celso Ismael tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus padres en el Cantón Chillanes, Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C NUEVE DE ABRIL, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia  San José del Tambo, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz y cacao.

Celso se dedica al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos y fertilizantes. El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar la calidad de sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño es tener una casa propia.

Le gusta jugar vóley.
texts.en:
Celso Ismael, 28, is single living with his parents in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “Nueve de Abril” (April 9) communal bank is located in San José del Tambo Parish belonging to Chillanes Canton.  The members of this communal bank are primarily corn and cocoa bean farmers.

Celso is a corn and cocoa bean farmer.  His purchases and his sales take place at the San José del Tambo market.

He is asking for a loan to buy seeds, manure and fertilizer.  The loan will serve as support to meet his economic needs and improve the quality of his agricultural products.  He faces challenges like the drop in price of the products he sells as well as middlemen.  His dream is to own a house of his own.  He enjoys playing volleyball.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat and fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn to make banku (corn dough)

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is divorced and has six children. She makes a living by selling palm oil, spices, canned tomatoes and other food items. For a long time now, she has lived in the town of Abura, and uses all of her earnings to clothe, feed and educate her children. She is applying for this loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. Her goal for the future is to build a better shop.

loans.use: to buy more food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Gloria Ignacia

texts.es:
Gloria Ignacia tiene 55 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres e hijos de 20 y 24 años en el Cantón Chillanes, Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C NUEVE DE ABRIL, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia  San José del Tambo, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz y cacao.

Gloria se dedica al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y abonos. El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar la calidad de sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño es tener una finca.

Le gusta jugar caminar y realizar labores domésticas.
texts.en: Gloria Ignacia is 55 and lives with her parents and children (ages 20 and 24) in Chillanes, Bolívar Province, Ecuador.  The communal lender V.R.C Nueve de Abril is located in San José del Tambo, Chillanes, and its borrowers are engaged in agriculture, principally growing corn and cacao.  Gloria also raises corn and cacao, which she sells in the market in San José del Tambo.  She seeks this credit to buy crop seed and fertilizer.  The funds will also help her to meet expenses and to improve her crop quality for market.   She confronts challenges such as unstable crop prices and high costs of intermediaries.  She hopes one day to own her own farm.  She enjoys taking walks and household activities.

loans.use: to buy crop seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama owns the grocery store we see here. She is married to a farmer and the mother of seven children. The items she sells in her store include soap, spaghetti, cooking oil and milk. Ama started her business three years ago, and she and her husband combine their incomes to support their family.  She is applying for this loan to expand her business and buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell to her customers..

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar and vegetables in bulk to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bundles of maize flour, wheat flour and sugar.

loans.name: Luis Marcelino

Luis Marcelino tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus padres en el Cantón Chillanes, Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C NUEVE DE ABRIL, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia  San José del Tambo, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz y cacao.

Luis se dedica al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y abonos para sus cultivos. El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar la calidad de sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño es trabajar con capital propio.

Luis Marcelino, 28, is single.  He lives with his parents in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “Nueve de Abril” (April 9) communal bank is located in San José del Tambo Parish belonging to Chillanes Canton.  Its members are primarily corn and cocoa bean farmers.

Luis is a corn and cocoa bean farmer.  His purchases and sales take place in the San José del Tambo market.

He requests the loan to buy seeds and manure for his crops.  The loan will serve as support to meet his economic needs and to improve the quality of his farming activities.  He faces challenges like the drop in price of products he sells as well as middlemen.  His dream is to work with his own capital.  He enjoys playing volleyball.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure for his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more eggs to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Bugembe Katwe Women's Group

texts.en:
If there is any business which has grown in popularity in the last five years or so, it has to be rentals. Many people are taking a liking for this business because one is assured of money from rent payments from tenants at the end of every month. This business is mostly a roaring trade in the urban areas where many people are moving. Currently, however, many of the individuals involved in this kind of business have been grumbling about a recently introduced property tax that they have to pay each month. Most of the landlords are facing a scenario where many clients are looking for cheaper options given the tough economic status quo.

George, 61 years old, has been in the rentals business for the past 17 years. He says most of them have been looking for a quick fix for the problems they face but to little avail. George, a down-to-earth father of six, says, despite that, many landlords like himself are still able to live within the ways and means of their businesses. Seventeen years of experience in this business have taught George much about how to be successful. He says he banked on savings from his farming business to take root in the business. On the side, George also ekes out additional income from a modest mattress sales enterprise that he began seven years ago.

Monthly, George says his business generates him income to the tune of 300,000 Ugandan shillings. He says that he intends to utilize this Kiva loan to purchase bags of cement, sand and other construction materials for the construction of two self-contained rooms for rent in Jinja, in the east of Uganda in East Africa.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement, sand and other construction materials for the construction of two self-contained rooms for rent in Jinja.

loans.name: Maria Luzmila

texts.es:
María Luzmila tiene 32 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres  e hijo de 12 años en el Cantón Chillanes, Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C NUEVE DE ABRIL, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia  San José del Tambo, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz y cacao.

María se dedica al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y abonos para sus cultivos. El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar la calidad de sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño es que su hijo culmine sus estudios.

Le gusta realizar labores domésticas.
texts.en:
María Luzmila, 32, is single.  She lives with her parents and her 12-year-old son in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “Nueve de Abril” (April 9) communal bank is located in San José del Tambo Parish belonging to Chillanes Canton.  Its members are primarily corn and cocoa bean farmers.

María is a corn and cocoa bean farmer.  Her purchases and sales take place in the San José del Tambo market.

She requests the loan to buy seeds and manure for her crops.  The loan will serve as support to meet her economic needs and to improve the quality of her farming activities.  She faces challenges like the drop in price of products she sells as well as middlemen.  Her dream is that her son finishes his schooling.  She enjoys doing housework.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure for her crops.

loans.name: Mwatsuma

texts.en:
Mwatsuma is a married man with two children: one girl and one boy. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and food. For the past four years, he has been selling fish at the market to his neighbours and passersby. He dreams of establishing another business selling shoes in the future.

With this loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase bundles of shoes for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El  Señor Mario  de  32 años de edad, estado civil soltero pero convive con su pareja, vive en casa de sus suegros,  trabaja con su vehículo como taxi  desde hace 4 años para mantener su familia. Su pareja la Sra. Eynny  le ayuda con los gastos vendiendo sodas en su casa. Don Mario  se vio en la necesidad de solicitar crédito de nuestra institución debido a que necesitaba comprar un motor para su vehículo. El cuenta con un buen historial de deuda, actualmente no posee otra deuda en ninguna institución, es cliente antiguo, es una persona muy trabajadora con ganas de superación agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mario, 32, is single but lives with his partner in his in-laws’ house.  He has been using his car as a taxi for the last four years to support his family.  His partner is Eynny and she helps cover expenses selling soft-drinks at home.

Mario needed to request a loan from our institution because he needed to buy an engine for his car.  He has a good credit history and currently has no debts in any institution.  He’s a longstanding client and a very hardworking person who very much wants to get ahead and who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy a car engine and to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio, es casado, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 36, 39 y 40 años de edad, cada uno tiene su propio hogar, él se dedica a la tapicería  de muebles de madera y de vehículos, lleva 21 años dedicándose al negocio, trabaja todos los días de 7:00am  a 3:00pm.
Actualmente el necesita comprar telas, pinturas, pegamento, para tapizar, por lo que le es necesario un préstamo que le solvente esta compra, con ello estará obteniendo los materiales para poder continuar brindando el servicio.
La aspiración de Sergio, es tener una tapicería con mayor capacidad, con buen servicio y que sea rentable para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sergio is married living with his wife.  He has three children who are 36, 39 and 40 years old; each has their own house.  He upholsters wood furniture and cars.  He’s been in business 21 years and works every day from 7am until 3pm.

At present, he needs to buy fabric, paint and glue to upholster so he needs a loan to pay for this purchase.  With it he will be acquiring the materials needed to continue providing this service.

Sergio’s hope is to have a larger upholstery shop providing good service so that it will be profitable and improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, paint and glue to upholster.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Jose Orlando

texts.es:
José Orlando tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus padres en el Cantón Chillanes, Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C NUEVE DE ABRIL, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia  San José del Tambo, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz y cacao.

José se dedica al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo.

Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño es tener una casa propia.

Le gusta jugar vóley.
texts.en:
José Orlando is 26 years old and single.  He lives with his parents in the Chillanes canton in the province of Bolívar.   

The communal bank Nueve de Abril is located in the San José del Tambo parish in the Chillanes canton.  The members of this bank work in agriculture and grow mainly corn and cocoa. 

José grows corn and cocoa.  He is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for his crops.  The loan will help support his financial needs and improve the quality of his agricultural activities.  The challenges he faces are falling prices of the products he sells and the middlemen. 

His dream is to have his own home.  He likes to play volleyball.

loans.use: purchase seeds and fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.es:
Timoteo, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 12, 14 y 16 años de edad, él es agricultor se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol, tiene casi 25 años de estar en esta actividad, este trabajo lo aprendió por su padre.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono y pesticidas, con estos materiales podrá dar un cuido adecuado para producir abundantemente, sirviéndole estos materiales para garantizar dicha cosecha.
Su objetivo es proveer para sus hijos todo lo necesario, dándoles la alimentación y educación necesaria para poder mejorar su futuro.
texts.en:
Timoteo lives with his wife and three children who are 12, 14 and 16 years old.  He’s a farmer growing corn and beans.  He’s been in this line of work for almost 25 years.  He learned this occupation from his father.

He is asking for the loan to buy manure and pesticides.  He will be able to provide adequate care to produce abundantly with these supplies; they will guarantee such a harvest.

His goal is to provide everything necessary for his children, providing them with food and the necessary education to be able to improve their future.

loans.use: to buy manure and pesticides.

loans.name: Jose Arnulfo

Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño es comprarse una finca.

Le gusta jugar vóley.

The “Nueve de Abril” (April 9) communal bank is located in San José del Tambo Parish belonging to Chillanes Canton.  The members are primarily corn and cocoa bean farmers.

José is a corn and cocoa bean farmer.  His purchases and his sales take place in the San José del Tambo market.

He requests the loan to buy seeds and manure for his crops.  The loan will serve as support to meet his economic needs and improve the quality of his agricultural activities.  He faces challenges like the drop in price of the products he sells as well as middlemen.  His dream is to buy a farm.  He enjoys playing volleyball.

loans.name: Nduku

texts.en: N. is 25, and together with her husband Daniel they have a 2-year-old child.  N. has been in the curio business for four years, making a monthly profit of KES.49,600.  She has been loaned KES.70,000, and she plans to use the proceeds to add more necklaces, earrings, bangles, and other miscellaneous items.  With the anticipated profits she plans to add inventory and own her own curio shop.

loans.use: To purchase necklaces, earrings, bangles, and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: David

texts.es: El  Señor David  de  46 años de edad, estado civil soltero, vive en casa de su tía,  realiza todo tipo de trabajos, referentes a la electricidad, como cableados, colocación de interruptores, conexiones de ventiladores  desde hace 20 años, esto lo hace de forma ambulante o por contratos en obras, para mantener su familia. Don David   se vio en la necesidad de solicitar crédito de nuestra institución debido a la demanda que se le  presenta actualmente el comprara con el dinero taladro, perforador, cables, tubos, interruptores. El cuenta con un buen historial de deuda, actualmente no posee otra deuda en ninguna institución, es cliente nuevo y cuenta con domicilio conocido ubicado al  este de nuestra ciudad, razón por la cual no se le negó dicho crédito ya que es una persona muy trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Señor David is 46 years old, single and lives in his aunt's house.  He has been working as an electrician for the past 20 years and does all types of jobs such as wiring, installing switches and fan connections.  He does this in an itinerant manner or by work contract to support his family.  

Don David found it necessary to request a loan from our institution because of his current demand.  He will buy a drill, a punch, cables, conduit, and switches.  He has a good credit history and currently does not have any outstanding debt with any other institution.   He is a new customer and has a known address on the east side of our city.  He was not denied credit since he is a very hard-working person.  He is grateful to the institution for the support given.

loans.use: purchase a drill, a punch, cable, conduit, and switches.

loans.name: Ines Cordero

texts.es:
Inés, tiene dos hijos de 26 y 31 años de edad, él administra una tienda, dicho negocio lo tiene desde hace 10 años, lo inicio junto a su esposa y juntos lo atienden todos los días de la semana de 7:00am a 3:00pm, este negocio lo tienen en el mercado municipal.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de aceite, arroz, frijoles, jabón y detergentes, su propósito es mejorar el negocio, surtirlo de productos que le ayuden a satisfacer la demanda y le provea mayores ingresos.
Su objetivo es mejorar la condición económica de su familia, cubriendo los gastos que se generan y encaminarse hacia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Inés has two children aged 26 and 31.  He manages a store, which he says is a business he has had for 10 years.  He started it with his wife, and together they serve in the store every day of the week from 7:00 am-3: 00pm.  This business is located in the municipal market.

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of oil, rice, beans, soap and detergents.  His intent is to grow the business, stocking it with products that will help him to meet demand and provide greater income.

His goal is to improve economic conditions for his family, covering the expenses generated and to move towards a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, beans, soap and detergents.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 30, and together with his wife Monica, they are blessed with a child.  Joseph owns a butcher shop where he slaughters bulls for sale.  He has been in this business for the last six years and earns an income of KES.15,000 per month.

Joseph is applying for his second loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD, and he plans to buy bulls for slaughter and sale.  He will use the anticipated profits to invest in his business and help give his child access to education.  Joseph hopes to have fresh meat everyday, and a wonderful family free from poverty.

loans.use: To buy bulls for slaughter and sale.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
Rosa, se dedica a la venta de comida, es madre soltera de un joven de 30 años, ella se dedica desde hace 14 años a la venta de alimentos, trabaja todos los días de la semana de 5:00am a 3:00pm, aprendió por su madre y hoy en día es la única fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta.
Quiere comprar de un préstamo la mercadería que se utiliza a diario para elaborar los platillos, como arroz, pollo, carne, aceite, gas propano, con la inversión garantizara sus ventas para un buen periodo, sirviéndole para fortalecer y abastecer la demanda.
El propósito de ella es que su negocio tenga vida por un largo plazo, por eso recurre a los préstamos para poder cubrir el gasto en mercadería y tener mayor disponibilidad.
texts.en:
Rosa sells food.  She’s a single mother of a 30-year-old young man.  She’s been selling food for the last 14 years.  She works every day of the week from 5am until 3pm.  She learned from her mother and today this is her only source of income.

She wants to use the loan to buy merchandise she uses every day to prepare her dishes like: rice, chicken, meat, oil and propane gas.  This investment will guarantee sales for a good period of time helping her strengthen and meet demand.

Her goal is that her business stays alive for a long time and this is why she calls on loans to cover costs of merchandise to have more available.

loans.use: to buy rice, chicken, meat, oil and propane gas.

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul started his El Paso, Texas-based body shop, A.R.C. Express Auto and Body Paint, because he wanted to provide reliable service to his community while providing secure employment to its hard-working members. Before opening his shop, Raul worked as the manager of the paint department at a large auto shop. However, after being forced to lay off many of the employees under his charge, Raul decided to go out on his own. 

A.R.C. Express Auto opened in September 2010 and offers its customers any auto body service from dent repair to complete paint jobs. Raul used his 10 years of experience, including time working with the U.S. Army, to start the business. He hired and receives ongoing support from three of the employees laid off by his old employer, including an old manager who helps Raul estimate paint and labor costs. 

Raul says his biggest success to date has been keeping the business open and successful while navigating a confusing city-permit process, which nearly led to the close of his shop. Of this, he says, “In order to keep your business legal, you need to get the right city permits. I would call in and get a different answer from each person regarding these permits. Ultimately, I had to pay someone to figure it out for me because I couldn’t start the shop and engage in that process at the same time.”  Since he started the shop with his personal finances, he said that the strain caused by this added necessity nearly forced him to shut down the business.

However, his loan from Kiva partner ACCION Texas-Louisiana helped Raul overcome this difficulty. He used the loan to make payroll, pay for paint and supplies, and pay off a mortgage on some land, which has since been sold and the money brought back to his business. Without the loan, Raul says, “I would have had to shut down the shop. ACCION Texas helped me see the options available to me.”

In the future, Raul hopes to stay true to his community-oriented business policy. He says, “My goal is to hire some disabled veterans and people with disabilities and give back to the community. My goal is not to get rich; I want to give people a workplace where they come in, enjoy what they do, and go home happy.”  He says that one day he hopes to open another establishment, such as a dance hall, that community organizations can use at an affordable price for recreational functions.

After nearly a year in business, Raul offers the following advice to aspiring business owners: “Make sure you do your homework, and, most importantly, make sure you engage with your customers and the people who affect your business face-to-face.”  With this loan, Raul was able to overcome the initial challenges of opening his business. Now, he can continue to give members of his community a secure job that provides reliable, quality services to the residents of El Paso.

loans.use: to make payroll, pay for supplies and pay off the remaining mortgage on his land

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI 3 sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygame à  Konfon, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce premier prêt, MAIMOUNA, la deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Klè, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 60 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of Benkadi 3 Group ("harmony") are married women who, on average, are 35 years old and have five children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Konfon, one of the villages in the rural municipality of Banco, prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of Mali). They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to deal more efficiently with their activities when the winter season begins. They grow, among other products, rice and groundnuts. This is their first loan with the institution.

Maïmouna, the second woman sitting at the right-hand side of the photo, intends to use her loan to buy agricultural supplies and tools and pay for plowing and weeding. She has around 0.5 hectares of farmland to grow rice and groundnuts. The harvested products will be sold at the markets in Klè, Banco and N'Golobougou to a clientele made up of men and women. Maïmouna expects to make an average profit of around 60,000 CFA francs per season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and weeding, and to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and tools.

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en:
Bibi is a married woman with four children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is the high cost of transportation.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a business selling goat meat, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge othe high cost of transportation in her business. Bibi dreams of purchasing a pick up van to transport the goat meat in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase young goats and fatten them for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase young goats and fatten them for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials for replacing the roof of his house.

loans.name: Flavio Eleodoro

loans.name: Mirna De La Paz

texts.es:
Mirna, es comerciante D. ropa y prendas D. oro, es casada, vive con su esposo y tres hijos D. 12, 16 y 9 años D. edad, el negocio lo atienD. desD. hace 8 años, lo fundaron junto a su esposo, trabaja D. 7:00am a 5:00pm.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. blusas, short, ropa interior para niños y adultos, esta solicitud se debe a  la necesidad D. mantener en el negocio la suficiente mercadería, para atender las demandas D. los clientes.
Para ella su principal objetivo es trabajar por sus hijos, cubrir sus gastos D. educación, y apoyarlos para que puedan tener mejores oportunidades D. desarrollo.
texts.en:
Mirna sells clothes and gold jewelry, is married, and lives with her husband and three children, ages 12, 16, and 9.  For 8 years she has tended to the business which she founded with her husband.  She works from 7:00am to 5:00pm.
She requests a loan to buy blouses, shorts, and underwear for children and adults.  This request is due to the need to maintain sufficient merchandise for her customer’s demands.
For her, the main objective is to work for her children, cover their educational expenses, and support them so that they may have better opportunities for development.

loans.use: To buy blouses, shorts, and underwear for children and adults.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José Luis tiene 52 años de edad, es casado, vive con su esposa e hijos de 2, 15 y 16 años  en el Cantón Chillanes, Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C NUEVE DE ABRIL, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia  San José del Tambo, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz y cacao.

José se dedica al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para sus cultivos. El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar la calidad de sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño que sus hijos sean profesionales.

Le gusta jugar vóley.
texts.en:
José Luis, 52, is married and lives with his wife and children of two, 15 and 16 years of age in the Chillanes hamlet, province of Bolívar. 

The Nueve de Abril [April 9th] communal bank is located the San José de Tambo parish belonging to the Chillanes hamlet. The members of this group work in agriculture, primarily the cultivation of corn and cocoa.  

José is a corn and cocoa farmer. He buys and sells his products in the San José de Tambo market. 

He is seeking the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers for his crops. The loan will help him supply his economic necessities and improve the quality of his farming business. He faces challenges such as falling prices in the products he sells, as well as the intermediaries. His dream is that his children would be professionals. 

He likes to play volleyball.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI 4 est constitué de dix femmes mariées  qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 5 enfants et qui vivent majoritairement dans des familles polygame à Konfon, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, SITANI, la deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Klè, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of Benkadi 4 Group ("harmony") are married women who, on average, are 42 years old and have five children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Konfon, one of the villages in the rural municipality of Banco, prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of Mali). They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to deal more efficiently with their activities when the winter season begins. They grow, among other products, rice and groundnuts. This is their first loan with the institution.

Sitani, the second woman sitting at the right-hand side of the photo, intends to use her loan to buy agricultural supplies and tools and pay for plowing and weeding. She has around 0.5 hectares of farmland to grow rice and groundnuts. The harvested products will be sold at the markets in Klè, Banco and N'Golobougou to a clientele made up of men and women. The group members expect to make an average profit of around 40,000 CFA francs per season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and weeding, and to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and tools.

loans.name: Nshigikira Group

texts.fr:
Alphonsine est une commerçante âgée de 36ans qui habite au centre du pays dans la ville de Gitega. C’est une vendeuse des habits et souliers depuis 3ans. Elle a fréquentée l’école jusqu’en 3année primaire. Elle est mariée a Tharcisse et ils n’ont pas d’enfant. 
Le crédit Kiva  de 120,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités d’habits et souliers à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« NSHIGIKIRA»
texts.en:
Alphonsine is a 36-year-old merchant living in Gitega, a town in central Burundi. She has been selling clothes and shoes for three years. She attended elementary school until third grade. She is married to Tharcisse and they have no children. Alphonsine will use her loan of 120,000 Burundi francs provided through Kiva to buy large quantities of clothes and shoes for resale. She expects to make a good profit.

Alphonsine is a member of Nshigikira Community Group.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy large quantities of clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Vilma Flora

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Vamos Juntas” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco.  Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las nuevas siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

En el lugar conocimos a la señora Vilma que nació en la ciudad de Huancayo (Perú), tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos, y nos cuenta:

“Actualmente, Yo vivo en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizo mis actividades económicas, Yo me dedico a la elaboración de productos lácteos como por ejemplo yogurt y manjar junto con mi amiga Karen. Ya es un año que me dedico a este negocio y me va muy bien. También me dedico a la venta de cosméticos en mis horas libres. Yo requiero el crédito para comprar cosméticos. Mi sueño es construir mi casa por la zona sur de la ciudad del Cusco”.
texts.en:
The communal bank Vamos Juntas [Let's Go Together] meets every month in the city of Cusco. Cusco is known for being a heavily touristed area with a lot of commercial activity, and for its traditional Inti Raymi festivities, as well as for having one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu. 

In this place we met Ms. Vilma who was born in the city of Huancayo, Peru. She is 40 years old, married, and has from that union three children. She tells us "Currently I live in the city of Cusco where I carry out my business activities. I devote myself to making dairy products such as, for example, yogurt and caramelized sweet milk with my friend Karen. I have been in this business for one year now and it is going very well. I also sell cosmetics in my free time. I need the loan to buy cosmetics. My dream is to build my house in the area south of the city of Cusco."

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI 5 est un regroupement de dix  membres  qui des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et  en moyenne 6 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Konfon, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce premier prêt, FATOUMATA la personne au milieu dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Klè, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of Benkadi 5 Group ("harmony") are married women who, on average, are 39 years old and have six children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Konfon, one of the villages in the rural municipality of Banco, prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of Mali). They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to deal more efficiently with their activities when the winter season begins. They grow, among other products, rice and groundnuts. This is their first loan with the institution.

Fatoumata, standing in the middle of the photo, intends to use her loan to buy agricultural supplies and tools and pay for plowing and weeding. She has around 0.5 hectares of farmland to grow rice and groundnuts. The harvested products will be sold at the markets in Klè, Banco and N'Golobougou to a clientele made up of men and women. The group members expect to make an average profit of around 25,000 CFA francs per season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and weeding, and to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and tools.

loans.name: Urunani Group

texts.fr:
Félicité est une commerçante  âgée de 41 ans . Elle habite à la Colline Mugutu en province de Gitega.  Elle vend la farine de manioc depuis 10 ans. Elle a fait les études jusqu’au niveau du primaire. Elle est mariée  à Joseph qui est chauffeur et  ils ont 6 enfants dont 5 étudient. 
Le crédit de Kiva de 120000 Fbu va lui permettre  d’augmenter  le capital  afin d’acheter beaucoup  de stock de farine à revendre pour réaliser  de grands bénefices. 
Elle est membre du groupe communautaire  “URUNANI”
texts.en:
Félicité is a 41-year-old merchant living on Mugutu Hill in the province of Gitega. She has been selling cassava flour for ten years. She attended elementary school. She is married to Joseph, a driver, and they have six children, with five of them attending school. Félicité will use her loan of 120,000 Burundi francs provided through Kiva to buy large quantities of flour for resale. She expects to make a good profit.

Félicité is a member of Urunani Community Group.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy large quantities of cassava flour for resale.

loans.name: Alba Jackeline

texts.en:
Alba is a hard-working and entrepreneurial 26-year-old single mother. She was born in Moraspungo, a small town in the Cotopaxi province. She lives with her child. Without any external economic support, her life as a single mother has been hard, but she has persevered, and now owns her own snack stall called "El Clasico Snack."

Alba lives and works in Latacunga, a plateau town of Ecuador, the capital of the Cotopaxi Province. Latacunga is known for its chilly weather and the presence of nearby Volcano Cotopaxi, an active volcano that has repeatedly damaged the city during eruptions.

This is Alba's first Kiva loan. She will use it to buy cooking utensils and food for her snack stall, which she runs by herself. She makes and sells french fries, coffee, and "bolones de verde," a traditional Ecuadorian dish made of mashed green bananas and varying types of meat. Since she was little, her mother and sister helped her learn to cook. She works five or six hours a day and hopes that by increasing her working hours and through her loan with Kiva and Fundación Alternativa, she can increase her income and her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils and food for "El Clasico Snack" stall

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto, vive con sus hijos y su esposa, se dedica a brindar servicio de taxi, tiene casi 6 años de estar brindando este servicio, trabaja todos los días de 5:00am a 7:00pm, surgió por iniciativa propia y ya cuenta con clientes frecuentes.
El está solicitando un préstamo para dar mantenimiento al taxi, ya que debe llevarlo al mecánico a reparar el sistema eléctrico, luego el cambio de placas, que significa incurrir en gastos, este préstamo le ayudara para tener en buenas condiciones el vehículo y trabajar con mayores seguridad.
La aspiración de Rigoberto es que su familia tenga una vida estable en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Rigoberto lives with his children and wife and devotes himself to providing taxi services. He has been providing this service for almost six years and works every day from 5 a.m. until 7 p.m. He started in the business by his own initiative and now has regular customers. 

He is seeking a loan to provide maintenance to the taxi, since he must take it to a mechanic to have the electrical system repaired, and then to have the plates changed which means more expense. This loan will help him keep his vehicle in good condition and so work more comfortably and safely. 

Robert's aspires to give his family a stable life in better conditions.

loans.use: to pay a mechanic to repair the electrical system of his vehicle.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a divorced woman with one child who graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a juice-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major dream is to establish a juice parlor in the future.

With the KSHS 10,000, she wants to purchase bundles of fruits for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of fruit to sell

loans.name: Benkadi 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe BENKADI 6 sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et ont en moyenne 6 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Konfon, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, A. T. deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,25 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Klè, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of Benkadi 6 Group ("harmony") are married women who, on average, are 38 years old and have six children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Konfon, one of the villages in the rural municipality of Banco, prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of Mali). They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to deal more efficiently with their activities when the winter season begins. They grow, among other products, rice and groundnuts. This is their first loan with the institution.

A. T., the second woman sitting at the right-hand side of the photo, intends to use her loan to buy agricultural supplies and tools and pay for plowing and weeding. She has around 0.25 hectares of farmland to grow rice and groundnuts. The harvested products will be sold at the markets in Klè, Banco and N'Golobougou to a clientele made up of men and women. The group members expect to make an average profit of around 20,000 CFA francs per season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and weeding, and to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and tools.

loans.name: Time

texts.en:
Time is a widowed woman with four children, all of whom are adults. She lives in a house that she owns. It has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a shoes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is theft because of insecurity in her area of operation. She dreams of selling more shoes in the future.

With the KSHS 10,000, she wants to purchase bundles of shoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of shoes to sell

loans.name: Benkadi 7 Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq  membres du groupe BENKADI 7 sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et en moyenne 6 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles polygames à Konfon, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, KOROTOUMOU première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,25 hectare d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Klè, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The five members of Benkadi 7 Group ("harmony") are married women who, on average, are 40 years old and have six children. They live in polygamous families in Konfon, one of the villages in the rural municipality of Banco, prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of Mali). They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to deal more efficiently with their activities when the winter season begins. They grow, among other products, rice and groundnuts. This is their first loan with the institution.

Korotoumou, standing at the right-hand side of the photo, intends to use her loan to buy agricultural supplies and tools and pay for plowing and weeding. She has around 0.25 hectares of farmland to grow groundnuts. The harvested products will be sold at the markets in Klè, Banco and N'Golobougou to a clientele made up of men and women. The group members expect to make an average profit of around 30,000 CFA francs per season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and weeding, and to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and tools.

loans.name: Twungurane Group

texts.fr:
Déogratias est un commerçant  âgé de 42 ans . Il habite à Kibimba  dans la province de Gitega. If fait le commerce  d’articles de bout ique comme dentifrices ,savons, cahiers,haricots, le riz ,l’huile de palme etc  depuis 18 ans. Il n’a pas été à l’école. Il est marié à Vestine qui est cultivatrice et ils n’ont pas encore eu d’enfant. 
Le crédit de Kiva de 30000 va lui permettre  d’acheter  beaucoup  de produits de boutiques (dentifrices, savons , cahiers, haricots, riz etc) à revendre pour realiser  de grands bénefices. 
Il est membre du groupe communautaire  “TWUNGURANE”
texts.en:
Déogratias is a 42-year-old merchant. He lives in Kibimba, in the province of Gitega. He has been selling convenience store items such as toothpaste, soap, notebooks, beans, rice, palm oil, etc. for 18 years. He is a member of the TWUNGURANE community group.

Déogratias never attended school. He is married to Vestine, a farmer, and they do not have any children yet. 

A loan of 30,000 BIF will help him to stock up on several items (toothpaste, soap, books, beans, rice, etc.) to sell and make substantial profits.

loans.use: to stock up on several convenience store items such as toothpaste, soap, notebooks, beans, rice, etc. for resale

loans.name: Benjamin Rafael

texts.es:
Benjamín, vive con su madre, y tres sobrinos, el se dedica a brindar servicio de diseño grafico, escaneo y fotocopias, tiene 15 años en el negocio, atiende de 7:00am a 6:00pm.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para dar mantenimiento a las maquinas e impresoras, también comprara tinta y papel, con estos materiales estará preparado para atender a la clientela que en su mayoría son estudiantes.
El objetivo de Benjamín es superarse, desarrollar su negocio, y contar con más clientes para generar mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Benjamín lives with his mother, and three nephews, and devotes himself to providing graphic design, scanning and photocopying services. He has been in this business for 15 years and is open for business from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m.

Currently he is seeking a loan to provide maintenance to the machines and printers. He will also purchase ink and paper, with which materials he will be prepared to serve the clientele which is mostly students. 

Benjamín's objective is to better himself, develop his business, and have more customers in order to generate more earnings.

loans.use: to maintain the machines and printers, and also to buy ink and paper.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is a peddler of salted fish and canned tomatoes. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a palm wine tapper. She assists her spouse in providing the basic needs of the home. Efua will use the loan to purchase more salted fish and canned tomatoes to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to add the sale of other food items.

loans.use: to purchase more salted fish and canned tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Duterintambwe 1 Group

texts.fr:
Rebecca est une commerçante âgée de 34ans qui habite au centre du pays dans la ville de Gitega. Elle vend de la bière depuis 5ans. Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle a fréquentée l’école jusqu’au niveau du primaire. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont 2 étudient a l’école primaire. 
Le crédit Kiva  de 100,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de caisses de bière à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« DUTERINTAMBWE 1 ».
texts.en:
