His goal is to expand his farm, in terms of the number of pigs and the amount of land that he owns. With this growth, he will be able to improve his income and live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy pigs and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Foussena

texts.fr:
Foussena est  une femme  âgée de 32ans. Elle est mariée å un commerçant. Elle a 02 enfants. 
Foussena travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1999. Elle vend seule  des épices, des cadenats et divers au marché de NUKAFU. Elle achète les produits à ACCRA et Grand Marché. 
Foussena a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des épices, des cadenats et divers.
texts.en:
Foussena is a 32-year-old woman. She is married to a merchant. She has two children.
Foussena has been working as a retailer since 1999. She works alone to sell spices, condiments and miscellaneous items on the market in Nufaku. She buys her products in Accra and in Grand Market.
Foussena has requested her first loan cycle from WAGES in order to buy spices, condiments and various other items.

loans.use: to buy spices.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana Cecilia, tiene la edad 59 de  años, está casada y vive con su es poso e hija. Ella pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de almacigo para la plantacion de café. Ella cuenta con un terreno apto para la siembra de café y pretende invertir en insumos como abonos y fungicidas para obtener una buena palantacion. Ella quiere implantar un cafetal que de buena producción para vender un café de calidad. Ella quiere implantar un cafetal que en un futuro de la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto del café. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Ana Cecilia is 59 years old, married, and lives with her husband and daughter. She intends to use this loan to buy supplies to make a seedbed for her coffee plantation. Ana Cecilia has adequate land for growing coffee and plans to invest in supplies such as compost and fungicides so that she can obtain a good crop. She wants to have a coffee farm that has good output so that she can sell a quality product. Ana Cecilia wants to keep her coffee business in operation so that in the future she can generate more revenue to provide for the welfare of her family and grow her coffee venture.

This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. Ana Cecilia has not had any other loans with the state banks. FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies for planting coffee.

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Kayissan Enyonam

texts.fr:
Kayissan est une femme âgée de  54 ans. Elle est veuve avec 05 enfants en charge. 
Kayissan travaille comme revendeuse de bijoux depuis 1980. Elle vend à ses clients au Grand Marché de Lomé. Elle achète les produits à COTONOU. 
Kayissan a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des bijoux.
texts.en:
Kayissan is a 54-year-old woman. She is a widow with five children in her care.
Kayissan has been retailing jewelry since 1980. She sells to her customers at the Grand Market in Lome. She purchases her products in Cotonou.
Kayissan requested her first loan cycle from WAGES in order to purchase jewelry.

loans.use: to buy jewelry.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Vamos Juntas” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco.  Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las nuevas siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

En el lugar conocimos al señor Pedro que nació en la ciudad de Urubamba (Perú), tiene 41 años de edad, está casado y fruto de esta unión tiene un hijo, y nos cuenta:

“Actualmente, Yo vivo en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizo mis actividades, Yo soy militar y trabajo en el ejercito del Perú en el área de mantenimiento, Yo y mi esposa Roció tenemos un pequeño negocio que consiste en comprar zapatos de la ciudad de Lima  y después venderlo a amigos, vecinos, compañeros de trabajo y familiares aquí en la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son dos años que me dedico a este negocio y me va muy bien. Este crédito es para comprar más mercedaria como por ejemplo zapatos y zapatillas”.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Vamos Juntas” (We Go Together) meets every 30 days in the city of Cusco, which is known in the region for being a tourist and commercial area. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

It is here that the staff of Asociación Arariwa met with Sr. Pedro, who was born in the city of Urubamba in Peru. He is 41 years old, married, and has a son. Pedro said the following:

“At the moment, I live in the city of Cusco and this is where I conduct my activities. I am in the military and a member of the Peruvian army in the maintenance unit. My wife Roció and I have a small business in which we buy shoes in the city of Lima and then sell them to friends, neighbors, co-workers, and relatives here in the city of Cusco. We have been in this business for two years and have done very well. We need a loan to buy more merchandise, such as shoes and slippers.”

loans.use: to buy shoes and slippers.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. Luis es soltero, se dedica a la fabricación y venta de ladrillos crudo, viene realizando esta actividad toda su vida, siendo un negocio de toda la familia; pero hace 4 años que el Sr. Luis se independizo en el negocio lo cual ha hecho progresar poco a poco. Para Luis su principal desafío es madrugar todos los días para poder fabricar los ladrillos ya que a medio día con el sol no se puede trabajar en ello y sus  sueños es tener una ladrillera grande y formar una familia. El crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materia prima para dicha fabricación. El Sr Luis está muy agradecido por la oportunidad recibida.
texts.en:
Sr. Luis is single and has been selling crude bricks throughout his entire life since his entire family in this business. Four years ago, Sr. Luis became independent and his business has advanced slowly. His main challenge is getting up early every day to make the bricks because by noon he is not able to work under the heat of the sun. His dreams are to have a large brickyard and to start a family.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of raw materials for making bricks. Sr. Luis is very grateful for the opportunity that he has received.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making bricks.

loans.name: Téko

texts.fr:
Tèko est une femme âgée de 60 ans .Elle est veuve et à deux enfants.
Têko  travaille comme   revendeuse depuis l’an  2000.Elle vend  de la boullie, du pain et du gâteau dans un quartier de la place.Têko s’approvisionne à lomé.Elle ne se fait pas aidé dans son commerce, elle travaille seule.
Têko a requis son deuxième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du maïs ,de la farine de blé et de l’huile pour la fabrication de ses produits de vente.
texts.en:
Téko is a 60-year-old widow with two children. She became a merchant in 2000. She sells porridge, bread and cake in a local neighborhood. She buys her supplies in Lomé. She runs her business alone and does not employ any helpers. 

Téko is seeking her second loan from WAGES to buy the corn, wheat flour, and oil necessary to make the products that she sells.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make porridge, bread and cake for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Luz Angelica

texts.es: Luz (50 años) ,es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora. Vive en casa propia junto a sus 2 hijas, un nieto y su esposo quienes le hacen feliz.El multiservicio de Luz esta ubicado en su propia casa, en una zona cerca de un colegio, ella se dedica a sacar copias, vender útiles, cabinas telefónicas y venta de ropa; además de realizar la actividad ya mencionada ella también se dedica a la preparación de alimentos para eventos que le soliciten.Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es el movimiento que hay ya que ella se divierte mucho en su trabaja, al mismo tiempo que le genera ganancias ya que es muy conocida y cada fin de semana le llegan contratos los cuales ella cumple con toda responsabilidad. Tiene en mente muchos planes y proyectos los cuales espera poder concretar más adelante con la ayuda Dios.Este es el sexto préstamo que recibe de MFP y espera poder seguir con el grupo ya que cuando los problemas se presentaron ahí estuvieron todos para poder solucionarlos como grupo que son.Con los 1000 soles que le prestaran serán para poder incrementar sus multiservicios y así poder satisfacer con las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luz, age 50, is a modest and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her two daughters, a grandson, and her husband who make her happy. Luz has a multi-service business located in her home, which is situated near a school. She makes copies, sells school supplies, offers phone booths for rent, and sells clothing. In addition to these services, she prepares food for events upon request. What she likes most about her work is the high level of activity in her job. This allows her to generate an income while enjoying what she does. Luz is well-known and responsibly fulfills all of her contracts each weekend. She has many plans and projects, so she hopes to complete them with the help of God.

This is the sixth loan she has received from MFP. She hopes to continue with her group because the other members can provide solutions when problems occur. The loan of 1000 PEN being issued to her will enable her to increase her services so that she can satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to increase the services that she offers in her business.

loans.name: Maximo Senin

texts.es: El Sr. Máximo es casado, tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad. Máximo es panadero, el se inicio trabajando desde muy joven en una panadería, luego con sus ahorros se compro maquinas para hacer pan y así fue que creó su propia panadería y ya tiene 3 años. Máximo va a invertir el crédito en la compra de insumos en cantidades mayores para su panadería. Su principal sueño es tener una cadena de panaderías en todo el departamento de Ica. El se encuentra muy agradecido por el crédito otorgado a su persona.
texts.en:
Sr. Máximo is married and has a two-year-old son. He is baker and started working at a bakery when he was a young man. He later used his savings to buy machines for making bread and started his own bakery. Máximo has already been in business for three years.

He will invest the loan in the purchase of supplies in large quantities for his bakery. His main dream is to have a chain of bakeries throughout the Department of Ica. He is very grateful for the loan that has been provided to him.

loans.use: to buy supplies in large quantities.

loans.name: Nidia Jeanneth

texts.es:
NIDIA  JEANNETH
Para doña Nidia quien tiene en su domicilio una tienda de consumo diario desde hace 7 años,  se siente orgullosa como mujer trabajadora  y madre de  de 4 hijos, aunque sabe que esto representa para  ella una obligación y compromiso muy grande  como también por su negocio ya que a Dios gracias tiene mucha clientela quien la visita desde muy temprano en la compra de los artículos necesario para el sustento diario, también ha incluido en su negocio la venta de recargas y tarjetas electrónicas, todo esto la impulsa a seguir luchando a pesar del alza que ha tenido todos los productos de la canasta básica,ella esta convencida de que nececita invertir mas para seguir creciendo por lo que ella esta solicitando este credito para al compra de productos comestibles  y no quedarle mal a su clientela, obteniendo de esta actividad un beneficio para su familia y sentirse como alguien que le brinda apoyo y servicio a su prójimo.
texts.en:
Doña Nidia Jeanneth has a store in her home where she has been selling everyday consumer products for seven years. She is proud to be a hardworking woman and a mother of four children. Nidia knows that this is an obligation and is greatly committed to her business. She also thanks God that she has many customers, who visit her from the early morning hours to buy the necessary products for their daily survival. In her business, Nidia also sells electronic rechargeable credits and phone cards. Nidia is encouraged to continue striving forward even though prices for all basic household products have increased. She is convinced that she needs to invest more so that she can continue growing.

For this reason, Nidia is requesting a loan to buy food products so as not to look bad to her customers. She established this business as a benefit for her family. Nidia feels that she is someone who can provide support and service to her neighbors.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Arturo David

texts.es:
Arturo es un hombre de 36 años nacido en "El empalme" una parroquia perteneciente a la Región costa del Ecuador. Actualmente vive en la parroquia "Río Verde" en la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas junto a su esposa Lourdes y sus tres hijos de 9, 7 y 5 años. El menor de sus hijos sufre de una enfermedad congénita la cual no permite que sus órganos se desarrollen, esto ha golpeado duramente a toda la familia, a nivel económico y emocional.

Hace 3 años Arturo inició su negocio de venta de comida. El tiene su propio carrito y se ubica en una popular calle del barrio donde reside para vender sus productos. El vende "corviches", "emborrajados" y "plátanos maduros con queso", bocadillos típicos de esta zona. Este oficio lo aprendió de su madre quien se dedica a la misma actividad. Él desea hacer reparaciones a su casa y comprar comida para venderla en su carrito, para ello solicitó a Fundación Alternativa un crédito el cual le permitirá mejorar su vida.

Trabaja 10 horas al día, todo por el bienestar de su familia, pero su gran sueño es que su hijo menor se cure.
texts.en:
Arturo is a 36-year-old gentleman who was born in El Empalme parish, which is located in the coastal region of Ecuador.  He currently lives in Río Verde parish in the province of Santo Domingo de Los Tsáchilas with his wife Lourdes and their three children (ages 9, 7, and 5).  His youngest child suffers from a congenital disease that prevented his organs from developing properly.  This situation has taken its toll on the entire family, both financially and emotionally.  

Three years ago, Arturo started a business selling food.  He has his own cart that he parks along a popular street in the neighborhood where he sells his products.  Arturo sells fish fritters, fried pastries, and ripe plantains with cheese.  All of these are traditional snacks of the region.  Arturo learned this trade from his mother, who also engaged in the same line of work.  

He hopes to make repairs to his house and buy food to sell from his cart.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan Fundación Alternativa in order to improve his life.  Arturo works 10 hours a day so that he can provide for the welfare of his family, but his greatest wish is to see his young son cured.

loans.use: to buy food to sell from his cart and to make repairs to his house.

loans.name: Mirian Esperanza

texts.en: Mirian, who lives in San Lorenzo, Honduras with her two children, operates a small grocery stand at the local market and sells basic grains and beef itinerantly via motorcycle. She is requesting a loan of HNL 12,000 to purchase beef and basic merchandise. Mirian hopes to keep working with Prisma in the future in order to expand her small business.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, candy, soft drinks, juices, milk, eggs, beef, corn, cornmeal, beans, rice, cooking oil, lard, household cleaning supplies, and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MARIA ELENA MOYANO”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Teofilo; el socio tiene  56 años de edad; el socio tiene 3 hijos de 38, 30, 14 años de edad,  el socio es casado y el socio  es el promotor de un jardín de niños, el cual a iniciado junto a su esposa la directora y a sus hijas las profesoras de nivel inicial, el jardín es muy bello y acogedor, el socio es muy gentil, amistoso y goza de un increíble humor, el socio viene trabajando desde hace 20 años y el desea seguir implementado las aulas, los baños, los útiles escolares, los mapas, los cuadros didácticos , renovar paredes, fachada y siempre es una inversión, el socio en esta ocasión desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de algunos cuadros didácticos, de pinturas para el jardín, de mejorar y ambientar con figuritas y pinturas de dibujos animados el jardín y las diversas aulas. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar pintura y pago al pintor y a los dibujantes que harán las figuras animadas para el jardín y las aulas, comprar mapas didácticos de diferentes actividades.

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Sr. Teofilo is a member of the Communal Bank “Maria Elena Moyano” which is located in the District of Huanchac in the Province and Department of Cusco.

He is 56 years old, married, and has three children (ages 38, 30, and 14). Teofilo is the promoter for a children’s kindergarten that he started with his wife, who is the director, and his daughters, who are preschool teachers. Their school is very beautiful and inviting. Teofilo is gentle, friendly, and has an incredible sense of humor. He has been working for 20 years and wants to continue utilizing the classrooms, bathrooms, school supplies, maps, textbooks, as well as repair the walls and façade since these items are always an investment. On this occasion, Teofilo wants to invest this loan in the purchase of some educational workbooks, children’s paints, as well as improve and enliven the atmosphere by adding figurines and animated paintings across the school and in different classrooms.

Teofilo is requesting a loan to buy paint and to pay a painter and draftsmen to make figurines for the school and classrooms. He will also buy educational maps for different activities.

Teofilo is grateful for the support that has been provided, so he promises to complete his payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy educational maps, paints, and to pay a painter and draftsmen to create figurines for the school and classrooms.

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es: Rosibel, tiene la edad 24 de  años, está casada y vive con su esposo . Ella pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de almacigo para su plantación de café. Ella cuenta con un terreno para sembrarlo de café y pretende invertir en mano de obra e insumos como abonos y fungicidas para obtener un buen resultado. Ella quiere implantar un cafetal que de buena producción para vender un café de calidad. Ella quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  familiar  y crecer con el proyecto del café. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Rosibel is 24 years old, married, and lives with her husband. She intends to use this loan to buy supplies to make a seedbed for her coffee plantation. Rosibel has a plot of land for growing coffee and plans to invest in labor and supplies, such as compost and fungicides, so that she can obtain good results. She wants to have a coffee farm that has good output so that she can sell a quality product. Rosibel wants to generate more revenue so that she can provide for the welfare of her family and grow her coffee venture.

This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. Rosibel has not had any other loans with the state banks. FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies for growing coffee and to pay for labor.

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Vamos Juntas” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco.  Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las nuevas siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

En el lugar conocimos al señor Mario que nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú), tiene 66 años de edad, está casado y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos, y nos cuenta:

“Actualmente, Yo vivo en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizo mis actividades, Yo soy jubilado pero trabajo de cocinero en el centro comercial “La Canasta” en la ciudad del Cusco los días sábados y domingos. También me dedica a la venta de ropa y compro mi mercadería en la ciudad de Juliaca. Este crédito es para comprar más mercedaria como por ejemplo vestidos. Y mi sueño es abrir un restaurante turístico en el centro de la ciudad del Cusco”.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Vamos Juntas” (We Go Together) meets every 30 days in the city of Cusco, which is known in the region for being a tourist and commercial area. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

It is here that the staff of Asociación Arariwa met with Sr. Mario, who was born in the city of Cusco in Peru. He is 66 years old, married, and has three children. Mario said the following:

“At the moment, I live in the city of Cusco and this is where I conduct my activities. I am retired but work as a cook at the La Canasta shopping center in the city of Cusco on Saturdays and Sundays. I also sell clothing and buy my merchandise in the city of Juliaca. This loan will be used to buy merchandise, such as dresses. My dream is to open a tourist restaurant in central Cusco.”

loans.use: to buy dresses.

loans.name: Norma Yamileth

texts.en:
Norma lives in San Lorenzo, Honduras, with her husband. She operates a small shop out of her home, selling shrimp, dairy products and basic groceries. 

Twice a week Norma leaves the shop in the care of her daughter-in-law while she travels around neighboring villages selling shrimp and dairy products.

Norma is requesting a loan of HNL 5,000 to purchase a bulk quantity of shrimp.

loans.use: to purchase a bulk amount of shrimp.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her storefront.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens and feed.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia de 47 años tiene 9 hijos,ella se dedica al cultivo de tomates desde hace 5 años ella nos cuenta que es Gracias a Dios le a ido bien en su negocio,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de semillas y abono para el cultivo,ella nos cuenta que su sueño es agrandar su siembra ya que las temporadas le han quedado bien,y se a producido en cantidades grandes.
texts.en:
Alicia is 47 years old and has nine children. She has been cultivating tomatoes for five years. Alicia says that she has done well in her business, thanks to God. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and compost for her crop.

Alicia says her dream is to increase her planting because the previous seasons have been good and have yielded large quantities.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and compost.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is 39 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has two children. Both are currently in school.  

Abdullah has a business of a small retail shop that sells cosmetics. He has run the shop for six years. He owns rental houses as his second business.  

To help expand his business, Abdullah has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase cosmetic items like body lotions for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Abdullah hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  

In the future, Abdullah hopes to expand his business. Abdullah is a member of BRACs small enterprise program (SEP), which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his capital.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic items like body lotions for resale.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar de 36 años es una mujer amable y trabajadora. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus cinco hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida y una buena educación para el futuro.Ella se dedica al alquiler de bicicletas. Normalmente, espera en su casa a que vengan los niños o señores en busca de un poco de diversión y sano ejercicios o quizás por alguna necesidad de transportarse. Cuenta con 10 bicicletas las que alquila en su mayoría a los chicos en edad escolar.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que siempre hay clientes además de poder estar en casa cerca de sus hijos. Lo que no le agrada es que a veces los niños se caen o maltratan a las bicicletas y tiene que pagar ella con los repuestos. Sin embargo ella continua perseverante porque es una actividad que le genera ganancias suficientes para poder cumplir con las necesidades básicas del hogar, ya que su esposo se dedica a otras actividades. Le gustaría poder comprar más bicicletas y mandar a arreglar los que presentan algún deterioro por el tiempo.Este es el segundo préstamo que realiza Pilar con MFP y espera poder seguir cumpliendo con la misma responsabilidad que lo ha hecho hasta ahora, se siente muy cómoda en su grupo ya que todos son vecinos y siempre están al pendiente de lo que le pueda suceder a la otra.Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles ella mandará a pintar y arreglar sus bicicletas.
texts.en:
Pilar, age 36, is a friendly and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her husband and five children, for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life and a good education for their future. Pilar has a business renting out bicycles. Normally, she waits at home for children and adults who are looking to have a little bit of fun and healthy exercise. Some of them may need a mode of transportation. Pilar has 10 bicycles for rent and most of her customers are school-age children. What she likes most about her job is that she always has customers and can be at home so that she is near her children. The part that she dislikes is whenever the children fall off the bicycles or damage them because she has to pay for replacement parts. Nonetheless, she continues to persevere because this business generates sufficient income for her to cover basic household needs. Her husband engages in other activities. Pilar would like to buy more bicycles and repair some of those that have deteriorated over time.

This is her second loan with MFP. Pilar hopes to continue fulfilling her commitments in the same responsible manner that she has done to this point. She feels very comfortable with her group since all of them are neighbors and always looking out for one another. The amount of 1000 PEN that she requested will be used to paint and repair her bicycles.

loans.use: to paint and repair her rental bikes.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 35 years old and lives in the town of Luweero in the Gulu region of Uganda. She is married and has four children. All of her children are currently in school.  

Joan has a business of a small retail shop that sells sugar. She has run her shop for five years.    

To help expand her business, Joan has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.  

With the help of the loan from BRAC, Joan hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  

In the future, Joan hopes to expand her business. Joan is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program (SEP), which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her improve her capital.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 35 years old and lives in the town of Luweero in the Gulu region of Uganda. He is married and has four children. Two of his children are currently in school.  

Francis has a business of selling produce, like maize flour. He has run this business for five years. He does farming as his second business.  

To help expand his business, Francis has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase produce like maize for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Francis hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  

In the future, Francis hopes to expand his business. Francis is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program (SEP), which has helped his prospects for the future by providing a loan that has helped him improve his capital.

loans.use: to purchase produce like maize for resale.

loans.name: Lamula

texts.en:
Lamula is 38 years old and lives in the town of Luweero in the Gulu region of Uganda. She is married and has three children. 3 of her children are currently in school.  

Lamula has a small retail shop that sells sugar and other essential commodities like salt and soap, which she has had for 4 years. She does farming as her second business.  

To help expand her business, Lamula has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar, salt, and soap for resale.  

With the help of the loan from BRAC, Lamula hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  

In the future, Lamula hopes to expand her business. Lamula is a member of BRACs small enterprise program (SEP), which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar, salt, and soap for resale.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 40 years old and lives in the town of Bombo in the Gulu region of Uganda. She is married and has four children. Three of her children are currently in school.  

Mariam has a small retail shop. She has run the shop for four years. She has rental houses as her second business.

 To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Mariam hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  

In the future, Mariam hopes to expand her business.  

Mariam is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise program (SEP), which has helped her prospects for the future by lending her money that has improved her capital.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities for resale.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is 38 years old and lives in the town of Matugga in the Gulu region of Uganda. She is married and has four children. Three of her children are currently in school.  

Justine has a small restaurant, which she has had for five years. She does farming as her second business.  

To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase food for the restaurant. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Justine hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  

In the future, Justine hopes to expand her business. 

Justine is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program (SEP), which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her capital.

loans.use: to purchase food for the restaurant.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.en:
Juan lives and works in the Santo Domingo canton of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas. Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas is one of the largest cities in Ecuador, with 500,000 inhabitants. But you'd never guess the size of the city from the tranquil pace of life. Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas is in a tropical, humid area of Ecuador, renowned for its natural beauty, its huge markets, and its trade in livestock -- the largest in the country.

Juan is 48 years old and has three children. His two oldest, at 24 and 27 years old, no longer live with him. He lives with his 16-year-old son and his 42-year-old girlfriend, Mariana, who works in the house. His relatives have been ill, which has been hard for him, and Juan spends all of his spare time with his family.

This is Juan's first loan with Kiva. Juan is a general mechanic, and he will use it to buy tools and parts for his business. He works 15 hours a day without help, but because he enjoys the work so much, it doesn't feel that hard. 

Juan's ambition for the future is to have a more modernized mechanic's workshop and business and to own his own home. Juan is always working toward his most important dream: to realize a lifestyle than can provide a better life for his family. He hopes to get closer to these goals through his loan with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy auto-repair tools and parts.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 45 years old and lives in the town of Matugga in the Gulu region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. One is currently in school.  

Janet has a small retail shop that she has had for four years. She owns rental houses as her second business.  
	
To help expand her business, Janet has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.  

With the help of the loan from BRAC, Janet hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, Janet hopes to expand her business.  

Janet is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program (SEP), which has helped her prospects for the future by providing her with more knowledge about business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es: Griselda es una mujer trabajadora ella es originaria de una localidad muy bonita y pintoresca donde todavía se preservan su cultura Mazahua en esa localidad hablan el dialecto y todavía visten sus prendas mazahuas. Gris como le dicen de cariño tiene 26 años de edad tiene 2 hijos una niña de 4 años y un niño de 8 meses, ella es casada y se dedica a la venta de ropa como son conjuntos de pants para dama y caballero, chamarras, blusas y ropa para niños, ella tiene con su negocio desde hace 5 años ella surte su ropa en la cuidad de México, ya que en esa cuidad le dan buenos precios para así ella ganarle un poco a la hora que vende su ropa. Dice que ahorita no tiene problemas o desafíos lo que le importa a ella es sacar adelante a sus hijos darles una buena educación y poder hacerles una casa de concreto ya que viven en una casa de madera. Griselda dice que el préstamo le beneficiara ya que tendrá muy bien surtido su negocio y podrá salir a venderles a sus vecinas ya que les agrada la ropa que ella vende ya que a veces le hacen pedidos y eso la tiene muy contenta por que puede ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. La meta que tiene Griselda es poder rentar en la ciudad de Zitacuaro un local donde pueda vender su ropa para ya no andar cargando sus bolsas ya que se le hace pesado ya que se lleva con ella a sus niños para no dejarlos solos en la casa y por eso quiere establecer su negocio. Las ganancias que obtenga Griselda le ayudaran a tener mejor surtido su negocio y a su comunidad ya no tendrán que salir a otros lados a buscar como dice ella “Buena, bonita y barata y sonríe”.
texts.en:
Griselda is a hardworking woman who is originally from a beautiful and picturesque town where the culture of the Mazahua is still being preserved. The Mazahua dialect is still spoken and the traditional clothing is worn. Griselda says with affection that she is 26 years old and has two daughters, ages 4 and 8 months. She is married and sells clothing such as men’s and women’s trousers, jackets, blouses, and children’s clothing. Griselda has been in business for five years and acquires her merchandise in Mexico City because the prices are better, which allows her to make a little more profit when she sells the clothes. She says that right now she does not face any problems or challenges. What matters to her is that her children succeed by giving them a good education and building a concrete house since they currently live in one made of wood.

Griselda says that the loan will be a benefit because her business will be well-stocked. Whenever she leaves to go sell to her neighbors, they like the clothing that she offers. Sometimes they place orders with her and she is very happy that she can help her husband with the household expenses. Griselda’s goal is to rent a shop in the city of Zitacuaro so that she can sell clothes and not have to carry around heavy bags of merchandise. It is also difficult to leave her children alone at home, so she wants to establish her business. The earnings that she generates will help restock her business so that the people in her community do not have to go to other places. Griselda always says, “Good, nice, cheap, and smile”.

loans.use: to buy all types of clothing.

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es: Doña Fabiola cuenta con 32 años de edad y es originaria de una localidad donde su principal actividad económica es la venta de borregos y el cultivo de aguacate. Ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos dos estudiantes de primaria y una pequeña de un año. Ella se dedica a vender borregos desde hace 5 años con su esposo los ofrece en su localidad, ella esta pidiendo un crédito por que quiere invertir en nuevo negocio que es en la venta de zapato por catalogo de diferentes marcas ella ira a la ciudad de México a los distribuidores autorizados a surtir los zapatos y los ira a vender a la gente de su comunidad y los venderá en dos pagos para que a la gente se le facilite comprárselos y para aclientarse con la gente de su localidad. La meta que tiene Fabiola es poner empeño en su nuevo negocio y mas adelante poner un local en su comunidad donde también venda accesorios para dama. Ella esta muy agradecida por este préstamo ya que esta muy emocionada por que tendrá otra entrada de dinero con lo cuál les dará una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Doña Fabiola is 32 years old and originally from a town where the main business activities are selling sheep and growing avocados. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in elementary school while the youngest is a year old. Fabiola and her husband have been selling sheep for five years and offer them for sale in her town. She is requesting a loan because she wants to invest in a new business selling shoes through catalogs of different brands. Fabiola will travel to Mexico City to visit authorized distributors so that she can receive a stock of shoes and sell them to people in her community. She will sell the shoes for two payment installments so that people can easily buy them. This will also help build up the customer base in her town.

Fabiola’s goal is to establish her new business and eventually open a store in her community where she can also sell women’s accessories. She is very grateful for this loan and is very excited about having another source of funds by which she can provide a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy shoes for her new catalog sales business.

loans.name: Vianey

texts.es: Vianey tiene 22 años de edad es madre de un niño de 1 año, su esposo es trabajador de la construcción en la cuidad de México. Ella vive en una localidad llena de vegetación y de unos paisajes hermosos, la principal actividad económica de su localidad es la venta de borregos. Ella se dedica a vender estos animales desde hace 3 años y dice que ella y su esposo emprendieron este negocio para tener sus ahorros invertidos en algún negocio que les dejara ganancias, ellos compran los borregos en otras localidades y ahorita dice que nada mas tienen 5 borregos ya en la temporada de graduaciones de las escuelas se les venden muy rápido es por eso que esta pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para comprar otros 3 borregos para criarlos y en la época decembrina (navidad) venderlos a un buen precio ya que también en esa época se le venden muy rápidamente. La meta que tiene Vianey es tener un gran rebaño de borregos para que sus esposo y ella nada más se dedique a ese negocio para que ya no salga tan lejos a trabajar. Ella esta muy contenta por que le están haciendo el préstamo por que su negocio crecerá.
texts.en:
Vianey is 22 years old and the mother of a 1-year-old son. Her husband is a construction worker in Mexico City. She lives in a locale full of vegetation and with beautiful landscapes. The principal economic activity of this locality is selling sheep.

Vianey has been selling these animals for the last 3 years and she says that she and her husband began this business to have their savings invested in a business that would provide earnings. They bought their sheep in other  regions and now, she says they have no less than 5 sheep. Now that the era of school graduations has arrived, they will sell the sheep rapidly. That's why she is requesting a loan from this institution to buy another 3 sheep to raise so that by the December (Christmas) season, she can sell them at a good price when they sell rapidly.

Vianey's goal is to have a large herd of sheep so that she and her husband can dedicate themselves full time to this business, and he won't have to go so far to work. Vianey is very content to be seeking a loan because it will help her business grow.

loans.use: raise and sell sheep.

loans.name: Rubi

texts.es: Rubí es una gran vendedora tiene 23 años de edad, soltera y pese a su corta edad es una mujer muy trabajadora ella se dedica a vender ropa para dama y niños también vende ropa interior, tiene con este negocio mas de 6 años y surte su ropa en la cuidad de Moroleón Guanajuato ella esta pidiendo un crédito por que quiere comprar trajes de pants para dama y caballero y comprar algo de uniformes ya que se viene la temporada de venta de los uniformes para el nuevo ciclo escolar, también comprara calcetas para las niñas de las escuelas y ropa interior para niños. Esta muy entusiasmada con la financiera por que dice que le han hablado muy bien de esta y lo que más le llamo la atención es que les ayuda a salir adelante con sus negocios. La meta que tiene Rubí es poner un negocio especialmente para su ropa ya que la tiene en la sala de su casa y ella quisiera un local estable.
texts.en:
Rubi is a great saleswoman.  She is 23 years old, single, and, in spite of her young age, is a very hard-working woman.  She sells clothes for women and children and also underwear.  She has worked in this business for more than 6 years and takes her clothes to the city of Moroleón, Guanajuato.
She is asking for a loan because she wants to buy pant suits for women and men and uniforms, now that the season to sell uniforms for the new school year is coming.  She will also buy stockings for schoolgirls and underwear for boys.  
She is very enthusiastic about the financial organization because she says people have spoken very highly of it.  What most caught her attention is that it helps people move forward with their businesses.  Rubi’s goal is to start a business especially for clothing, since she currently runs her business out of her living room, and would like to have a more stable location.

loans.use: to sell clothes.

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.en:
Alexandra is a hard-working, 22-year-old mother of two. She had her first child at 15 years old and her second child two years later. Her greatest struggle is working to provide her seven-year-old daughter Tatiana with a bright future; Tatiana is severely handicapped and was born with paralysis. Alexandra lives with her children, her 55-year-old mother Elva, and her 30-year-old husband Richard. 

Alexandra lives and works in the Santo Domingo canton of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas. Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas is one of the largest cities in Ecuador, with 500,000 inhabitants, but you'd never guess the size of the city from its tranquil pace of life and easy-going inhabitants. Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas is in a tropical, humid area of Ecuador, renowned for its natural beauty, its huge markets, and its trade in livestock--the largest in the country.

This is Alexandra's first Kiva loan. She will use it to buy more chickens and feed. Alexandra works eight hours a day, with help from her mother Elva, and she uses her spare time to sell other products.

Her dream is to own her own home, and for one day to see her daughter walk. She hopes her Kiva loan will help her increase her income, so she can gain access to more expensive medical treatments for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed.

loans.name: Yareni

texts.es:
Yareni es soltera y vive en un ribera que esta a media  hora del pueblo, es un lugar muy bonito donde su gente es muy trabajadora que busca la manera de sacra delatante a su  familia.
    Ella invertido el préstamo para la compra de cosméticos  de la marca Avon, Fuller, Blanda y Jafra, en donde lleva trabajando tres años y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello se apoya para tener su propios ingresos  aun así también trabaja en la casa de una tía cuidando a una niña y dice que le va bien.
     Lo que  lo inspiro a esta  actividad fue ella sola para mejorar sus ingresos económicos para así  no tener que depender de nadie  y Salir adelante por si sol.
    Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña activa pueda tener un mejor ahorro a y así mejorar  algunas cosas que desea comprar para su casa.
texts.en:
Yareni is single and lives at the beach which is a half hour from town. It is a very lovely place where the people are very hard-working and look for ways to help their families get ahead.

     She will invest her loan in the purchase of Avon, Fuller, Blanca and Jafra cosmetics, which she has been selling for three years.  She comments that she has been doing well since she is able to have her own income. At the same time she is also working in an aunt's house caring for a little girl and she says that is going well.

    What inspires her to do this business is her own self motivation to increase her income and not be dependent on anyone so that she can get ahead on her own.

    What she most wishes is that with this small business she can increase her savings and thereby make some improvements that she wants to make in her home.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of Jafra brand and Fuller cosmetics, among others.

loans.name: Adelayda

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Vamos Juntas” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco.  Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

En el lugar conocimos a la señora Adelayda que nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú), tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, y nos cuenta:

“Actualmente, Yo vivo en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizo mis actividades, Yo me dedico a la venta de cometicos. Ya voy dos años con este negocio y me va muy bien. También me dedico a limpiar y dar mantenimiento de departamentos. Ya son 7 años que me dedico a brindar este servicio y me va muy excelente. En esta oportunidad requiero el préstamo para comprar más cosméticos. Uno de mis sueños es abrir un bazar o boutique”.
texts.en:
The community bank "We Come Together" meets every month in the city of Cusco.  Cusco is known as a popular tourist area, and a business center.  It is also known for its traditional festival of Inti Raymi and because it is the location of Machu Picchu, one of the seven wonders of the world.

In this place we meet Señora Adelayda, who was born in the city of Cusco (in Peru).  She is 33 years old and married, and has two children from this relationship.  She tells us:

"Currently, I live in the city of Cusco, where I do my work.  I work selling cosmetics.  It's coming up to two years that I've had this business and it's going very well.  I also work cleaning and doing maintenance for the local government.  I've been providing this service for 7 years, and it's going extremely well.  At this moment, I am requesting a loan to buy more cosmetics.  One of my dreams is to open a bazaar or boutique."

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics.

loans.name: Rosa Lidia

texts.es:
La señora  Rosa Lidia es madre soltera con una hija de diez años de edad y vive en una ribera muy bonita que alado pasa la carretera internacional, en esa ribera la gente es muy  trabajadora y busca la manera de dicar su tiempo en  algo que les deje beneficios.
Solcito el préstamo  para invertirlo en la compra de  mercancía como son: frijol, aceite, galletas, jabón, café, entre otros  para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, en done lleva cuatro años y comentó que le  va bien ya que con ello ha tenido un buen ingreso.
Su inspiración por esta actividad comenzó ya que su esposo la abandono cuando su hija esta de cinco años y decidió dedicarse a algo que le deje ingreso  para  sacar adelante a su pequeña hija.
Lo que ella desea es que con esta actividad pueda tener sus propios ahorros para seguir apoyando  a su hija y darle una educación y con el tiempo terminar su carrera.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa Lidia is a single mother with a ten year old daughter, and she lives in a beautiful waterfront community that wings along the side of the international highway.  In this community, the people are hardworking and looking for ways to spend their time on something that brings them benefits.

She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise such as beans, oil, biscuits, soap, coffee, etc., to stock her grocery store.  She started this four years ago, and comments that it is doing well and that she has had a good income from it.

Her inspiration for this activity started when her husband abandoned her when her daughter was five years old, and she decided to work in something that would provide her with income to move her young daughter ahead in life.

What she wants is to have her own savings as result of this business, so she can continue to support her daughter and give her an education and eventually a career.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of merchandise to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a bulk supply of shrimp.

loans.name: 10 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está en la parroquia "Bobolí" de la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, una zona densamente poblada del Ecuador cuyo clima tiene una temperatura se encuentra entre los 21 y 33 grados centígrados. Aquí la producción y comercialización de fruta es muy común entre los pobladores así como la crianza de animales.

José el presidente del grupo se dedica a la crianza de chanchos, luego los vende para obtener sus ingresos. Vive con su esposa y su hijo que nació hace un par de semanas. Durante su tiempo libre practica deportes como el "Ecuavoley" y el fútbol. Su obstáculo en la vida ha sido no haber podido terminar sus estudios secundarios. Con el préstamo él comprará más chanchos para criarlos y así aumentar sus ingresos.

Al igual que José, Cesar también se dedica a la crianza y venta de chanchos pero lo hace solamente parte de su tiempo. El trabaja como albañil pero quiere ampliar su negocio para poder renunciar a ser albañil y únicamente dedicarse a la crianza de chanchos. El es soltero y vive con su madre, nos cuenta que su deseo es poder compartir más tiempo con ella y darle una mejor calidad de vida.

Blanca es una mujer soltera de 50 años y se dedica a la venta de ropa, ella quiere invertir comprando más ropa y así poder tener ingresos para arreglar su casa. En este lugar desea poder hacer un pequeño local comercial para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
This group is in the Boboli parish in the Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas province.  It is a densely populated zone in Ecuador.  Its climate has a temperature of between 21 and 33 degrees centigrade.  The production and commercialization of fruit is very common with the people here, as is raising animals.

José is the president of the group.  He raises pigs, and he later sells them to get his income.  He lives with his wife and his son, who was born a couple of weeks ago.

During his free time he plays sports like “Ecuavoly” (a volleyball variation that is played with two 3-player teams with a higher net and the use of a soccer ball) and soccer.

The obstacle in his life is not having been able to finish high school.

He will use the loan to buy more pigs to raise and increase his income.

Just like José, Cesar also raises and sells pigs.  However, he only does this part time.  He works as a bricklayer, but he wants to expand his business to be able to stop being a bricklayer and to devote himself to only raising pigs.  He is single and lives with his mother.  He tells us that his wish is to be able to spend more time with her and to give her a better quality of life.

Blanca is a single, 50 year old woman.  She sells clothes.  She wants to be able to buy more clothes in order to have income to fix her house.  She wants to be able to establish a small store in her house in order to sell her products.

loans.use: to buy more pigs for his business.

loans.name: Rocio Maribel

texts.en:
Rocio Maribel is a hard-working single mother of 21 years. She lives with her 42-year-old mother Amanda and her two-year-old child. In her spare time, Rocio Maribel likes to listen to music, read, and just think.

Rocio Maribel lives and works in the Santo Domingo canton of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas. Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas is one of the largest cities in Ecuador, with 500,000 inhabitants, but you'd never guess the size of the city from the tranquil pace of life and the easy-going inhabitants. Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas is in a tropical, humid area of Ecuador, renowned for its natural beauty, its huge markets, and its trade in livestock--the largest in the country.

This is Rocio's second loan with Fundación Alternativa and her first loan with Kiva. She will use her loan to buy more cattle to sell. Rocio works twelve hours a day. She learned this business from her parents. Rocio hopes one day to be an engineer or work in business administration. She hopes this loan will her her increase her income and provide for a bright future for her and her child.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell later on.

loans.name: Diana Caridad

texts.en: Diana is a single mother who lives in San Lorenzo, Honduras with her daughter and mother. Diana runs a small clothing business and is requesting a loan of HNL 10,000 to purchase merchandise. The town where she lives will be having its yearly carnival in the upcoming weeks, and thus Diana would like to have more merchandise to sell. She is a returning client who has a reliable payment history.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, blouses, hats, belts, shoes, and sandals.

loans.name: Eliberta

texts.en: Eliberta lives in San Lorenzo, Honduras with her husband and four children. She makes a living by running a small eatery out of her house where she sells a variety of local fare. Eliberta has a steady clientele of neighbors, passersby, and friends from her church. She is requesting a loan of HNL 10,000 to purchase ingredients for cooking.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, beef, tomatoes, cucumbers, carrots, cabbage, potatoes, cornmeal, and condiments.

loans.name: Gladis Aidee

texts.es:
Gladis, vive sola, sus hijos viven fuera de su casa ya son independientes, es divorciada, propietaria de una venta de lácteos, este negocio lo inicio por iniciativa propia, no tiene un horario establecido para atender a sus clientes.
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de leche  para elaborar el queso, esta compra le ayudara a crecer en su negocio y gracias a ello ampliara el servcio a la clientela.
Su mayor sueño es tener un negocio grande, además que la experiencia con el negocio le ayude para continuar en el comercio y proveer para sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Gladis lives alone.  Her children do not live in her house because they are independent.  She is divorced.  She has a business selling dairy products, which she started with her own initiative.  She does not have a fixed schedule for seeing to her customers.

She is requesting a loan to buy milk in order to make cheese.  This purchase will help her to grow in her business.  Thanks to the loan she will expand her customer service.

Her greatest dream is to have a large business.  In addition to the experience in the business, it will help her continue with the business and provide for her necessities.

loans.use: to buy milk to make cheese.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.en:
Maria is a single mother who lives with her children in San Lorenzo, Honduras. 

Maria sells clothing for a living and has a sound customer base. 

She is requesting a loan of HNL 10,000 to purchase merchandise like pants, shirts, blouses, undergarments, shoes and sandals for resale. 

Maria is a returning client and dreams of eventually owning her own home.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, blouses, undergarments, shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y una hija, administra un negocio de ropa y medicina, dicho negocio surgió gracias a la ayuda de su hermano quien le enseño a manejar el negocio, no tiene un horario establecido para atender a sus clientes.
El esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, medicina y mas mercadería para su negocio, esta compra le ayudara crecer y tener la mercadería necesaria para atender a la clientela. 
El Objetivo de Jose es tener una empresa bien formada, tener mas clientela y ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and daughter.  He manages a clothing and medicine business.  Said business emerged thanks to his brother’s help.  His brother taught him how to run the business.  He does not have a fixed schedule for seeing to his customers.

He is requesting a loan to buy pants, shirts, skirts, medicine, and more merchandise for his business.  This purchase will help him grow.  It will help him to have the merchandise he needs to see to his customers.

José’s objective is to have a well formed business, to have more customers, and to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, and medicine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure and pesticide.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es: Emiliana:D. 44 años y tiene dos hijas,ella se dedica a la venta D. verduras por mayor como por ejemplo tomate y otros,ella no cuenta que esta muy contenta porque gracias a Dios su negocio a prosperado,ahora esta solicitnaod este credito para la compra D. mas verduras ya que esta convencida D. que le falta capital para trabajar y aumentar sus ganancias el sueño D. ella es tener un local mas granD. y surtir su negocio.para darles un mejor futuro a sus hijas.

loans.use: Compra de Verduras para la venta.

loans.name: Jose Alejandro

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa, agricultor y ganadero, ademas cria cerdos, él aprendio gracias al apoyo de su cuñada quien se dedicaba a lo mismo y lo ayudo para tener su propio negocio, cuenta con varios clientes, la granja de cerdos la tiene ubicada en su vivienda.
Actualmente esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de cerdos, esta compra le permitirá ampliar su negocio e incrementar las ganancias con la clientela.
El quiere montar una granja mas grande, conocer más clientela y desarrollandose como comerciante.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife.  He’s a farmer and raises cattle.  He also raises pigs.  He learned thanks to a sister-in-law who was in the same line of work and helped him have his own business.  He has several customers.  His pig farm is located at home.

At present, he’s asking for a loan to buy pigs.  This purchase will make it possible for him to expand the business and increase profits from customers.

He wants to set up a larger farm, to get to know more customers and to develop as a merchant.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Santos Javier

texts.es:
Santos de 20 años, es soltero, vive en casa de unos familiares, la cual cuenta con sólo servicios de luz, ubicado en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Santos desde hace un año se dedica a la comercialización de animales de corral (cerdos, cabras, ovejas y aves de corral), los cría en sus corrales que tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada, granos y pastos naturales, una vez que hayan completado su crecimiento ideal, los vende a sus clientes o en los diferentes mercados de la zona  y con los ingresos podrá cubrir sus necesidades personales.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para compra de alimento balanceado, una vez que los engorde los comercializa a sus clientes, con las ganancias que obtenga pagará el crédito otorgado y mejorará su calidad de vida.  Santos con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo está tratando de salir sólo adelante y superarse por sus propios medios.
texts.en:
Santos is 20 years old, single, and lives in the home of some relatives. The only service they receive is electricity. Santos resides in the District of Tambogrande, which is part of the Department of Piura. This area is known for its businesses involving agriculture, livestock breeding, and handicrafts.

For the past year, Santos has been selling domesticated animals such as pigs, goats, sheep, and chickens. The animals are kept in pens located behind his house and are fed balanced feed, grains, and natural grasses. Once the animals have completed their growth to the ideal level, Santos sells them to his customers or at the different markets in the area. With the income he earns, Santos is able to cover his personal needs.

He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN so that he can buy balanced feed for fattening his animals before selling them to his customers. With the revenue he generates, Santos will be able to repay the loan and improve his quality of life. Through much work and effort, Santos strives to move forward and succeed on his own.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for his animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance and replace the parts of his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Maria Rogelia

texts.es:
María tiene 40 años D. edad, vive con su esposa en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio D. agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito D. Túcume, que pertenece al departamento D. Lambayeque.  Esta zona la actividad que desarrollan es la agricultura, ganadería y turismo (cuenta con sitios arqueológicos muy bonitos para visitar).

María desD. hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta D. ganado vacuno (vaca), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa D. su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que tenga una buena producción D. leche, la que ofrece a los mismos pobladores D. la zona o lo lleva a vender al mercado D. Lambayeque, cuenta con clientela fija por la buena calidad D. leche que tiene, con sus ingresos solventa sus obligaciones D. su casa.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla D. 1500 nuevos soles para compra D. animales D. otras especies (aves D. corral) y su respectivo alimento para que se incremente la producción D. la leche D. vaca y así podrá ofrecerlo aun mejor precio para poder cubrir su crédito otorgado y mejorar su nivel D. vida.  María es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su negocio crezca para que tenga más comodidades en su casa pera su esposo y ella.
texts.en:
María is 40 years old and lives with her husband in their own home. They receive services, such as running water and electricity. María resides in the rural section of the District of Túcume, which is part of the Department of Lambayeque. This area has developed businesses involving agriculture, livestock breeding, and tourism (there are several beautiful archaeological sites that people can visit).

María has been raising and selling cattle for a few years. She has a corral that is located in an area outsiD. of her house. The animals are fed a diet of balanced feed and natural grasses so that they will produce a good amount of milk, which is offered to the local residents or taken to the market in Lambayeque to sell. María has an established customer base that is of good quality because of the milk she offers. With the income, she is able to meet her household obligations.

María is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN through its Seed Capital Program. The money will be used to buy animals of other species (specifically chickens) and the respective feed for her cows in order to increase milk production. This will allow María to obtain the best price for her products so that she can repay the loan and improve her standard of living.

María is a hardworking and responsible person. The only thing she wants is to see her business grow so that she can acquire more household comforts for herself and her husband.

loans.use: to buy chickens and cattle feed.

loans.name: Maria Catarina

texts.es:
La señora Maria Catarina es casada, tiene 59 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, estudio los estudios primarios, se dedica al comercio, a la venta de ropa típica, inició este negocio gracias al apoyo de sus hijos, y tiene hasta el momento 3 años de experiencia.

Decide solicitar un préstamo para aumentar su capital de trabajo, compra de ropa típica para reventa, va a comprar cortes, blusas, güipiles, fajas, rebosos, pañuelos, etc. En el futuro quiere ver su negocio prospero.
texts.en:
María Catarina, 59, is married and has two children.  She completed elementary school.  She’s a merchant.  She sells traditional clothing.  She started the business thanks to help from her children and to date has acquired three years of experience.

She decided to request a loan to increase her working capital buying traditional clothing to resell.  She will buy fabric, blouses, skirts, sashes, shawls, handkerchiefs, etc.  She wants to see her business be prosperous in the future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Nuevo Amanecer”  está conformado por 17 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran venta de ropa, venta de joyas, preparación y venta de comida rápida, artesanía en tejido y ventas en un minimarket. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillán. 
Paola delegada del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la primera fila y primer lugar de izquierda a derecha, además viste una chaqueta de cuero color negro y un sweater color amarillo. Ella se dedica al servicio en corte y confección de ropa, cuenta con una vasta experiencia en el rubro. Paola habilitó espacios de su casa para su taller de costuras, ahí cuenta con dos maquinas de coser puntada recta y una máquina de coser overlock. Confecciona ropa para colegios, cortinaje, además repara y transforma ropa. Comenta que durante todo el año las ventas son muy buenas, ya que recibe muchos pedidos para diferentes motivos y temporadas. Su horario de trabajo es durante las mañanas y las noches  todos los días de la semana, incluyendo los fines de semana. Paola recibe pedidos y también vende a domicilio sus confecciones. 
Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras en la ciudad de Santiago.
Con el crédito comprará telas, cierres e hilos.
Sus metas son contar con maquinaria industrial, ya que de esta manera agilizaría su trabajo y vendería una mayor cantidad de productos. 
Paola vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos, ambos asisten al colegio. Uno de sus sueños es generar mayores ganancias para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios brindados por Fondo esperanza, sobre todo de conocer nuevas experiencias y redes sociales que le han permitido obtener nuevos datos para vender. Las capacitaciones le han servido en su negocio y también en su vida personal, ya que ha sido un aprendizaje integral. Respecto a las demás socias, estas son responsables y comprometidas. 
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Nuevo Amanecer” (New Dawn) and has 17 entrepreneurs who are in a variety of occupations among which are: clothing sales, jewelry sales, fast food production and sales, woven crafts and sales in a minimarket.  They are all from the city of Chillán.

Paola is the communal bank group’s delegate.  In the photo she’s in the first row, first spot from left to right, wearing a black leather jacket and yellow sweater.  She is a clothing designer and seamstress and has vast experience in this line of work.  Paola equipped a room in her house as a sewing workshop where she has two sewing machines, a straight stitch and an overlock.  She manufactures school uniforms, drapery and also repairs and remakes clothes.  She comments that sales are good all year because she gets orders for different reasons and seasons.  Her work schedule is mornings and evenings every day of the week including weekends.  Paola takes orders and also sells her items door to door.  She buys her merchandise from distributors in the city of Santiago and will use the loan to buy fabric, zippers and thread.  Her goal is to get industrial machinery because that will make work easier and she will sell larger numbers of items.

Paola lives with her husband and two children who are in school.  One of her dreams is to generate higher profits to provide her family with a better quality of life.

She is very happy and grateful for the services given by Fondo Esperanza above all becoming aware of new experiences and social networks that have led to new sales data.  Training has been useful for her business and also for her personal life because it’s been integrated learning.  With respect to the other members, they are responsible and committed.

Chillán is a commune in south-central Chile.  The name means “Seat of the Sun” in Mapudungun, the language of our Mapuche indigenous people.  Chillan is also known as “Cradle of the Nation” or “Land of Artists” because many outstanding people in Chile’s history have been born here like the well-known pianist, Claudio Arrau, for example.

loans.use: to buy fabric, zippers and thread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover personal expenses and pay off debts

loans.name: Leida Rosa

texts.es:
Leida de 19 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Castilla, que pertenece al departamento de Piura.   Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesanía.

Leida a colocado un bazar donde ofrece todo tipo de productos para el uso diario en su domicilio, desde hace 5 año, éste negocio no tiene mayor competencia en la zona donde vive, siempre está tratando de ofrecer artículos novedosos para tener mayor demanda de clientes y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar sus gastos personales.

Al observar que su negocio cada día es más próspero a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para implementar comprando otro tipo de mercadería como ropa para todas las edades, con la finalidad que sus ganancias aumenten en su bazar, lo que le permitirá pagar su crédito, mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir apoyando económicamente a sus padres.
texts.en:
Leida is 19 years old, single, and lives at the home of her parents. They receive running water and electricity. Leida resides in the District of Castilla, which is part of the Department of Piura. This area is known for having businesses involving agriculture, livestock breeding, and handicrafts.

Leida established a bazaar where she offers all types of products for everyday household use. She has been in business for five years and does not have any major competition in the area where she lives. Leida always tries to offer the latest merchandise since she has more demand from her customers. This enables her to earn more income to cover her personal expenses.

Noticing that her business has grown more prosperous each day, Leida decided to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN so that she can introduce other types of merchandise, such as clothing for all ages. Her goal is to increase the revenues of her bazaar, which will allow her to repay her loan, improve her quality of life, and continue supporting her parents financially.

loans.use: to purchase new types of merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing.

loans.name: Jesus Joaquina

texts.es:
Jesús tiene 44 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona la actividad que desarrollan es la agricultura, ganadería y artesana.

Jesús desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno (vaca), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que tenga una buena producción de leche, la que ofrece a los mismos pobladores de la zona o lo lleva a vender a los diferentes mercados de Piura, cuenta con clientela fija por la buena calidad de leche que tiene, con sus ingresos solventa sus obligaciones de su hogar.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla de 2500 nuevos soles para compra de alimento balanceado y para realizar revisiones a su ganado,  al alimentarlos bien se incrementará la producción de la leche de vaca y así podrá ofrecerlo aun mejor precio para poder cubrir su crédito otorgado y tener mejoras económicas.  Jesús es una mujer responsable y dedicado a su trabajo y familia, con el ideal de que su familia se supere y sus tengas estudios superiores para poder defenderse en la vida.
texts.en:
Jesús is 44 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and children.  They do not receive basic services.  Jesús resides in the rural section of the District of Tambogrande, which is part of the Department of Piura.  This area is known for having developed businesses involving agriculture, livestock breeding, and handicrafts.  

Jesús has been raising and selling cattle for a few years.  The animals are kept in a corral located outside of her house and are fed a diet of balanced feed and natural grasses to ensure good milk production.  She offers the milk to villagers in her area or takes it to different markets in Piura to sell.  Jesús has an established customer base because of the good quality of milk.  With her income, she is able to meet her household obligations.  

Jesús is requesting a loan of 2500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa through the Seed Capital Program.  The money will be used to buy balanced feed and to pay for veterinary checkups for her cattle.  By being well-fed, her cows will be able to produce more milk that she can sell at a good price.  This will enable her to repay the loan and have improved finances.  

Jesús is a responsible woman who is dedicated to her work and family.  Her ideal situation is for her family is to be successful and to provide a higher education so that her children can fend for themselves in life.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and to pay for veterinary checkups for her dairy cows.

loans.name: Maria De  Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria de los Angeles, tiene la edad 54 de  años, está divorciada  y vive con su nieto. Ella pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de concentrado par engorde de pollos. Ella  cuenta con pollos a su poder y lo que pretende es darle alimento con concentrado para engorde mas rápido. Ella quiere lograr tener sus animales con un buen peso para su posterior venta en el mercado local. Ella quiere generar ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su nieto y crecer con el proyecto de la granja avicola. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
María de los Ángeles, 54, is divorced and lives with her grandson.  She intends to use the loan to buy feed concentrate to raise chickens.  She has chicks in her possession that she intends to feed with feed concentrate so that they will fatten up more quickly.  She wants to get them to good weight for subsequent resale at the local market.  She wants to earn profits for her and her grandson’s wellbeing and to grow with her poultry farm project.

This is the first loans he’s received from Fudecosur.  She’s had no previous loans from state banks.  Fudecosur offered a loan with the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy feed concentrate.

loans.name: Adela Xiomara

texts.en:
Adela lives in Choluteca, Honduras, where she makes a living selling clothing. 

Adela has had this business for many years and wakes early each day to visit her many clients. 

She is requesting a loan of HNL 15,000 to purchase merchandise. 

Adela is a returning client and is grateful to Prisma for the support and service she has received.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, blouses, underwear, watches, swimwear, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Manuel Gustavo

texts.es:
Manuel 47 años, es soltero, vive en casa de unos familiares, la cual cuenta con sólo servicios de luz, ubicado en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Manuel desde hace un año se dedica a la comercialización de animales de corral (cerdos y ovejas), los cría en sus corrales que tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales, una vez que hayan completado su crecimiento ideal, los vende a sus clientes o en los diferentes mercados de la zona  y con los ingresos podrá cubrir sus necesidades y gastos personales.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para compra de alimento balanceado y aves de corral, una vez que los engorde los comercializa a sus clientes, con las ganancias que obtenga pagará el crédito otorgado y mejorará su calidad de vida.  Manuel con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo trata de salir adelante para seguir ayudando económicamente a los familiares con quien vive.
texts.en:
Manuel is 47 years old, single, and lives in the home of some relatives. The only service they receive is electricity. Manuel resides in the District of Tambogrande, which is part of the Department of Piura. This area is known for its businesses involving agriculture, livestock breeding, and handicrafts.

Manuel has been selling domesticated animals, such as pigs and sheep, for one year. The animals are kept in pens located behind his house and are fed a diet of balanced feed and natural grasses.
