When the animals have reached their ideal growth, they are sold to his customers or at different markets in the area. The income he earns is used to cover his needs and personal expenses.

Manuel is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN in order to buy balanced feed and chickens for fattening to sell to his customers. With his earnings, Manuel will be able to repay the loan and improve his quality of life. He works hard and with effort in order to move forward so that he can continue helping his relatives financially.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed and chickens for fattening.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor de 54 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, la cual  es propia y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Pacasmayo que pertenece al departamento de la Libertad.  Los pobladores de éste distrito se dedican a la pesca y al turismo (es un balneario que tiene playas muy bonitas) .

Víctor labora desde hace 4 años realiza servicio de transporte público en su mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) la cual trabaja diariamente mañana y tarde, con las ganancias que obtenga podrá solventar sus gastos y necesidades familiares.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1200 nuevos soles y su destino será para realizar mantenimiento y reparación de su mototaxi que está presentando algunas fallas mecánicas, al encontrarse su unidad móvil en buen estado podrá brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes y aumentarán sus ingresos.  Víctor es un padre de familia trabajador y responsable que con empeño ha sabido sacar adelante a su familia poco a poco, algo que lo tiene muy alegre y orgulloso.
texts.en:
Victor is 54 years old and lives with his family in their own home. They receive all the basic services. Victor resides in the urban section of the District of Pacasmayo, which is part of the Department of La Libertad. The residents of this district engage in trades such as fishing and tourism (there is a resort with very beautiful beaches).

For the past four years, Victor has provided public transportation services using his motorcycle taxi (a vehicle that is used for traveling short distances and has a maximum occupancy of three people). He works every day in the mornings and afternoons. With the income that he earns, Victor is able to cover his expenses and the needs of his family.

He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1200 PEN and will use the money to pay for maintenance and repairs to his motorcycle taxi, which has been experiencing a few mechanical failures. Victor needs his vehicle to be in good condition so that he can provide excellent service to his customers and increase his earnings.

Victor is a hardworking and responsible father who has been able to move his family forward a little bit at a time, an accomplishment that makes him happy and proud.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance and repairs to his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Manuel Isaac

texts.es:
Manuel, vive con su esposa y una hija, es casado y propietario de una farmacia donde ofrece todo tipo de medicamentos, este negocio lo heredó de su abuela, no tiene horario fijo para atender a sus clientes y gracias a Dios ha sido un negocio rentable.
El esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de diferentes tipos de medicamentos como antibioticos, analgesicos, vitaminas, en diferentes presentaciones inyecciones, jarabes, tabletas, esta compra le ayudara a tener mayor variedad de medicamentos para ofrecer a su clientela.
El objetivo de Manuel es diversificar los productos en su farmacia, logrando fortalecerla y mejorando el servicio al cliente así como también sus ingresos para la familia.
texts.en:
Manuel lives with his wife and daughter.  He’s married and owns a pharmacy where he sells all types of medicine.  He inherited the business from his grandmother.  He does not have a fixed schedule to tend to customers and thanks be to God, it’s been a profitable business.

He is asking for a loan to buy different types of medicine like antibiotics, analgesics and vitamins in various presentations like injections, syrups and tablets.  This purchase will help him have a larger variety of medicine to offer customers.

Manuel’s objective is to diversity his pharmacy stock managing to strengthen it and improve customer service as well as family income.

loans.use: to buy medicines.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rabbits, seeds and manure.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos de 44 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, la cual  es propia y cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Olmos que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Los pobladores de éste distrito se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

Santos labora desde hace 6 años realizando servicio de transporte público en su mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) la cual trabaja diariamente hasta las 6 de la tarde, con las ganancias que obtenga podrá solventar sus gastos y necesidades familiares.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla es de 2000 nuevos soles y su destino será para realizar mantenimiento a su mototaxi que está presentando algunas fallas, al encontrarse su unidad móvil en buen estado podrá brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes y esto permitirá aumentar sus ingresos.  Santos es un padre de familia que con esfuerzo y trabajo a sacado adelante a su familia poco a poco, con la idea de que sus hijos tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Santos is 44 years old and lives in his own home with his family. The only service he receives is electricity. Santos resides in the urban section of the District of Olmos, which is part of the Department of Lambayeque. The residents of this district engage in agriculture and livestock breeding.

For the past six years, Santos has been providing public transportation services using his motorcycle taxi (a vehicle that is used for traveling short distances and has a maximum occupancy of three people). He works every day until 6pm. With the income he generates, Santos is able to cover his expenses and his family’s needs.

Santos is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN through its Seed Capital Program. The money will be used to pay for maintenance of his motorcycle taxi which is experiencing some mechanical failures. Santos needs for his vehicle to be in good condition so that he can provide excellent service to his customers and increase his earnings.

He is a father who is able to gradually move his family forward with the intention of providing his children a better future.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Claudina

texts.en:
Claudina lives in Choluteca, Honduras, where she is engaged in a variety of small businesses. She sells clothing out of her home, and she also prepares bread and tamales, which she sells. 

Claudina is requesting a loan of HNL 10,000 to purchase merchandise as well as ingredients for cooking. She hopes to continue working with Prisma in the future in order to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, pants, shirts, blouses, boxer shorts, swimwear, watches, flour, sugar, yeast, corn and rice.

loans.name: Maritza Maximina

texts.es:
Maritza, vive con sus dos hijos, administra una tienda donde ofrece artículos de primera necesidad y una venta de ropa, dichos negocios surgieron por iniciativa propia, no tiene horario fijo para atender a sus clientes ya que sus negocios los tiene en su casa.
Ella  solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos para su tienda y para surtir la venta de ropa,con blusas, camisas, vestidos;  estas compras le ayudara a tener variedad de productos a disposición de sus clientes.
Su sueño es aumentar la clientela para mejorar las ganancias y darles a sus hijos una buena educación para que puedan en el futuro superarse.
texts.en: Maritza lives with her two children and manages a sale of staple goods and clothing, activities that she has developed on her own.  Her hours are variable as she sells out of her home.  She seeks this credit to stock her store with clothing items such as blouses, shirts, dresses and to maintain a good variety available for her clients.  She hopes to grow her clientele and profits in order to educate her children and prepare them for success.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, dresses and staples (sugar, oil, beans).

loans.name: Magdai

texts.es:
La señora Magdai  vive en una ribera muy bonita ya que en el centro de la ribera esta la virgen de Guadalupe quien en es la patrona del pueblo y el doce de diciembre se hace la celebracion mas grande. Ella es viuda y tiene a su responsabilidad dos hijos.

    Ella solito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, como son: azúcar, frijol, aceite, galletas, entre otros, para que así sus clientes encuentren lo que buscan comprar, en esta actividad lleva  siete años y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello a estado sacando adelante a su familia. 
    
      Lo que la inspiro a realizar esta actividad fue su propia familia quienes decidieron apoyarla con ingreso y así mejoras su estado económico, y salir adelante  por sí misma.

     Lo que más desea es que con esta actividad pueda seguir incrementado  su negocio para ahorra y seguir apoyando a su hijos que están creciendo y desea darle una educación.
texts.en:
Magdai lives in a very pretty river basin because Our Lady of Guadalupe is in the middle of it and she’s the patron saint and on the December 12th she is celebrated in a large way.  She is a widow and is responsible for two children.

She asked for the loan to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store; such things as: sugar, beans, oil, cookies, among others, so that her customers will find what they are looking to buy.  She’s been in this activity for seven years and she comments that she does well since she’s been able to raise her family through it.

What inspired her was her own family who wanted to help her with income thus improving her economic situation and to get ahead on her own.

What she most wants from this activity is to continue growing in her business to save up and continue supporting her children who are growing and that she wants to provide a good education to.

loans.use: to pay for stock merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Henry

texts.es:
Henry de 24 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa de unos familiares, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicado en la zona rural del distrito de Olmos que pertenece al departamento de Lamabayeque.  Estas zonas se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

La actividad que desarrolla Henry  es la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas) desde hace unos  4 años, el lugar donde cría  sus animales es en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada  y pastos naturales, una vez que tengan el tamaño y el peso ideal los oferta en los distintos mercados, ya que cuenta con su propia clientela en la ciudad de Piura y con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir sus necesidades personales.

Ha solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más animales y su respectivo alimento para sus animales, lo que le permitirá tenerlos bien alimentados  para ofertarlos a un mejor precio a sus clientes.  Henry es una persona conocida en el lugar donde vive porque siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de sus padres, con la finalidad que en un futuro tenga exito en su negocio.
texts.en:
Henry is 24 years old, single, and lives in the home of some relatives. They do not receive basic services. Henry resides in the rural section of the District of Olmos, which is part of the Department of Lambayeque. This area has businesses that involve agriculture and livestock breeding.

Henry has been raising and selling sheep for approximately four years. The animals are kept in an area behind his house and are fed a diet of balanced feed and natural grasses. Once the animals have reached the ideal size and weight, they are offered for sale at different markets. He has his own customer base in the city of Piura. With his income, Henry is able to cover his personal needs.

He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN so that he can buy more animals and the appropriate feed. The animals will have a proper diet so that they can be sold to his customers at a good price. Henry is a person who is recognized in the place where he lives because he is always concerned about the well-being of his parents. His goal for the future is to be successful in his business.

loans.use: to buy more animals and the appropriate feed.

loans.name: Edvin Alberto

texts.es:
Edvin Alberto es soltero, tiene 29 años de edad, es bachiller en computación, se dedica a la atención de cibercafé, inicio este negocio ya que era sus sueños tenerlo, y lleva 3 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres.

Decide solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para incrementar su negocio, ya que va a comprar accesorios para el mismo como son, audífonos, tintas, memorias, discos compactos, altavoces, etc. Ya que en el futuro espera que se negocio sea amplio y que brinde un servicio de calidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Edvin Alberto, 29, is single.  His degree is in Computing.  He runs an Internet Café.  He started this business because it had been his dream to have it.  He has three years’ experience and has support from his parents.

He decides to request a loan to increase business because he’ll buy accessories for it like: earphones, ink, memory sticks, compact discs, speakers, etc. because he hopes in future that the business will be large and to provide quality customer service.

loans.use: to buy computer accessories.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga de 37 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicado en el distrito de Sullana que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Estas zonas se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

La actividad que desarrolla Olga  es la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas) y caprino (cabras) desde hace unos años, el lugar donde cría  sus animales es en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada  y pastos naturales, una vez que tengan el tamaño y el peso ideal los oferta en los distintos mercados, ya que cuenta con su propia clientela en la ciudad de Piura y con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir sus necesidades diarias de su hogar.

Ha solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar alimento para sus animales, lo que le permitirá tenerlos bien alimentados  para ofertarlos a un buen precio a sus clientes.  Olga es una persona muy conocida en el lugar donde vive porque siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de los suyos, con el finalidad que en un futuro pueda brindarles mejores estudios superiores a sus hijos principalmente.
texts.en:
Olga is 37 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and children. They do not receive basic services. Olga resides in the District of Sullana, which is part of the Department of Piura. This area is known for having businesses that involve agriculture, livestock breeding, and handicrafts.

Olga has been raising and selling sheep and goats for a few years. The animals are kept in an area behind her house and are fed a diet of balanced feed and natural grasses. Once the animals have reached the ideal size and weight, Olga sells them at different markets. She has her own customers in the city of Piura and the income she earns is used to cover her daily household necessities.

Olga is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN so that she can buy feed for her animals. This will allow them to have a good diet so that they can be sold at a good price to her customers. Olga is a person who is well-known in the area where she lives because she is always concerned about her family’s welfare. Her primary goal for the future is to provide her children with the best in higher education.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric and thread for the sewing and corn, chicken and spices for the tamales.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente de 32 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, la cual cuenta sólo con servicio de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Cañaris que pertenece a la provincia de Ferreñafe y al departamento de Lambayeque.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

La actividad que desarrolla Vicente es la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra café, una vez que realiza su cosecha su producto los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de Chiclayo y Lambayeque y así puede obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos diarios de su familia. 

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras como su producto y para el pago de mano de obra cuando se inicie la cosecha de café, con la finalidad de ofertarlo a un mejor precio a los comerciantes y así tener mejoras económicas.  Vicente es un padre de familia que se preocupa por que su familia mejore y tenga algunas comodidades en su hogar.
texts.en:
Vicente is 32 years old and lives in his own home with his family. The only service they receive is electricity. Vicente resides in the rural section of the District of Cañaris, which is part of Ferreñafe Province in the Department of Lambayque. This area is known for its businesses involving agriculture and livestock breeding.

Vicente is a farmer and has his own land on which he grows coffee. Once his crop is harvested, his product is offered at different markets in Chiclayo and Lambayeque. With the income he generates, Vicente is able to cover the daily expenses of his family.

He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN in order to buy fertilizers to improve his land and his crops. He will also pay for labor when the coffee is ready to be harvested. In the end, he hopes to obtain a good price from the merchants and improve financially. Vicente is a father who is concerned about seeing his family get better and acquiring a few comforts for their home.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to pay for labor during the harvest season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure and herbicide for his corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Elvira Dolores

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres 13 De Septiembre.

En este lugar vive la señora Elvira, tiene 40 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 17, 15, 10 y 7 años los mismos que estudian dos en colegio y dos en escuela. El marido es chofer y trabaja en una empresa.
 
Ella tiene un negocio de fabricación y venta de chifles en su casa, junto a sus hijos todos los días se encargan de fabricar este producto que es muy apetecido por los pobladores y luego distribuirlos a las diferentes tiendas y picanterías de la localidad.  También se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, estas ventas las realiza puerta a puerta sobretodo en las tardes cuando se ha desocupado del trabajo de la fabricación de chifles. Lleva 10 años dedicada a esta actividad y le va muy bien creciendo cada dia más.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar manteca en canecas ya que así le salen más baratas y fundas plásticas para envasar los chifles. Está en el Banco Comunal  siete ciclos y le gusta por  La ayuda que siempre ha recibido del banco.

Su sueño es son tener maquinarias para producir a mayor escala sus productos.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known since many years ago as the “City of the Royal Tamarinds” because of the large amount of this fruit that existed back then, the members of the “Mujeres 13 de Septiembre” (13th of September Women) meet every fifteen days.

Elvira, 40, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has four children who are 17, 15, 10 and 7 years of age.  Two of them go to secondary school and two are in elementary school.  Her husband’s a driver and works for a firm.

She has a home-based business making fried banana chips.  Together with her children she makes this product that is highly sought after by local residents and that she then distributes to various local stores and snack shops every day.  She also sells all types of clothes door to door, especially in the afternoon when she’s finished making the banana chips.  She’s been in business ten years and does very well, growing more each day.

She will use this loan to buy lard in tubs because they are less expensive that way and plastic bags to package the chips.  

She’s been in the communal bank for seven cycles and she likes it because of the help she always gets from the bank.  Her dream is to have machinery to produce her products in a larger scale.

loans.use: to buy lard and plastic bags.

loans.name: William David

texts.es:
William de 29 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona es agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

William se dedica a la agricultura, tiene sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón, actividad que realiza desde hace 4 años, además de ser productos consumido diariamente por las personas, una vez que realiza su cosecha lo comercializa en los diferentes mercados de la zona y fuera de ella,  con los ingresos que adquiera puede brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y esposa.

A observar que su negocio va creciendo y a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras de cultivo y su producto, también para el pago de mano de obra por los trabajos de dehierbo y poda del cultivo y una vez que se inicie la cosecha de su limón, con las ganancias que obtenga podrá pagar su crédito y solventar las necesidades diarias de su familia.  William con trabajo y dedicación le brinda lo mejor a sus hijos, con la intensión de que ellos sean mejores en la vida y logren todos sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Sr. William is 29 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and children. The only service they receive is electricity. William resides in the rural section of the District of Tambogrande, which is part of the Department of Piura. This area has businesses involving farming, livestock breeding, and handicrafts.

William has been farming on his own land for four years. He grows lemons as well as other products that people consume on a daily basis. Once his crops are harvested, he sells them at different markets within and outside of the area. The income he earns helps to provide a better quality of life for his wife and children.

Noticing that his business has grown, William decided to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN so that he can buy fertilizers to improve his farmland and his product. He will also pay for labor to have the weeds removed from his land so that he can begin harvesting lemons. With the revenue he generates, he will be able to repay the loan and cover the daily needs of his family. Through work and dedication, William will be able to provide for his children. He intends for them to have the best in life so that they can achieve all of their goals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay for labor to help with removing weeds.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es:
Shirley  vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla con su esposo y su hijo de 12 años de edad; ella se dedica a la actividad comercial, que  ejerce desde su miscelánea ubicada  en su propia casa, donde vende productos energéticos,alopaticos y mercancías variadas tales como prendas de vestir, accesorios, papelería y prodtos de drogueria etc. Su negocio inició cuando decidió generar ingresos para su hogar de alguna manera y fue apoyada por su esposo para lograrlo, así fue como  inicialmente y de manera independiente,  empezó vendiendo productos energéticos de varios laboratorios a sus vecinos y amigos, con el tiempo también agregó prendas de vestir,  productos de belleza y poco a poco toda mecánica por la que  sus clientes preguntaban y ella no tenía. 
Su sueño es adicionar a los productos energéticos, mayor volumen de drogas alopáticas de consumo libre, porque quiere integrar a su miscelánea la línea de farmacia con mayor fuerza. Su desafió es tener el suficiente capital de trabajo para comprar en mayor volumen y obtener  buenos descuentos por su compra de contado. En la actualidad vende de contado en el punto comercial,  pero tiene una cartera de clientes rentables que cada día le recomiendan nuevos compradores y es necesario complacerlos. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar  especialmente ropa que tiene encargada. Mientras Shirley trabaja sigue fortaleciendo su negocio con sus esfuerzos y generando una rentabilidad no menor del 21%, una rotación de inventarios de 10 días y una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 15.
texts.en:
Shirley lives in the city of Barranquilla with her ​​husband and 12 year old son.  She has a business which she runs from her general store located in her home, where she sells energy products and miscellaneous goods such as clothing, accessories, stationery, etc.  

Her business began when she decided to somehow generate income for her household, and her husband supported her in it.  It was in this way that she initially and independently began selling energy products from several laboratories to neighbors and friends.  She eventually also added clothing, beauty products, and gradually all the other items that customers had requested that she didn't stock.

Her dream is to add a number of freely available allopathic drugs to her energy products, because she wants to integrate a pharmacy line into her general store.  Her challenge is having enough working capital to buy in greater volume and to get good discounts for cash purchases. 

Today she sells items from her business locale for cash, but she has a roster of profitable customers who recommend new buyers to her on a daily basis, and it is necessary for her to keep them happy.  This is the reason that she is coming for a Kiva loan.  It is her first financing through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, specifically to buy clothing that has been ordered. 

While Shirley is working, she continues to strengthen her business through her efforts.  She generates a return of no less than 21%, an inventory turnover of 10 days and a turnover of accounts receivable of 15 days.

loans.use: specifically to buy clothes.

loans.name: Pedro Rafael

texts.en:
Pedro lives in Choluteca, Honduras, where for the last eight years he has made a living by selling plastic goods, paper plates and cups, and flatware. 

Pedro sells his wares at a stand at the local market and has a large web of clients that includes local hotels and restaurants. 

He is requesting a loan of HNL 10,000 to purchase merchandise. Pedro hopes to keep working with Prisma in order to grow his small business.

loans.use: to purchase plastic bowls, buckets, strainers, cups, plates and flatware.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Juana Francisca es viuda, tiene 58 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 1 hijo que no estudia y la apoya en el negocio que tiene, se dedica al comercio, a la venta de muebles que los compra a los fabricantes y poder revenderlo y obtener un poco de ganancia, inicio este negocio junto con su esposo y hasta el momento ella sigue con este negocio y lleva 17 años de experiencia.

Decide solicitar un préstamo para aumentar su venta, para comprar mesas, sillas, paletas, gabeteros, estantes, roperos, etc. Espera en el futuro tener un negocio más surtido y más grande y así poder generar mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Juana Francisca, 58, is a widow who didn’t have the opportunity to go to school.  She has 1 son who is not studying but helps her with her business.  She sells furniture that she buys from manufacturers and resells for a small income.  She began the business with her husband and has had 17 years of experience with it.

She decided to request a loan to increase her sales to buy tables, chairs, sofas, dressers, shelves, wardrobes, etc.  She hopes to be able to have more selection and more items in her business in the future so she can earn more.

loans.use: to buy furniture for resale

loans.name: Adita Mariana

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres 13 De Septiembre.

En este lugar vive la señora Adita, tiene 48 años de edad, está divorciada pero de esa relación tiene seis  hijos, cuatro de ellos  mayores de edad y dos de 17 y 14 años que estudian en colegio, cinco de sus hijos aun viven en su casa. Nuestra amiga lleva más de tres años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ella puede sacar su negocio adelante.

Nuestra amiga con la finalidad de ganarse para sus sustento diario y el de sus hijos hace ocho años atrás puso un bar en su casa en el mismo vende bebidas  como gaseosas, jugos, cervezas, además de bocadillos para picar como hamburguesas,  empanadas, corviches y productos elaborados, trabaja  de viernes a domingo con la ayuda de sus hijos desde las 14h00 hasta las 22h00.  Gracias a su trabajo ella ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos después de que se separo.

Este crédito es para comprar, gaseosas, aguas, cervezas, y víveres para preparar los alimentos.
 
Sus sueños son tener un gran negocio y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of the community bank named "Mujeres de 13 de Septiembre", meaning "The Women of September 13" meet in the city of Portoviejo, the capital city of Manabi, which has been known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds.

Here we meet Adita. She is 48 years old and she is divorced, but from that relationship she has six children. Four of her children are grown and the two youngest are 17 and 14 years of age and they attend high school. Five of her children still live at home. Our friend has been with her communal bank for more than three years and she appreciates it becuase it is through loans that she has been able to move her business forward.

Eight years ago our friend set up a bar inside of her house with the goal of earning a daily income for herself and for her children. She also sells soft drinks, juices, beer, and snacks such as hamburgers, savory pastries, and ready to eat products. She works from Friday to Sunday and her children help her from 2:00 pm to 10:00 pm. It is thanks to her work that she has been able to provide for her children following her separation from her husband.

This loan will be used to purchase soft drinks, juices, beer, and grocery products to prepare foods.

Her dream is to have a successful business and to see her children complete their studies.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, beer, juices, and grocery products.

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.es:
Eleuteria, vive con su esposo, un hijo, la nuera y su nieto, tiene un negocio D. Jarcia que consiste en confección D. hamacas, dicho negocio surgió por iniciativa propia, atienD. a sus clientes todos los días a tiempo completo. 
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. hilo D. seda para la elaboración D. las hamacas, esta compra le ayudara a tener y realizar un mejor trabajo y aumentar la produccion.  
Su principal objetivo es ayudar a su hijo a ser independiente y a que tenga su propia vivienda junto a su esposa y su hijo.
texts.en:
Eleuteria lives with her husband, one son, her daughter-in-law and her grandson. She has a twine-based business that consists of hammock production. She started up this business under her own initiative. She attends her clients every day, full-time.

She requests a loan to purchase a silk twine to make hammocks. This purchase will help her to maintain her business and to carry out higher quality work, and to increase production.

Her main goal is to help her son to become independent so that he will have his own house in which to live with his wife and his son.

loans.use: to purchase twine of different colors to make hammocks.

loans.name: Alexandra Isabel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres 13 De Septiembre.

Aquí conocimos a Alexandra tiene 25 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de 6 años que estudian en escuela. Ella vive en casa de su mamá. Es auxiliar de enfermería y labora en un laboratorio clínico.
 
Además de trabajar en un laboratorio clínico nuestra amiga tiene  una papelería en su casa, en su negocio le ayuda sus mamá ya que ella pasa todo el dia allí, pero en sus momentos libres y fines de semana ella se encarga de su negocio. Empezó su negocio con el primer crédito que recibió de la institución por lo cual está muy agradecida ya  que con esto gana lo suficiente para sacar adelante a su pequeño hijo a pesar de que esta sola.

Este crédito lo va a invertir en comprar útiles escolares y así seguir aumentando su negocio. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido y agradable.
 
Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su pequeño hijo y agrandar más su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank named "Mujeres 13 de Septiembre", meaning "The Women of September 13" meet every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo, the capital city of Manabi, which has been known as the city of the royal tamarinds for many years.

Here we met Alexandra. She is 25 years old and the single mother of a 6-year old son who is in primary school. She lives in her mother's house. She is a nurse assistant and she works in a medical laboratory.

In addition to her medical laboratory work, our friend also has a school-supply store in her house. Her mother helps her with her business because she is at home all day. But during her spare time and on the weekends she takes care of her business. She started out her business with the first loan she received from the institution, for which she is very thankful. It is through this business that she earns enough to provide for her young son, despite being alone.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of school supplies in order to keep her business growing. This is her second loan cycle with her communal bank and she appreciates it because her group is very unified and pleasant.

Her dreams are to give her young son only the best and to to further increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
Faustino, vive con su esposa, tres hijos y un nieto, agricultor, siembra maíz, este negocio es el patrimonio que ha tenido durante toda la vida, atiende sus labores todos los días a tiempo completos junto a su familia.
El esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de semilla y fertilizante para su cosecha, esta compra le ayudara a tener una mejor cosecha para ofrecer a sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos familiares.
El objetivo de él es obtener mejores ganancias gracias a un mejor trabajo para poder darle el estudio adecuado a todos sus hijos, contibuyendo a la superacion de ellos..
texts.en:
Faustino lives with his wife, three children, and a grandson. He is a farmer who grows corn. His business has been in his family for his entire life. Faustino performs all of the daily chores every day with his family on a full-time basis.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy seeds and fertilizers for his crops. This purchase will help him produce a better crop to offer to his customers and improve the family income. His goal is to generate more revenue by doing a better job. This will help him provide an adequate education for all of his children that will contribute toward their success.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Armando José

texts.es:
Don Armando de profesion confeccion, que junto con su esposa trabajan en la costura, con mas de tres años de experiencias, en donde ha logrado aumentar su produccion, al tener prestamo en Afodenic, siendo de gran sastifaccion al vender mas.
Como objetivo es tener su local propio de taller.  Logrando tener mas espacio. Lo que produce mas es camisetas blancas, y camisetas a colores, el cual son entregada a un solo proveedor.
Con este nuevo prestamo comprara maquina electrica plana, semi industrial para seguir produciendo su ropa en variedad y estilo.
texts.en:
Armando is a tailor by profession. He and his wife work in garment-making and have more than three years of experience, during which they have increased their production. With the help of loans from AFODENIC, Armando feels very satisfied to be able to sell more.

Armando's goal is to have his own sewing shop in order to have more space. He makes white shirts and other colors of shirts, which he delivers to just one supplier.

He will use this new loan to buy a semi-industrial electric sewing machine so that he can continue producing clothes in a variety of styles.

loans.use: to buy a semi-industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Yvonny Elisabeth

texts.es:
Yvonny de 43 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de luz solamente, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Paijan que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.    Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Yvonny se dedica a la venta de ropa para todas las edades y de calzado femenino, negocio que a colocado en su domicilio desde hace varios años, su mercadería lo ofrece a sus clientes, también trae a pedido, tratando de tener mayor demanda de clientes y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Al observar que su negocio cada día es más próspero a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería y abastecer su tienda con productos innovadores, con la finalidad que su clientela siga aumentando para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Yvonny, age 43, lives with her husband and children in her own house.  The only service the house has is electricity.  It is located in the rural zone of the Paijan district in the La Libertad department.  The zone is known for farming and its livestock.

Yvonny sells clothes for all ages and women’s shoes.  Her business has been in her home for several years.  She has merchandise to sell to her customers, and she also takes orders.  She is trying to have more customer demand. That way she will be able to get more income to pay for the family expenses.

Upon observing that her business is more prosperous each day, she has seen the need to request a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  She will buy a greater quantity of merchandise and stock her store with new products.  She will do this so that she continues getting more customers, to be able to pay for her loan, and to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: tobuy a greater quantity of merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Leonor Cristina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres 13 De Septiembre.

En este lugar vive la señora Leonor, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen siete hijos, todos son mayores de edad y cuatro de ellos aun viven en su casa, también vive con ella un nieto de 7 años que está en la escuela y que lo ha criado desde pequeño y es como su hijo. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que para ganarse algo para propio y con esto contribuir a los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de sabanas y edredones, tiene un pequeño local en su  casa aunque dos días  a la semana también realiza sus ventas  puerta a puerta, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Picoaza ya que allá le entregan más barato. Lleva en este negocio tres años y le está yendo bastante bien.

Este crédito es para comprar sabanas, edredones y almohadas. Lleva más de dos años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado a salir adelante.

Su sueño es ver a su nieto grande y estudiado.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi, a city known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the communal bank "Mujeres 13 de Septiembre" meets every 15 days.

This is where Leonor, aged 55, lives.  She is married and has 7 children, all of whom are now adults.  Four of them still live in her house, and she also lives with a 7 year-old grandson who is in school and who she has raised as her own since he was small.  Her husband is a security guard.

Leonor is a great housewife who, in order to earn something on her own and contribute to the household expenses, has a business selling bed sheets and comforters.  She has a small store in her house, and 2 days a week she also sells door-to-door.  She sells her goods on credit, and collects every 15 days.  She goes to purchase her merchandise in Picoaza, since there she can find the goods at the lowest cost.  She has had this business for 3 years, and she is doing quite well.

This loan will be used to buy sheets, comforters and pillows.  She has been in her communal bank for more than 2 years, and she likes it because of the loans that have helped her to get ahead.

Her dream is to see her grandchild grow up and become educated.

loans.use: to buy sheets, comforters and pillows

loans.name: Asunciona

texts.es:
Asunciona es una madre de familia de 49 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicado en el distrito de Mórrope que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turismo.

Asunciona se dedica desde algunos años a la crianza y comercialización de ganado porcino (cerdos), su corral lo tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada, una vez que lleguen a su crecimiento óptimo lo puedan ofrecer a sus clientes y con los ingresos que obtenga puede solventar los gastos de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más animales y su respectivo alimento, una vez que se engorden los vende a los diferentes mercados de su zona, con la finalidad de que obtenga un mejor precio por ellos y así pueda tener más ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Asunciona es una persona trabajadora y empeñosa que lo único que quiere es que su familia salga adelante y se supere.
texts.en:
Asunciona, age 49, lives with her husband and children in her own house.  The house has no basic services.  It is located in the Mórrope district in the Lambayeque department.  The zone is known for its farming, cattle, and tourism.

Asunciona has been raising and selling livestock (pigs) for several years.  Her corral is in the area behind her house.  She feeds them balanced feed, and once they have reached their optimum growth she is able to sell them to her customers.  With the income that she gets she is able to pay for the household expenses.

She has requested a loan for 1,000 from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy more animals and balanced feed.  Once they are fattened she sells them at different markets in her zone.  She does this to get a better price for them.  That way she can have more income in order to have a better quality of life.

Asunciona is a hard-working and tenacious person.  The only thing she wants is for her family to get ahead and succeed.

loans.use: to buy animals and balanced feed.

loans.name: Maria Rosaura

texts.es: Maria Rosaura: de 29 años ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda desde hace 2 años en la comunidad donde vive,ella nos cuenta que inicio su negocio vendiendo un poco de mercaderia en ropa de segunda,ahora ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de una paca de ropa de segunda ya que nececita invertir mas para poder generar mas ganancias y aumentar sus ventas y asi de la misma manera estar mejor economicamente.
texts.en: Maria Rosaura is 29 years old.  She has been working selling second-hand clothing for the last two years in the community where she lives.  She tells us that she began her business by selling a small amount of second hand clothing merchandise.  Now she is requesting this loan for the purchase of a bale of second hand clothes, as she needs to invest more in order to generate more earnings and grow her sales, and in this same manner to become better off financially.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina de 24 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Chepén que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.    Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad comercial, agrícola y ganadera.

Marina se dedica a la venta de ropa para todas las edades de forma ambulatoria en el mercado de la zona donde vive, negocio al cual se dedica desde hace varios años, su mercadería lo ofrece a sus clientes, con los ingresos que pueda adquirir podrá solventar sus gastos familiares.

Al observar que su negocio va creciendo a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería y abastecer su negocio con productos innovadores, con la finalidad que su clientela siga aumentando para poder pagar su crédito,  mejorar económicamente y brindarle a su familia un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Marina, age 24, lives with her husband and children in her own house.  The house has all of the basic services.  It is located in the urban zone in the Chepén district in the La Libertad department.  The zone is known for its commercial activities, farming, and livestock.

Marina sells clothes for all ages in an itinerant manner.  She sells at the market in the area where she lives.  She has been in this business, selling her merchandise to her customers, for several years.  With the income she is able to get she is able to pay for the family expenses.

Upon seeing that her business is growing, she has seen the necessity to request a loan for 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  She will use the loan to buy a greater quantity of merchandise and to stock her store with new products.  She will does this so that she continues to get more customers, to be able to pay for her loan, to improve financially, and to give her family a better future.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of merchandise  to stock her store.

loans.name: María Roibertina

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Primero de Mayo, vive por la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia es de clima frió, su gente es amable, cordial y mantienen su cultura y tradiciones, laboran en el comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, mucha de su población ha migrado en busca de mejores oportunidades de trabajo.

Doña María tiene 56 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos, todos son mayores de edad, cinco de ellos son casados, tres viven independientes y dos  viven en su casa y comparten gastos del hogar, su última hija de 19 años está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo se encuentra fuera del país, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.

La Señora. María se dedica a labrar sus tierras y sus cosechas son solo para el consumo de su hogar, también se dedica a la cría de ganado, cerdos y borregos  a los que los vende en su comunidad, pero a lo que más le dedica es a su tienda la misma que atiende todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una vecina a este hermoso grupo de mujeres,  el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en productos de primera necesidad para incrementar en su tienda.
 
Su meta es  incrementar su tienda y tener más animales.
texts.en:
Señora Maria is a member of the Primero de Mayo communal bank. She lives in Cumbe parish. This parish has a cold climate, however its people are friendly and warm-hearted and they maintain their culture and traditions. They work in stores, raise animals and do agriculture. Much of its population has migrated in search of better work opportunities.

Doña María is 56 years old, married and, as fruit of her conjugal union, has conceived 6 children, all of whom are adults: five of them are married, three live independently and two live in her home and share household expenses. Her last child, a 19 year old daughter, is studying at a school in the city. Her husband is outside of the country and the house that she lives in is her property.

Señora Maria works her land and her crops are only for household consumption.  She also raises cattle, pigs and sheep, which she sells within her community. However she devotes most of her time to her store, which she runs every day from 6 in the morning until 10 at night.

This is her first loan with the communal bank. A neighbor invited her to join this beautiful group of women. She will invest the money from her loan in staple items for her store.

Her goal is to increase the essential goods in her store and to have more animals.

loans.use: to buy essential goods for her store.

loans.name: Zoila Emperatriz

texts.es:
Zoila, vive con sus tres hijos, administra una tienda en la cual ofrece artículos de primera necesidad, este negocio surgió gracias a su madre quien la apoyo para instalarlo en su vivienda, no tiene horario fijo para atender a sus clientes.
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de gaseosas, frijol, arroz, aceite, jabón, frutas, verduras y mas mercadería que es demanda por sus clientes, esta compra le ayudara a aumentar tanto su inventario como sus ventas.
Su mayor sueño es seguir trabajando para mejorar sus ingresos y poder darles el estudio a sus hijos hasta terminar su carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Zoila lives with her three children and manages a store where she sells basic staples. This business came about thanks to her mother who supported her in starting it up in her living quarters. She has no fixed schedule for waiting on her customers. 

She is seeking a loan to purchase soft drinks, beans, rice, oil, soap, fruits, vegetables and other merchandise requested by her customers. This purchase will allow her to increase in her inventory along with her sales. 

Her greatest dream is to keep working in order to increase her income, and be able provide schooling for her children through the completion of a university degree.

loans.use: ro purchase soft drinks, beans, rice, oil, soap, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Rocio Del Carmen

texts.es: Rocio vive en Sabanagrande, municipio del departamento del Atlántico y se dedica a la preparación y venta de comidas. Ella tiene un hijo de 24 años de edad con quien sueña verlo feliz y muy exitoso.  Su negocio indicó hace 8 años vendiendo almuerzos entre sus vecinos, hasta que el jefe de una empresa cercana probó “las delicias de su sazón “y le dio el contrato de su empresa. Desde ese momento se han incrementado sus ventas y todos los días proyecta su crecimiento., hacia otros mercados, pero el insuficiente capital de trabajo para extenderse es su gran desafío. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el  cual comprará materias primas como arroz, aceite y víveres, con tal de tener un mayor stock de inventarios.  Su sueño es lograr importantes adecuaciones para su vivienda donde haya un espacio para su restaurante visiblemente confortable, para quienes trabajan pero especialmente ara que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos y cómodos.  En la actualidad su negocio tiene liquidez y sus ventas presentan estabilidad y las hace  de contado en las tiendas de su barrio, con una frecuencia diaria, razón por la cual sus inventarios rotan rápidamente y se le incrementa el costo porque  no tiene descuentos por las cantidades que compra.  Esta es una de las soluciones que obtendría con su credikiva al invertirlo en sus materias primas.
texts.en:
Rocío lives in Sabanagrande, a municipality in Atlántico Department, and works preparing and selling meals.  She has a 24-year-old son that she happily lives with and dreams of seeing him being happy and very successful.  She started her business 8 years ago selling lunches among her neighbors until the boss at a nearby firm tasted “the deliciousness of her seasoning” and gave her the contract for his firm.  Since then, sales have increased and she projects daily growth toward other markets.

However, insufficient working capital is her great challenge to attain this growth.  This is why she’s calling on her Kiva loan, the first financing she’s done with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy raw materials like rice, oil and foodstuffs in order to have a larger stock of inventory.  Her dream is to make adequate adjustments to her house so that she’ll have visibly comfortable space for her restaurant for those who work there but especially for her customers so that they will feel satisfied and comfortable.

At present, the business has liquidity and her sales are stable.  She purchases daily from local stores and pays cash so her inventory turns over quickly but costs increase because she doesn’t get any discounts for volume purchases.  This is one of the solutions her Kiva loan will provide when she uses it to buy raw materials.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like rice, oil and foodstuffs.

loans.name: María Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Primero de Mayo, vive por la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia es de clima frió, su gente es amable, cordial y mantienen su cultura y tradiciones, laboran en el comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, mucha de su población ha migrado en busca de mejores oportunidades de trabajo.

La Señora. María es muy joven tiene 21 años y vive en unión libre, fruto de esa unión ha concebido un hijo de 1 año. Su esposo labora como albañil, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su suegra con quien comparte los gastos del hogar.
 
Nuestra socia labora como empleada domestica, esta actividad la desempeña hace 5 años y trabaja de lunes a viernes. En su casa se dedica a la cría de gallinas las que son para la venta y consumo.
  
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada  por su suegra, este crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para la construcción de su casa.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank "Primero de Mayo."  She lives in Cumbe parish, where the climate is cold and the people are friendly and maintain their culture and traditions.  The residents of this area work in retail trade, animal husbandry and agriculture.  Much of the population has migrated in search of better job opportunities.  

Maria is very young; she is 21 years old and is in a common-law marriage which has produced a 1 year-old child.  Her husband works as a bricklayer.  Maria does not have her own home, and so she lives in her mother-in-law's house and shares the household expenses with her.

Maria works as a domestic.  She has been doing this work for 5 years, and she works Mondays through Fridays.  In her house, she also raises hens for sale and for household consumption.

This is the first loan that she has taken from her communal bank.  She was invited to join the bank by her mother-in-law.  She will invest this loan in construction materials for the construction of her house.

Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Doña Alba Luz, tiene su propio negocio, la venta de comida con mas de dieciseis años en las ventas, en su especialidad la venta de baho. En donde ha logrado mucha clientela, haciendolo de forma ambulante, aunque se queda en una sola parte todos los dia. Y por las noches hace fritanga en su casa. 
Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, y ambos apoyan  a sus hijos para el bien comun de la familia.
Alba Luz, ha crecido en producir mas comida, gracias a los financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado en oncce ciclos, de los cuales parte de estos ha sido para la infraestructura de su casa. asi como el aumento en venta de comida.
Hoy con este nuevo prestamo, sera para la compra de granos basicos: arroz, frijoles, azucar, bidon de aceite, carnes de res, de cerde y pollo para elabarorar las ricas comidas, a si como frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
Alba Luz has her own business, selling meals, with more than 16 years experience. Her specialty is "baho," a meat and yucca dish, for which she has earned many customers. She sells meals in the streets from one locale in the daytime, then evenings, she sells a stew from her house.

Alba can count on her husband's help, and both parents assist their children for the common good of the family.  Alba's business has grown as she cooks more meals, thanks to loans provided by Afodenic during 11 loan cycles. A part of these loans has been used to improve the infrastructure of her house, as well as for increasing the sale of meals.

Today, with this new loan, Alba will buy basic grains, including rice, plus beans, sugar, a container of cooking oil, beef, pork, and chicken, for preparing rich meals, plus fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to invest in meat, chicken, basic grains, fruit, and vegetables, to prepare tasty dishes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy corn and firewood

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La Señora. Juliana es socia del banco comunal Primero de Mayo, vive por la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia es de clima frió, su gente es amable, cordial y mantienen su cultura y tradiciones, laboran en el comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, mucha de su población ha migrado en busca de mejores oportunidades de trabajo.

Doña Juliana tiene 46 años, es madre soltera de 4 hijos, una de sus hijas es casada, vive en su casa y comparte los gastos del hogar, sus tres hijas solteras tienen 19, 16 y 7 años de edad, sus dos hijas trabajan y la ultima hija estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. La casa en la que habita es de su propiedad siendo el fruto de su trabajo.

La Señora. Juliana se dedica a la cría de ganado, borregos, cuyes y gallinas los que los vende en su comunidad.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una vecina. Este crédito lo va a invertir para la compra de materiales de construcción para hacer unos arreglos a su casa.
 
Su meta es tener una mejor casa.
texts.en:
Juliana is a member of the May 1st Commmunity Bank. She lives near the town of Cumbe, where the climate is cold and the people are kind, polite, and work at maintaining their culture and traditions. They work in commerce, raising animals, and in agriculture. Much of the population has moved in search of better work opportunities.

Juliana is 46 years old and a single mother of four children. One of her daughters is married, lives with her in her home, and shares the expenses of the home. Her three single daughters are 19, 16, and 7 years old. The older two work and the youngest studies at a small school in the city. The house where they live is on their own property and is the fruit of their labor.

Juliana works raising livestock: rams, guinea pig, and chickens, that she sells in her community. This is her first loan with the community bank and she was invited to join by a friend. She will use the loan to buy construction materials to repair her home. Her goal is to have a better house.

loans.use: buy construction materials

loans.name: Roxana De Jesus

texts.es:
Roxana, vive con su esposo y sus hijos,tiene una venta de ropa y de pan, estos negocios surgieron por iniciativa propia, no tiene horario fijo para atender a sus clientes ya que los negocios los tiene en su casa y pasa tiempo completo en ellos.
Ella necesita un préstamo para la compra camisas, pantalones, faldas y más mercadería que es demanda por sus clientes para sus negocios, esta compra le ayudara en variar la venta de ropa y tener más materia prima para la elaboración del pan. 
Ella quiere mejorar sus negocios y sus ingresos para el bienestar de su familia y ser un buen cliente con moral de pago, para tener la oportunidad de crecer en el comercio.
texts.en:
Roxana, who lives with her husband and children, sells clothes and bread.  These businesses came about due to her own initiative.  She does not have  fixed business hours to attend to her customers as she works from her home and spends her full time on the businesses.

Roxana needs a loan to buy shirts, pants, skirts and other merchandise that is in demand by customers for her business.  This acquisition will help her to vary the clothes she sells and give her more raw materials for making bread.

She wants to improve her business and increase revenue for the welfare of her family. She is a good client with good ethics in payment.  She is grateful for the opportunity to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, skirts and other merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Maria Marcela

texts.es:
Doña Maria es pequeña comerciante, su negocio es la venta de fritanga y gaseosas, golosinas, con mas de catorce años en las ventas.
Hoy en dia aumentado mas su produccion de alimentos en comida variada, al aumentar su capital, el cual lo ha hecho atravez de prestamos en Afodenic, siendo de gran oportunidad para la inversion por ser aplazos accesibles.
Hoy con este nuevo prestamo sera para la compra de mercaderia variada en alimentos en la compra de carne, pollo, chicharon, yuca, repollo, quinientos platanos, tomate, vinagre, gabachas, vasos y platos desechables, asi como vidon de aceite, arroz, frijoles, azucar, frutas y verduras para seguir ofertando a sus clientes variedad.
texts.en:
Doña Maria has a small business; her business is selling fried food, soft drinks, and candy, and she has been making sales for over fourteen years.

Today, she is further increasing her food production of varied dishes with increased capital, which she achieved through loans with Afodenic.  These loans are a great opportunity for investment with affordable installments.

Now this new loan will be for the purchase of varied food-related supplies.  She will buy meat, chicken, pork, yucca, cabbage, five hundred plantains, tomatoes, vinegar, aprons, cups and plates, as well as a drum of oil, rice, beans, sugar, fruits and vegetables to continue offering variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, basic grains, plantains, sodas. and other products that will help her to grow her sales of fried food.

loans.name: Celia Marina

texts.es:
La Señora. Celia es socia del banco comunal Yanbal, vive por el sector de Molleturo, lugar en donde su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y comercio, son personas que mantienen su cultura y tradiciones siendo muy amable y carismáticas.
 
Doña Celia tiene 60 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos quienes son todos mayores de edad, 5 son casados e independientes y dos trabajan. Su esposo trabaja en un restaurante, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Celia se dedica  a los quehaceres de su hogar, allí cría chanchos, aves de corral, cuyes y ganado a los que los vende en su comunidad. También se dedica a la agricultura y su cosecha es para su consumo.
 
Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de ganado para la cría y venta.
 
Su meta es mejorar sus potreros y su sueño es tener una mejor casa.
texts.en:
Celia is a member of the communal bank "Yanbal".  She lives in the Molleturo sector, a place where people are work in animal husbandry, agriculture and trade.  They are people who maintain their culture and traditions and are very friendly and charismatic.
 
Celia is 60 years old, married, and this relationship produced 7 children who are all grown, 5 are married and independent and 2 are working. Her husband works in a restaurant.  The house where they live is their own property.

Celia works on the tasks at home, breeding pigs, poultry, guinea pigs and cattle that are sold in her community.  She also works in farming and the harvest is for their own consumption.
 
This is her second loan with the communal bank and she will invest in the purchase of cattle for breeding and selling.
 
Celia's goal is to improve her pastures and her dream is to have a better house.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Urbana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Vamos Juntas” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco.  Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una D. las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

En el lugar conocimos a la señora Urbana que nació en la ciudad D. Paruro (Cusco, Perú), tiene 55 años D. edad, está casada y fruto D. esta unión tiene cinco hijos, y nos cuenta:

“Actualmente, Yo vivo en la ciudad del Cusco y donD. realizo mis actividades, Yo me dedico a  la elaboración D. mana y llevo a vender a diferentes ciudades como Urubamba, Calca y Abancay. Ya son varios años con este negocio y me va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiero el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplos arroz, maíz, fideos, azúcar, papel y otras cosas más que se necesitan para elaboracion”.
texts.en:
The “Vamos Juntas” (Let’s Go Together) Communal Bank meets once a month in the city of Cusco.  Cusco is known for its tourism, its commerce, and for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because one of the Seven New Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is there.

This is where we meet Urbana, who was born in the city of Paruro (Cusco, Perú).  She is 55 years old, married, and has five children.  She tells us, “I currently live in the city of Cusco, which is where I conduct my business activities.  I make "mana" (a candy similar to marzipan), and I take it to sell in different cities like Urubamba, Calca, and Abancay.  I have had this business for several years, and it is going very well for me."

At this point I need the loan to buy more supplies like rice, corn, noodles, paper, and other things that are needed for food preparation.

loans.use: to buy supplies like rice, corn, noodles, paper, and other things.

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es:
Carmen, vive con su esposo y una hija, es propietaria D. un salón D. belleza, este negocio surgió por iniciativa propia gracias a su madre quien le enseño el oficio, trabaja a tiempo completo durante todos los días.
Ella, está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. vitrinas y cosméticos (maquillajes, tintes para el cabello, labiales) para mejorar su negocio y darles una mejor atención a sus clientes.
Su objetivo es tener su negocio más fortalecido para mejorar los ingresos y terminar la construccion D. su casa.
texts.en:
Carmen lives with her husband and one daughter.  She is the owner of a beauty salon.  This business came of her own initiative, thanks to her mother who taught her the profession.  She works full-time every day.

She is asking for a loan to purchase glass showcases and cosmetics (makeup, hair dyes, lipsticks) in order to improve her business and to take better care of her customers.

Her goal is to have a stronger business to improve her income and to finish the construction of her house.

loans.use: To purchase glass showcases and cosmetics (makeup, hair dyes)

loans.name: Maria Ramosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MARIA ELENA MOYANO”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia Maria; La socia tiene 56 años de edad, la socia es casada y  tiene 3 hijos de 38, 30, 14 años de edad; la socia es docente de profesión y se dedica a la Dirección de su jardín, la socia se dedica a administrar el jardín de niños llamado Lucesitas; el jardín es muy bonito y acogedor, en este jardín  trabajan toda la familia, los esposos y las hijas; la socia  requiere el crédito para invertir en la compra de materiales para implementar el jardín la socia suele comprar, papeles, como las hojas A-4, papel lustre, papel seda, corrospum, crayones, temperas, colores entre otros materiales didácticos para implementar el jardín de niños. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de papeles en millares como las hojas A-4, corrospum, papel seda, papel lustre, colores, crayones, temperas.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Maria belongs to the communal bank "Maria Elena Moyano."  This bank is located in the Huanchac district of Cusco province in the department of Cusco.

Maria is 56 years old, married, and has 3 children aged 38, 30 and 14.  She is a teacher by profession, and works as a kindergarten administrator.  She runs a kindergarten called "Lucesitas," which is a very nice and cozy school.  Her whole family works in this kindergarten, including her daughters and their husbands.  Maria needs a loan to invest in materials for her kindergarten.  She will buy paper, such as A-4 photocopy paper, construction paper, crayons, tissue paper, foam craft sheets, paints, colored pencils, and other teaching materials for her kindergarten.  She requests a loan to invest in reams of photocopy paper, foam sheets, tissue paper, construction paper, colored pencils, crayons and paints.

Maria is grateful for the support that she is being granted, and as such pledges to make all of her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy reams of photocopy paper, foam sheets, tissue paper, construction paper, colored pencils, crayons and paints.

loans.name: Alicia Guillermina

texts.es:
La Señora. Alicia es socia del banco comunal Yanbal, vive por el sector de Molleturo, lugar en donde su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y comercio, son personas que mantienen su cultura y tradiciones siendo muy amable y carismáticas. 

La Señora. Alicia tiene 24 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 8 y 6 años de edad que estudian en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo es chofer profesional y labora realizando fletes en una camioneta, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

Doña Alicia se dedica a la atención de su tienda la misma que tiene hace 2 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. También se dedica a la cría de cerdos, pollos y cuyes los que los vende en su propia comunidad.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito, fue invitada por su cuñada a formar parte de este grupo. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en productos de primera necesidad para su tienda. 

Su meta es que su tienda sea más grande y  tener más variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Ms. Alicia is a member of the communal bank Yanbal. She lives near the Molleturo zone, a place where people devote themselves to raising animals and growing crops, and to business. They are persons who maintain their culture and traditions, being very friendly and charismatic. 

Ms. Alicia, 24, is married and from her conjugal union she has conceived two children, 8 and 6 years of age, who attend a small elementary school in the area. Her husband is a professional driver and hauls freight in a small truck. The house where they live is their own property. 

Doña Alicia devotes herself to running the store which she has had for two years. She works from Sunday to Sunday from 6 a.m. until 7 p.m. She also raises pigs, chickens and guinea pigs which she sells in her own community. 

In the communal bank she is on her second loan. She was invited by her sister-in-law to join this group. She is going to invest the money from the loan in basic staples to sell in her shop. 

Her goal is that her store would be bigger and have a greater variety of products.

loans.use: to purchase basic staples for her grocery store.

loans.name: Josefa Maria

texts.es:
Josefa de 47 años vive en el centro de Malambo, municipio, área metropolitana de la ciudad de Barranq,uilla, a 5 kilómetros del aeropuerto de la ciudad, contiguo a las poblaciones de Soledad, Sabanagrande y Santo Tomás, caracterizado por una composición social muy especial, debido a que en sus habitantes encontramos una mezcla gente de todo el país, que llega a trabajar de manera independiente mediante un negocio o en El Parque Industrial Malambo S.A. -PIMSA- condominio industrial privado de completa infraestructura de servicios, orientados a garantizar reducciones en los costos a las empresas que se ubiquen en sus instalaciones y que tienen garantizada la disponibilidad suficiente de mano de obra a las empresas de la zona.
Ella tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 12 y 22 años, con quienes sueña ver convertidos en personas exitosas y son el motor de su vida. Hace 5 años  Josefa trabajaba en un almacén y quedó desempleada, con su liquidación compró una vitrina, insumos de modistería y adecuó una habitación en su casa, aprovechando el potencial estratégico de su barrio, su negocio cada día fue aumentando sus ventas y con ellos sus utilidades, las que le permitieron comprar más vitrinas que surtió y posteriormente 2 máquinas troqueladoras con 40 juegos de troqueles, ofreciendo el servicio de troquelado y forrado de botones, también compró  dos estantes exhibidores de cintas e hilos para vender en su mercado.
Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que Josefa hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización a la que llegó al conocer las bondades de los  credikiva,  y por eso está aplicando a él y lo invertirá en surtido de materiales para zapatería y artículos de papelería con los cuales quiere diversificar su oferta. Su meta más adelante es adecuar su negocio, para darle una mejor imagen, lograr apoyar los estudios universitarios de sus hijos y cumplir su sueño personal de tener un negocio posicionado. Mientras este ocurre maneja un ciclo de 93,58% dias, una rotación de inventarios de 93 días, mientras su rentabilidad  es de un 31%.
texts.en:
Josefa is 47 years old and lives in the center of Malambo, a town in the metropolitan area of the city of Barranquilla about five kilometers from the airport.  It is near the towns of Soledad, Sabanagrande, and Santo Tomás.  The area has a special social composition since its inhabitants are a mix of people from all over the country that come to work independently at their business, or in the Malambo Industrial Park (PIMSA).  This is a private industrial area with a complete infrastructure of services designed to reduce costs for the businesses located there, and guarantee the availability of sufficient labor to the businesses in the area.

Josefa has two children who are 22 and 12 years old.  She hopes that they will be successful people, and they are her motivation in life.  Five years ago, Josefa worked at a store and became unemployed.  With her settlement, she purchased a display case, dressmaking supplies, and outfitted a room in her house to take advantage of the strategic potential of her neighborhood.  Her business was growing every day and with that, her profits grew, which allowed her to purchase more display cases.  Later she bought two die-cut machines with 40 stencils and offered die-cut services and covered buttons.  She also bought two display stands for tapes and threads to sell.

Her Kiva loan is Josefa's first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, an organization that introduced her to the benefits of Kiva loans.  For this reason, she is applying for a loan to purchase shoes and stationary so that she can diversify her offerings.  Her goal is to improve her store to give it a better image, support her children's university studies, and fulfill her personal dream of having a well known business.  While this happens, she manages a cycle of 93.58 days, an inventory rotation of 93 days, and her profitability is 31%.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and stationary to diversify her business.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Edilberto, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, es agricultor en pequeño, este negocio surgió por su propia iniciativa y con la ayuda de su esposa ya que la tierra donde cultivan es alquilada, no tiene horario fijo para realizar las labores.
El, está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas abono y fertilizantes esto le permitirá tener un mejor cultivo y ofrecer mejores productos a sus clientes y le ayudara a recibir más ingresos. 
El objetivo de Edilberto es ser un buen cliente para mejorar sus cosechas y sus ingresos y así para mejorar el nivel de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Edilberto lives with his wife and their children. He is a small-time farmer. He started the business on his own initiative and with the help of his wife since the land they cultivate is rented. He doesn't have a fixed schedule to carry out his work. He is requesting the loan to purchase manure and fertilizer to have better cultivation and offer better products to his customers so he can earn more income. Edilberto's goal is to be a good client who will have better harvests and income and in this way improve the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Azucena Del Carmen

texts.es:
Azucena, vive con sus hijos y sus nietos,  tiene una venta D. semilla D. marañón, dicho negocio surgió por iniciativa D. su esposo quien lo hace desD. 21 años.
Actualmente ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. semilla, esta compra le ayudara para tener un mejor inventario para sus ventas y ampliar su negocio.
Ella quiere a traves del prestamo mejorar el negocio y sus ingresos para satisfacer las necesidades D. la familia, ya que se considera una persona emprendedora y con buena moral D. pago.
texts.en: Azucena lives with her children and grandchildren. She sells cashews, a business her husband started 21 years ago. Currently she is requesting a loan to purchase more cashews, which will help improve her inventory so her sales and business expand. Through this loan, Azucena wants to improve her business and her income so she can meet the needs of her family. She considers herself to be an enterprising person with good repayment morals.

loans.use: to purchase cashews.

loans.name: Mónica Carmita

texts.es:
La Señora. Mónica es socia del banco comunal Yanbal, vive en las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad que es de clima frió, es reconocida por ser la tercera ciudad más importante  del país, cuenta con una gran variedad en su gastronomía, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.
