Doña Mónica tiene 44 años, es casada y ha concebido 3 hijos de 23, 22 y 16 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en la universidad y trabajan, su último hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad.  Su esposo es chofer profesional y labora conduciendo un bus que es de su propiedad, no tienen casa propia y viven arrendando.

La Señora. Mónica labora en un comedor y esta actividad la desempeña hace 3 años, trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde.

Es socia de la banca comunal hace 3 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la matricula del colegio de su hijo y en útiles escolares.
 
Su sueño es tener casa propia.
texts.en: Mónica is a member of the Yanbal community bank and lives on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca. The city has a cool climate and is recognized as the third most important city in the country. It has a wide variety of cuisines, cultures and traditions. Mónica is 44 years old, married and has three children, ages 23, 22 and 16. Her eldest two sons attend a university and work, and her youngest son goes to school in the city. Her husband is a professional driver and works driving a bus he owns. They don't have their own home so they rent. Mónica has worked at a restaurant for the past three years. She works Monday to Saturday from 7 a.m. until 5 p.m. She has belonged to her community bank for three years, and with this new loan she plans to buy school supplies for her youngest son and and pay for his tuition. Her dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies and pay for tuition.

loans.name: Gloria Judith

texts.es:
La señora Gloria Judith es casada, tiene 33 años de edad, a tenido sus estudios de nivel medio, tiene 3 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la enseñanza, es decir esa maestra de educación como también al comercio ya que tiene una tienda de consumo diario, lleva ya 5 años con este negocio.

Decide hacer un préstamo para invertirlo en capital para la tienda, ya que va a comprar más productos: aguas gaseosas, jugos, comidas en lata,  lácteos como leche y carnes, golosinas, etc. Espera en el futuro tener un negocio grande como una abarrotería.
texts.en: Gloria Judith is 33 years old, married and has a high-school education. She has three children who are in school. She makes a living in education; that is to say she is a teacher but also works in commerce since she has had a convenience store for five years. She is requesting the loan to invest capital into her store so she can purchase more products, such as carbonated water, juices, canned goods, milk and other dairy products, meats, snacks, etc. She hopes in the future to have a big business like a grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase products for her store, such as carbonated water, juices, canned goods, milk and other dairy products, meats, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con un hijo y una sobrina, es viuda, agricultora, siembra maíz, este negocio surgió gracias a su esposo quien lo desempeñaba y le enseño el oficio, lo atiende junto a mozos que paga, no tienen horario fijo para trabajar.
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de abono, otros fertilizantes  y pagar mano de obra, este prestamo le ayudara a trabajar los cultivos y sacar buena cosecha para mejorar sus ingresos.
su objetivo es sacar buenos cultivos para mejorar junto a us familia cubriendo las necesidades y teniendo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rosa lives with her son and a niece. She is a widow and works as a farmer harvesting corn. This business started thanks to her husband, who carried out the labor and taught her the trade. She tends to the crops along with young workers whom she pays, and they don't have a fixed work schedule. She is requesting the loan to purchase manure and other fertilizers as well as to pay for labor. This loan will help her better tend to her crops so she has a good harvest and improve her income. Her goal is to have good crops so she can cover necessities and provide herself and her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase manure, other fertilizers and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Don Esteban es comerciante de una pulperia que administra junto   a su esposa, su negocio tiene once años en las ventas, pues de profesion es mecanico pero debido a su condicion de su pies, que tuvo un accidente, lo ejerce poco. Y que con esos otros ingresos se ayuda para pagar gastos basicos.
Don Esteban ha venido mejorando la infraestructura de su vivivenda en donde ha hecho el muro, que es de gran relevancia para su seguridad, hoy en dia hara cambio de techo y el piso del bajarete, los materiales a comprar bloques, arena, cemento, y comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Esteban is storekeeper of a grocery store that he runs with his wife.  Their business has been open for 11 years.  Though by profession he is a mechanic, he does not practice much because he injured his feet in an accident.  With this other income he is able to pay his basic expenses.

Esteban has been improving the infrastructure of his home, where he has built a wall that is very important for his safety.  Currently, he will work on putting in a new roof and floor for the shed.  He needs to buy blocks, sand, and cement to begin building.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to repair the roof and put a floor in the shed, improving the condition of his home

loans.name: Arselia Epifania

texts.es: El Sra. Arselia nació en Araní Cochabamba tiene cuatro  hijos algunos ya independientes,  su esposo es el Sr.  Fernando,  hace 40 años que se vinieron a la guardia en busca de mejores oportunidades dejando su ciudad natal y mediante el sindicato de pequeños comerciantes del mercado tienen un pequeño puesto en el mismo,  en la cual  trabaja en la venta de desayuno se levanta a tempranas horas de la mañana para preparar sus alimentos y su esposo se dedica a la carpintería en su domicilio,  hace 30 años que  esta trabajando como carpintero y a veces se dedica  preparar la masa para las empanadas ya que ella elabora sus propias empanadas,  para llevarlo al mercado ayudando así a su esposa mayormente lo hace los fines de semana, ya que ella cuenta con una ayudante pero esos días se necesita mas manos en lo que es la preparación ya que ella elabora empanada de pollo, queso, masaco, pastel de choclo, yuca, etc. Con el dinero del credito comprara harina por mayor, Es una persona muy trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Arselia was born in Araní Cochabamba and has four children, some of whom are already independent. Her husband is Sr. Fernando, age 40. They left her hometown and came to La Guardia in search of better opportunities. After joining a union of small merchants, Arselia was able to acquire a vending post at the market. Her work involves selling breakfast, so she wakes up in the early hours of the morning so that she can prepare the food. Her husband works from home as a carpenter and has been in this profession for 30 years. Sometimes he helps with preparing the dough, while Arselia is busy making her empanadas to take to the market. She works mainly on the weekends. Recently Arselia hired an assistant because she needs more hands for making empanadas filled with chicken, cheese, mashed plantains, sweet corn, cassava, and other items.

The money from this loan will be used to buy flour in bulk. Arselia is a hardworking individual and is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to buy flour in bulk.

loans.name: Alex Jhon

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Vamos Juntas” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú).  Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

En el lugar conocimos al señor Alex Jhon que nació en la ciudad de Cusco, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, y nos cuenta:

“Actualmente, Yo vivo en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizo mis actividades, Yo soy artesano y realizo pinturas, arte plástico y muchas cosas más, yo tengo un pequeño taller en mi domicilio y está básicamente esta implementada con cuadros, pinturas, oleos y otros materiales. Ya son 15 años que me dedica a este negocio y me va  muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiero el préstamo para comprar más materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo oleos, pinceles, bastidores, pasteles, etc. Mi sueño es exportar o exhibir mis trabajos en el país de Estados Unidos para que conozcan mi talento”.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Vamos Juntas” (We Go Together) meets every 30 days in the city of Cusco, which is known in the region for being a tourist and commercial area. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

It is here that the staff of Asociación Arariwa met with Sr. Alex Jhon, who was born in the city of Cusco. He is 31 years old, married, and has two children. Alex said the following:

“At the moment, I live in the city of Cusco and this is where I conduct my activities. I am an artisan who produces paintings, works made of plastic, and many other items. I have a small workshop in my home that is equipped with canvases, paints, oils, and other materials. I have already been in this business for 15 years and have done very well. My dream is to export or exhibit my works in the United States so that people can discover my talent.”

loans.use: to buy oils, brushes, frames, pastels, and other items.

loans.name: Duvan De Jesus

texts.es:
Duvan, vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos, es agricultor y ganadero, su padre le enseño esta labor, y ha logrado mantener a su familia de las ganancias que le dan la agricultura y la ganaderia.
El esta realizando la siembra de maiz, para esto solicita un prestamo que cubra el gasto de abono y fertilizantes, pues estos materiales son necesarios para fortalecer la milpa y prevenirla de plagas.
su aspiracion es aumentar el terreno de cultivo y apoyar a sus hijos para que puedan superarse.
texts.en:
Duvan lives with his wife and four children. He is a farmer and a rancher. His father taught him this trade and now Duvan is able to support his family with the revenue he generates from farming and raising livestock.

He just finished planting corn, so he is requesting a loan to cover the cost of buying compost and fertilizers. These supplies are needed to strengthen his cornfield and prevent pests.

His aspirations are to increase his farmland and to support his children so that they can succeed.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Renacer Uncovia, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad es de clima frió, fue nombrada en 1999 como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad por la belleza de sus iglesias y su centro histórico, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Doña María tiene 30 años, es madre soltera de un hijo de 5 años de edad que está estudiando en el jardín de infantes. Vive con sus padres, su papá es guardia de seguridad y su mamá labora en un restaurante de su propiedad, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señora María es una profecional en pastelería y trabaja en un local de lunes a viernes desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde. En su casa realiza pasteles pero solo bajo pedido y en sus tiempos libres ayuda en el negocio de su madre. 

Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de una maquina batidora que le hace falta para realizar los pasteles en su casa. 

Su meta es tener su cafetería y pastelería.
texts.en:
Sra. María is a member of the Communal Bank “Renacer Uncovia” and lives on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca. This city has cold weather and was named a World Heritage Site in 1999 because of the beauty of its churches and its historical center. The people have maintained their culture and traditions.

Doña María is 30 years old and a single mother of a five-year-old son who is a kindergarten student. She lives with her parents. Her father is a security guard and her mother manages her own restaurant. María does not own a home and lives with her family in a rental property.

Sra. María is a professional pastry maker and works at a shop from Monday to Friday from 6am to 2pm. When she is at home, María makes pastries only upon request. During her free time, she helps out at her mother’s business.

This is her second loan through the Communal Bank and she will invest the funds in the purchase of a mixer so that she can make pastries at home. Her dream is to open a cafeteria and pastry shop.

loans.use: to buy a mixer.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal Renacer Uncovia, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, fue nombrada en 1999 como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad por la belleza de sus iglesias y centro histórico, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Doña Rosa tiene 60 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 8 hijos quienes son todos mayores de edad, casados e independientes. No tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señora Rosa se dedica a un a la venta de comida, trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 5 de la tarde hasta las 8 de la noche, este trabajo le ha permitido salir adelante y lleva en él 8 años. 

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su 4 crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Renacer Uncovia” and lives on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca. This city has cold weather and was named a World Heritage Site in 1999 because of the beauty of its churches and its historical center. The people have maintained their culture and traditions.

Doña Rosa is 60 years old, married, and has eight children. All of them are adults, married, and independent. She does not have a house of her own and lives in a rental property.

Sra. Rosa has a business selling food. She works Sunday to Sunday from 5am to 8pm. This work has allowed her to get ahead and she has been in business for eight years. Rosa is receiving her fourth loan from the Communal Bank and will invest the funds in the purchase of provisions for her business. Her dream is to own a home.

loans.use: to purchase provisions for her food business.

loans.name: Elizabeth Rosalia

texts.es:
La Señora Elizabeth es socia del banco comunal Renacer Uncovia, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad  es de clima frió, fue nombrada en 1999 como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad por la belleza de sus iglesias y centro histórico, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora Elizabeth tiene 22 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido una hija de 5 años. Su esposo labora en una carpintería, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de un familiar.
 
Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de cosméticos Avon, esta actividad la desempeña hace 2 años, trabaja sin horario fijo de domingo a domingo. También se dedica a la venta de empanadas las mismas que vende solo bajo pedido.

Este es su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, bisutería y víveres para realizar sus empanadas.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Sra. Elizabeth is a member of the Communal Bank “Renacer Uncovia” and lives on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca. This city has cold weather and was named a World Heritage Site in 1999 because of the beauty of its churches and its historical center. The people have maintained their culture and traditions.

Sra. Elizabeth is 22 years old, married, and has a five-year-old daughter. Her husband works as a carpenter. She does not have her own home and lives at a relative’s house.

Elizabeth has been selling Avon cosmetics for two years and her work schedule lasts from Sunday through Sunday. She also sells empanadas, but only on request.

This is her third loan through the Communal Bank and she will invest the funds in the purchase of perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, trinkets, and ingredients for making empanadas. Her goal is to own a home.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, trinkets, and ingredients for making empanadas.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Vamos Juntas” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú).  Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una D. las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

En el lugar conocimos a la señora Dominga que nació en la ciudad D. Cusco, tiene 57 años D. edad, está casada y fruto D. esta unión tiene cuatro hijos y nos cuenta:

“Actualmente, Yo vivo en la ciudad del Cusco y donD. realizo mis actividades, Yo me dedico a llevar y vender productos del valle sagrado como verduras y frutas a la ciudad D. Paruro y al regresar a la ciudad del Cusco llevo granos secos, carne y queso. DesD. muy joven me dedico a este negocio, aproximadamente unos 25 años estoy en el negocio y me va muy bien.  En esta oportunidad requiero el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como verduras y frutas”.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Vamos Juntas” (We Go Together) meets every 30 days in the city of Cusco, which is known in the region for being a tourist and commercial area. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

It is here that the staff of Asociación Arariwa met with Sra. Dominga, who was born in the city of Cusco. She is 57 years old, married, and has four children. She said the following:

“At the moment, I live in the city of Cusco and this is where I conduct my activities. I bring products from the Sacred Valley, such as vegetables and fruit, to sell in the city of Paruro. When I return to the city of Cusco, I bring back dried grains, meat, and cheese. I have been in this business since I was a young woman and have been working for approximately 25 years. I have done very well and am taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy more merchandise, such as vegetables and fruits.”

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Edgar Eduardo

texts.es:
El señor Edgar Eduardo es casado, tiene 39 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar de estudiar, tiene 3 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la confección de tejidos, pantalones, playeras, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica al mismo oficio inició este negocio siendo trabajador para otro negocio, y lleva 10 años de experiencia con este trabajo.

Decide solicitar un préstamo para ampliar su capital de trabajo va a comprar más tela e hilos, espera que en el futuro mejore en ganancias  y mejore su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Sr. Edgar Eduardo is 39 years old, married, and has three children who are in school. He did not have the opportunity to pursue an education. Edgar makes woven articles, trousers, and shirts with the help of his wife, who works in the same trade. He has 10 years of experience in this line of work, both in his own business and working for other people.

Edgar decided to request a loan in order to increase his operating capital. He plans to buy more fabrics and thread. In the future, he hopes to improve his earnings and his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Isabel Emilia

texts.es:
La señora Isabel, de 46 años de edad, madre soltera, originaria de Estelí. Ella se dedica a vender tamales, elotes, güirilas (tortillas e maíz dulce) y montucas (Tamales hechos de maíz dulce). 
Este ha sido su segundo préstamo, con la primera inversión pudo salir adelante con su negocio, ayudo a su familia, mejoraron sus ventas. Compra elotes para hacer sus tamales, montucas y güirilas, tuvo la capacidad de poder producir y vender un poco, mas que antes ahora la demanda de sus clientes aumento y necesita mas materia prima con que trabajar y cumplir con los pedidos que le hace. Requiere este préstamo para comprar elotes, azúcar, queso, canelas para realizar sus güirilas y tamales, pagar a vendedores que le ayuden a distribuir sus productos. Con esta inversión podrá tener suficiente materia prima para trabajar, vender mas y darle la oportunidad de ingresos a los vendedores.
Su más anhelada meta es poder sacar adelante a sus hijos y hacer prosperar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Isabel is 46 years old and a single mother who is originally from Estelí. She sells tamales, corn on the cob, “güirilas” (tortillas made of sweet corn), and “montucas” (tamales made with sweet corn).

This is her second loan. With her first investment she was able to move her business forward, help her family, and improve her sales. Isabel bought corn for making tamales, “montucas”, and “güirilas”. This allowed her to produce and sell a little more than ever. Now the demand for her customers has increased and she needs more supplies for her work so that she can complete her outstanding orders.

Isabel needs this loan to buy corn, sugar, cheese, and cinnamon for making “güirilas” and tamales. She will also pay vendors to help distribute her products. This investment will allow her to have sufficient supplies for her work, sell more, and create opportunities for her vendors to earn income. Her greatest wishes are to help her children move forward and to make her business prosper.

loans.use: to buy corn, sugar, cheese, and cinnamon and to pay vendors to distribute her products.

loans.name: Marta Albertina

texts.es:
La señora Marta Albertina está casada, tiene 24 años de edad, cursó sus estudios de educación primaria, tiene 1 hijo el cual aun no estudia, se dedica a la confección de tejidos como también al comercio, inicio este negocio gracias al tiempo que estuvo como trabajadora para  otro negocio, y hasta el momento cuenta con 10naños de experiencia.

Decide solicitar un dinero como prestamos a ASDIR para ampliar su capital de trabajo, trabaja en la confección de camisas y playeras, va a comprar telas e hilos para confeccionar mas y poder vender más de su producto. En el futuro quiere que su pequeño negocio sea una empresa.
texts.en:
Sra. Marta Albertina is 24 years old, married, and finished her elementary school education. She has one son who is still not in school. Marta produces and sells woven articles. She started this business as a result of working at another business. As of this moment, she has 10 years of experience.

Marta decided to request money through loans from Asociación ASDIR to increase her operating capital for making shirts and beach shoes. She is going to buy fabrics and thread so that she can produce and sell more of her products. In the future, she wants her small business to become a larger enterprise.

loans.use: to buy materials for weaving.

loans.name: Trabajando En Armonia Group

texts.es:
Luisa llevo cursos de confección de ropa esto le sirvió para poder empezar su propio negocio, al principio lo hizo trabajando para otros pero se dio cuenta que si ella misma confeccionaba las prendas y las vendía tendría más ingresos, y asi fue lo que mas vende son polos de algodón  y polos deportivos esto a su vez los comercia en los mercados de su zona y en algunas ferias, con su trabajo puede ayudar a solventar los gastos de sus hijos ya que ella es madre soltera, el préstamo que EDAPROSPO le esta otorgando le servirá para incrementar sus materiales como telas de algodón e hilos, su hermano la apoya en el trabajo compartiendo labores de costura, mas adelante quiere formalizar su negocio y convertirlo en una empresa estable donde pueda dar trabajo a otros , ella y  12 socias pertenecen al grupo “ TRABAJANDO EN ARMONIA “ ya forma parte del grupo cerca de 1 año y quiere seguir por que encuentra mucho apoyo para su progreso.

   * Luisa se encuentra lado derecho es la cuarta vestida con buzo deportiva color azul con rayas blancas.
texts.en:
Luisa took classes in the making of footwear, leather products and clothes and this enabled her to start her own business.  At first, she worked for others, but then she realized that if she made and sold the items herself, she would have more income.  What she sells most are cotton polos and athletic wear.  She sells them in local markets and during festivals or fairs.  With her job, she can help settle the expenses of her children, since she is a single mother.  This loan will allow her to increase her supplies like cotton fabric and thread.  Her brother supports her in her work and later wants to formalize the business and convert it in a stable business that can provide jobs to others.  She belongs to the group “TRABAJANDO EN ARMONIA"  (Working in Harmony).  She became part of the group almost one year agao and wants to continue because she has found a lot of support for her progress.

Luisa is the fourth from the left wearing the blue jacket with white stripes.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Patricia Veronica

texts.es:
Patricia madre soltera sus hijos ya mayores, comerciante, su plan es poner una pulpería, desde hace tiempo tiene su propio negocio de venta de cosmético, lo inicio con fondos propios. 
La infraestructura de su vivienda requiere de mejoras, el préstamo que solicitad será invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción: cemento, hierro, arena, piedra cantera, piedrines, bloques, piedras canteras, tablones de maderas entre otros materiales. Para construir la pared de lateral de la casa. Obteniendo seguridad  y protección que necesita. Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo al mejoramiento de nivel de vida.
texts.en: Patricia is a single mother and her children are grown up. She works as a merchant and her plan is to start up a convenience store. For some time she has had her own business selling cosmetics, which she started with her own funds. Her home's infrastructure needs improving, and she plans to use the loan to purchase construction materials such as cement, iron, sand, quarry stones, gravel, cinder blocks, wooden planks and other items to build a side wall. This will provide the security and protection she needs. She is grateful to the lenders for supporting her in improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Olimpia Venesuela

texts.es:
La señora Olimpia Venesuela está casada, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene actualmente 47 años de edad, tiene 7 hijos los cuales tan estudiando, se dedica a la venta de ropa para mujeres, inicio este trabajo cuando era pequeña y hasta el momento lleva 13 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es maestro de enseñanza.

Decide solicitar un préstamo para invertirlo en capital de negocio y poder comprar más mercadería: cortes, güipiles, fajas, pañuelos, suéteres, etc. En el futuro espera que su negocio en una tienda formal y más grande  y mejorar así su condición de vida.
texts.en: Olimpia is married and never had the opportunity to go to school. She is 47 years old and has seven children who all go to school. She makes a living selling women's clothing. She started working when she was young and at the moment has 13 years of experience. She is supported by her husband, who is a teacher. She is requesting the loan to invest in capital for her business so she can purchase more products, such as shorts, blouses, belts, scarves, sweaters, etc. In the future she hopes to have her business in a formal and bigger store and in this way improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to sell, such as shorts, blouses, belts, scarves, sweaters, etc.

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en:
Sokhoeun, 30 years old, and her husband, Rotha (pictured with her), have been married since 2002 and have two children. One son attends grade 3 and one daughter attends grade 1. The family is living in a village along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sokhoeun sells fish. Her husband is farmer. He also drives motor taxi when he is free from farming. 

She is asking for her first loan of $700 to repair the house where she lives. She will use a part of her loan to assist in her husband’s farming business.

loans.use: To repair the house where she lives and fill the land around her house.

loans.name: Rasy

texts.en: Rasy is 29 years old and has been married to his wife, Sokry, since 2005. They have one young daughter and live in a village along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Rasy makes a living by driving a bicycle-powered taxi while his wife works as a vegetable seller. Rasy would like to go into business in Phnom Penh, but his type of vehicle is not legal there. He is applying for this loan for $800 to buy a motorized taxi, or tuk tuk, which the law allows him to use in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: to buy a motorized taxi.

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en: Soeun makes a living by building wooden houses. His wife, San, is a farmer and silk weaver. They have been married since 1979 and have four children -- three sons and one daughter. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Soeun is applying for a loan for $1,000 to buy pipe and a pump to use on the family's farm.

loans.use: to buy equipment for his family's farm.

loans.name: Lyheng

texts.en:
Lyheng (in the photo) and his wife, Sokhai, live along National Road Number Six about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2005 and have two children--one son and one daughter. One is in school and the other is still young. 

Lyheng and his wife are fish sellers. They buy from Prek Phnao market and sell the fish in a market located in Phnom Penh. They do not have their own shop within the market to sell their fish, and as a result, they must spend a lot of money on rental fees which makes it very difficult to support their family. 

They want to buy their own space at the market, but they do not have enough money. Therefore, Lyheng is asking for a loan of $1,000.

loans.use: To purchase a space for a shop to sell fish.

loans.name: Cherrylymer

texts.en:
Cherrylymer is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Cherrylymer has a shop that sells beverages, chocolate powder, drinks & snacks. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Cherrylymer has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Cherrylymer hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

loans.name: Nguon

texts.en:
Nguon and his wife, Bunneang, have been married since 1985 and have four children-two sons and two daughters. They live in a village along National Road Number two approximately thirteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Nguon is a taxi driver, while his wife sells roast beef, and sandwiches on baguettes from her home. Nguon is requesting another loan in the amount of US $1,200 to purchase a spare part for his taxi in order to repair it.

Photo: motorbike at the back is belonging to Nguon’s children which they drive to work. So, please do not wonder Nguon is a motor taxi driver.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his taxi in order to repair it.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia  is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Virginia  has a shop that sells canned goods, noodles & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy canned goods & sacks of rice for retailing per kilogram.

Virginia  has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Virginia  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods & sacks of rice for retailing per kilogram.

loans.name: Han

texts.en:
Han (in the photo) is 51 years old and her husband, Channy, is 52 years old. They live in a village across the Mekong River, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1980 and have six children--two sons and four daughters. Three are married and live in separate homes; two are garment factory workers and another one stays at home.  
  
Han and her husband are farmers. She is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to work.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena  is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, has 11 children and earns a living by running a shop where she sells canned goods, beverages and snacks. She has been in this line of work for three years and is applying for a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. Elena has been a member of HSPFI since 2008 and is committed to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is creative and a hardworking mother. She doesn't want to laze at home and just do household chores. She wants to earn more money to provide sustenance for her family. She has four children, two of whom are attending school. 

Marites sells processed meat products such as hot dogs, longganisa and tocino (cured pork and sausages). She usually earns about 6,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month in this field of work. Aside from selling meat products, she also raises hogs for future merchandise. 

Marites hopes to strengthen her hog raising business, which is why she is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy feed, medicine, and vaccines for her hogs. With the help of this loan, she can get higher profits from her hogs. Thus, it would help improve her business and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicine, and vaccines for her hogs.

loans.name: Namroeun

texts.en:
Namroeun (pictured above) is a garment worker. Her husband, Sochea, is a construction worker. They have been married since 2005 and have a young son. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, about 15 kilometers away from the city. 

Namroeun is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to drive to work.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Teodora has a food shop that sells rice & cassava cakes. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients in making snacks like pancakes. 

Teodora has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Teodora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks like pancakes

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated and has six children. 

Victoria has a shop that sells snacks like rice cakes & pancakes. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients for making snacks. 

Victoria has just become a member of HSPFI this year. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children. 

Susan has a shop that sells beverages, snacks, & canned goods. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan for 13,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks. 

Susan has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Susan hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, & snacks

loans.name: Redelyn

texts.en: Redelyn is 34 years old, married, has five children and lives in the town of Bintangan, Larena, Siquijor. For the last three years, she has earned a living by raising pigs. She has been in this line of work for three years and is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more pigs to raise and sell. She has been a member of the Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for a year, and hopes to improve her business so that she can earn enough money to meet the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Marylou

texts.en:
Marylou is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with children. 

Marylou has a shop that sells T-shirts, blouses & underwear. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy additional clothes & beauty products from NATASHA.

Marylou has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marylou hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional clothes & beauty products from NATASHA.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 56 years old and lives in Mobod, Oroquieta City. She is married with one child. 

To earn a living, Josephine has a business selling different kinds of viands. She earns about PHP 1,500 each month doing this type of work. Josephine has a requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase meats, vegetables and spices.

Josephine has been a member of PMPC 11 years.  In the future, Josephine would like to have a big restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase meats, vegetables and spices.

loans.name: Asila

texts.en:
Asila is married with 3 children. Asila is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Asila is a pig grower to earn a living. She has been doing this for 14 years. She has requested a loan to purchase feed for the pigs.

Asila has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Asila hopes to have a concrete piggery.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Loreta has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages & snacks. She has had this business for nine years. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Loreta has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Loreta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Paz has a shop that sells snacks like rice cakes, cassava cakes & hot cakes. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy raw materials needed for making snacks.

Paz has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Paz hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed for making snacks.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, has three children and earns a living by selling fish such as sardines and mackerel. She has been in this line of work for 21 years and is applying for a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy more fish to sell to her customers. Nenita has been a member of HSPFI since 2009 and is committed to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ceremie

texts.en: Ceremie is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated, has two children and earns a living by running a shop that sells snacks, canned goods and noodles. She has had this business for four years and is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. Ceremie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010 and is committed to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena, age 56, is a vendor of snack foods. She prepares and sells items such as rice cakes and suman (sweetened rice). She has been engaged in this business for five years. She and her husband have six children.

Elena has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 in order to buy the raw ingredients needed for making snacks to offer for sale.
 
Elena has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy rthe aw ingredients needed for making snacks such as rice cakes and suman (sweetened rice) to offer for sale

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, age 47, is a widow with two children. She owns and operates a shop where she sells canned goods, beverages, and snacks. She has been engaged in this business for five years. 

Teresita has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 in order to buy snacks, beverages, and canned goods to offer for sale.

Teresita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages, and canned goods to offer for sale in her shop

loans.name: Shela

texts.en:
Shela, age 24, sells snacks, beverages, and canned goods from her shop. She has been engaged in this business for three years. She is unmarried and has two children.

Shela has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 4,000 in order to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale. 

Shela has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina, age 42, owns and operates a shop where she sells fish, such as sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for three years. She and her husband have four children.
 
She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 4,000 in order to buy fish to offer for sale in her shop.
 
Paulina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to offer for sale in her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, and snacks to offer for sale

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Leang is 32 years old and married. She has two school-aged children. 

She works very hard to provide for her family. Leang has run a retail store in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia where she sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap and other grocery items like snacks and noodles.

Leang is requesting a loan from Kiva in order to buy additional items to sell, including milk and groceries. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell including milk and groceries.

loans.name: Ermakan's Group

texts.en:
Ermakan, age 42, is the leader of this group. She is divorced and is bringing up a daughter and a son. The son studies at university and the daughter is at school. 

In 2006, Ermakan started a fruit vending business with an initial investment of 5,000 soms. She earns 1,500 soms per month from this business. This profit has made it possible for her to purchase household appliances that have improved the family’s living conditions. 

She has applied for this loan because she needs additional funds in order to purchase peaches and currants to offer for sale or trade. She is confident that this will help to increase her profits. 

In the future, Ermakan intends to provide her children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line:
– People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), 
– Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and 
– Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). 
MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase peaches and currants to offer for sale or trade

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng, 53, is a fish seller living in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. She and her husband have a fishing business. Her husband catches fish in the lake, pound and river and she takes these fish, along with fish purchased from a wholesaler, and brings them to sell at the local market. She earns $3 per day. 

They have four children who are still dependent on their income. 

Seng has requested a loan from Kiva to purchase a new motor for their fishing boat so that her husband can haul his nets more quickly and they can earn more money from their fish-catching business.

loans.use: to purchase a new motor for their fishing boat.

loans.name: Prin

texts.en:
There are many Cambodians who make a living as rice cultivators. One of them is Prin, 35, who has been working in this sector since 2007. 

She and her husband grow rice on their own farmland that they inherited from their grandparents. From this business they can generate an income of around US $2 per day. 

This humble couple has three dependents. All of them are students. 

This rice-growing season, the family planted rice two months ago but their rice is not growing well due to the lack of fertilizer. Because of this condition, Prin would like to request a loan from Kiva in order to purchase fertilizer to improve her crops' yield. She says the income will help her improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena, age 46, is a rice farmer. She and her husband Rodrigo plant and harvest rice and offer it for sale to traders. They have been engaged in this business for 15 years. They usually earn P21,000 for their yield during the month of May and November. The income is put to use for daily expenses and financing their children's studies. They have three children to educate. 
 
Filomena has the drive and attitude to succeed despite poverty. She was not financially stable originally, but with the help of her family members, she has faced her challenges with strong determination. She is now requesting a loan of P12,000 in order to buy farm inputs, such as fertilizers and insecticides. Filomena is confident that this will help her achieve an abundant harvest and allow her to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy essential farm inputs, such as fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Tan

texts.en:
Mrs. Tan, 62 years old, is living permanently in Siem Reap Province of Cambodia. She works hard to support her family. She is married and has three lovely children. One of them is married, and the other two are single. 

Presently, Tan is a cooked food seller, selling her food in front of her house. Tan would like to request a loan from Kiva in the amount of US$1,200 in the aim of repairing her old house. With any remaining money, she will purchase more ingredients for her business. 

In the future, Tan would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to repair her old house.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn, age 39, owns a store where she sells a variety of goods, such as soft drinks and canned goods. She has had this business for five years. She and her husband have two children. The family lives in Mobod, Oroquieta City.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 10,000.00 in order to purchase additional stocks of soft drinks and canned goods to offer for sale in her shop. 

Jovelyn has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Jovelyn hopes to open a mini-mart.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of soft drinks and canned goods to offer for sale in her shop

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, age 49, owns a shop that sells canned goods, beverages, and noodles. She has been engaged in her business for six years. She and her husband have three children.

Teresita has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 14,000 in order to buy canned goods, beverages, and snacks to offer for sale.

Teresita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, and snacks to offer for sale

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy, age 27, runs a food shop where she prepares and sells a variety of meat dishes, such as afritada and bulalo. She has had this business for four years. She and her husband have three children.
 
Nancy has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 11,000 in order to buy the raw ingredients needed for the meat dishes she prepares and sells.
 
Nancy has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy the raw ingredients needed for the meat dishes she prepares and sells

loans.name: Cesario

texts.en:
Cesario, a 50-year-old married father of five school-aged children, wants all of his children to finish their studies, as this is the only thing of value he can give to them. He has been a farmer for almost 30 years, raising crops and livestock, usually earning a net profit of P 40,000 per harvest season.

Now requesting a loan of P20,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides for rice production, Cesario's goal is to increase his rice production to earn more income to finance the school fees of his children. He believes that his efforts and sacrifices will someday bear fruit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for rice production.

location.town: Brgy. Sta. Clara, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits, coconut wines & beverages to sell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia is 52 years old and lives in Canubay, Oroquieta City. She is married with three children. Letecia has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. Letecia has been a member of PMPC for almost a year. In the future, Letecia hopes to own hectares of coconut land.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Agerico

texts.en: Agerico is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children. Agerico is planting & harvesting vegetables like ampalaya (bitter melon). He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy fertilizers for vegetable plants. Agerico has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Agerico hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for vegetable plants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making salad & viands to sell

loans.name: Hazel Grace

texts.en:
Hazel Grace is 22 years old and a single mother of one child.  She lives in Bliss Caipilan, Siquijor, Siquijor Province.  

Hazel Grace is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living.  She has been doing this for just three months.  She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase feed and medicines for her pigs.

Hazel Grace has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for two months.  In the future, Hazel Grace hopes to help her family and support their basic needs.

loans.use: to pay for medicines and feed for her pigs

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is married with five children. Victoria is 59 years old and lives in Poblacion, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. To earn a living, Victoria has a tailoring business. She has had this business for 30 years. Each month, she earns approximately 15,000 PHP.  Victoria has been a member of PMPC for over one year. In the future, Victoria hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en: Ma. Fe is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. Ma. Fe has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. Ma. Fe is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Ma. Fe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.en:
Gonzalo's dream is to send his four children to school to have a degree someday.  He works hard to overcome the hardships of life and achieve his dream. Together with his wife, they have managed well their rice field for almost 30 years, planting rice and raising livestock, earning a net income of PHP 35,000 per cropping.

To improve his production, Gonzalo is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides and to pay the labor for uprooting and transplanting rice on their field. 

He hopes that he can reap a large volume of rice to increase his income for the education of their children and to satisfy their basic needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Bandina

texts.en: Bandina is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. Bandina has a pigpen and sells matured & grown pigs. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs. Bandina has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Bandina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs

loans.name: Haqiqat

texts.en: Haqiqat is 49 years old, married and has two children. Haqiqat runs her own business selling home furniture in Agcabadi district in the southern part of Azerbaijan. Her shop is located in the central market of the city and everyone who passes by comes in, but still her monthly income from this business is only $300 USD. She would like to increase her profit and start selling plastic furniture. This will allow her to increase her monthly turnover and improve life of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new inventory of plastic furniture

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en: Elshan is a 20-year old very young and enthusiastic man who sells different kinds of dishes, glasses, plates, kettles and other home products. This kind of product is very popular for dowries. His store is located in the central market of his home city. His profit is about $350 USD per month. He wishes to expand his business and purchase more items to increase his stock. For this purpose, he applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in his store

loans.name: Konul

texts.en: Konul is 38 and a devoted mother of 3 beloved children. She sells women's seasonal clothes in the central market of Agcebedo district in the southern part of Azerbaijan. Konul is married and her husband actively helps her to run her business. Konul has about four years of experience in this field. She buys merchandise two times per month from another city. She is very polite and friendly and this is the main key to her successful business. She applied for a 1,000 AZN loan to purchase more seasonal clothes and increase her monthly profit.

loans.use: to purchase more seasonal women's clothes

loans.name: Glenna Flor

texts.en: Glenna Flor is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with one child. Glenna Flor has a food shop that sells viands like caldereta and pancit bihon. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients needed for cooking the viands she sells. Glenna Flor is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Glenna Flor hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for cooking viands to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase three cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food products to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 42 years old and lives in Palomoc, Titay, Zamboanga del Norte. Evelyn has a sari-sari store business and earns approximately 10,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for additional capital. Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for this year 2011. In the future, Evelyn hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her general store

loans.name: Farahim

texts.en: Farahim is 55 and a livestock breeder with six years of experience. He is a trusted borrower of AqroInvest and KIVA. He is married and has two grown sons who are, thanks to his experience, independent adults also engaged in farming. Farahim and his sons work on the same farm and their total monthly income is about $400 USD. He usually purchases small cattle. Then he raises them and sells them in the livestock bazaar after five or six months. He would like to purchase more cattle. Summer is the high period for wedding parties and dishes from meat are very popular. Farahim would like to take this chance and purchase more cattle for their meat. This will be his fifth loan from AqroInvest and his second from KIVA.

loans.use: purchase three cattle, one pregnant cow and fodder

loans.name: Zonalyn

texts.en:
Zonalyn is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Zonalyn has a food shop that sells snacks like rice cakes, puto (steamed rice cakes) & butse (sesame seed ball). She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients like flour & eggs to make snacks.

Zonalyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Zonalyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like flour & eggs to make snacks

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Elvira is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. Elvira has a food shop that sells viands like afritada (tomato saauce based stew) & caldereta (beef stew). She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for cooking viands to sell. Elvira is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Elvira hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for cooking viands to sell

loans.name: Vuqar

texts.en: Vuqar  is a small business retailer. He sells different kinds of home products. He is 41, married and has four children. He has about three years of experience in sales. He applied for a 1000 AZN loan in order to purchase more goods and expand his business. Vuqar is promising to pay back on time.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Cecil

texts.en:
Cecil is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Cecil has a retail shop that sells dried fish. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy dried fish to sell.

Cecil is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future,Cecil hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase new seasonal clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more items to increase profit.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en: Catalina, a 59-year-old resident of the Philippines, is married and has four children.  For the past five years, Catalina has had a food shop that sells banana cakes, and she is now requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks. A new member of HSPFI, she  hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make snacks.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Cristina has a shop that sells soft drinks like Pepsi & Coca Cola . She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy  cases of beverages like soft drinks to sell.

Cristina has been a member of HSPFI since 1998. In the future, Cristina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy cases of beverages like soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase and diversify veterinary medicine.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion  is 67 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Asuncion  has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 16 years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks. 

Asuncion  has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Asuncion  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce, 32 years old, has been selling mobile phones and accessories in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last two years.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officer and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy mobile phone accessories in bulk as this is cheaper.

In future, she hopes to grow her shop and also be involved with selling computers and computer accessories.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone accessories in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 51 years old, married to Rose, and they have two school-going children. He has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last seven years. 

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting, and he will also use some part of the cash to pay his casual worker.

In future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for labour.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 63 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 3 children. 

Anita has a food shop that sells snacks, like rice & cassava cakes. She has had this business for 8 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.  Anita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Anita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Joram

texts.en:
Joram is 37 years old.  He is married to Esther, and they have three school-aged children.  He has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last six years.   

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his 1st loan.   He plans to buy a bag of Irish potatoes for planting.  He will sell his harvest at the local market.

In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a bag of Irish potatoes for planting

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio is aspiring to something better for his family. He is an inspiration to them by working all day long to generate income.  In the morning, he goes up to the field. Virgilio raises crops. He plants and harvests rice for future sale. He has been doing it for almost five years. At the last crop in May, he earned P20,000. In the afternoon, after going to the field, he operates a motorcycle transport service for the people in his village for additional income.


He wants his crop to yield more, and that is why he is requesting a loan of P10,000 to pay for labor costs in sowing and transplanting rice seedlings for his farm.  With the help of this loan, he will thoroughly prepare his farmland for the next planting season.  He hopes to achieve an abundant harvest every season.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs in sowing and transplanting rice seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more livestock (4 cows) for sale.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome was born in 1969; she is married and blessed with one child.  She sells cosmetics to earn a living.  She sells her products both in retail and wholesale.  She joined Faulu Kenya so that she would save her money and access business loans easily.  Now she has requested 50,000 Kenya shillings to renovate her business premises and buy cosmetics.  Salome hopes to open other business outlets in the future.

loans.use: To renovate her business premises and buy cosmetics

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 42 years old.  She is married and has five children.  For four years, she has been farming to earn a living. She mainly practices dairy farming and poultry farming.   So far, she has managed to employ two people in her business.  Mary believes that through Faulu Kenya, she will improve her farming.  
Mary hopes to expand her business and employ more people in the future.  She has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 55 years old.  He is married to Magdaline.  He runs a hotel and a shop and has been doing it for the past thirteen years, with a monthly profit of KES.20,000 for his primary business and KES.10,000 for the secondary business.  He is requesting KES.30,000, with which he plans to purchase stock for the hotel, like big sufurias (cooking pots) and foodstuff like rice, beans, kale, etc.   With the anticipated profit, he plans to open another hotel.  In the future, he hopes to have a five-star hotel.

loans.use: to purchase stock for the hotel, like big sufurias (pots) for cooking,  and foodstuff like rice, beans, kale, etc.

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
Jason is a married man with two children, aged 4 and 6.  He has been selling newspapers for ten years.  He was previously operating a retail shop.  He is very grateful to Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management skills.  This has helped him to retain his business for ten years.
Jason hopes to fully establish his business so that he may be financially stable in the future.  He has requested  50,000 Kenya shillings to buy a printer and photocopy machine.

loans.use: To buy a photocopy machine and a printer

loans.name: Maryanne

texts.en:
Maryanne is 30 years old and lives in Bliss Caipilan, Siquijor, Siquijor Province.  She is married with 2 children.  

Maryanne sells assorted canned goods products, feeds and other grocery items in her general store business. She has had this business for almost one year.  Each month, she earns about PHP10,000 doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan of PHP10,000 to purchase more canned goods, feeds and other grocery items.

She has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for 5 months.  In the future, Maryanne hopes to improve their living standards from being poor to being able to support the basic needs of the family.

loans.use: To purchase assorted canned goods products, feeds and other grocery items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wheat flour, charcoal, firewood and a water tank.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last six years.  He is 28 years old, married to Ann and they have two school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan.  He paid his previous loan of Kshs 25,000 well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow.  He hopes the income from selling milk will boost his farm income.

In future, Patrick hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last three years.  He is 27 years old, married to Grace and they have one school-going child.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan.  He paid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy carrot seeds for planting and also to plow the land.

In future, David hopes to become a leading farmer in Olkalou town.

loans.use: To plow the land and buy carrot seeds for planting.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary, an ambitious 33-year-old businesswoman, is single and blessed with two children. For the last five years she has been providing tailoring services, primarily making school bags, to meet the needs of her family.

Thanks to Faulu Kenya, Rosemary has been able to supply her business with the necessary materials, and she is now requesting a loan of 20000 Kenya shillings to buy more fabric. Within the next five years, she wants to become a major supplier of school bags in Kenya.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Jokudu

texts.en: Jokudu has six children. All of the children are in school. She is a widow. She took a loan from BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business selling ice cream. She will use the profit from her loan to pay for school fees.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks like ice cream and beer to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 58 years old and lives in Dipolog City. She is married and has seven children. To earn a living, Sarah makes and sells dried fish. She earns about 6,000 PHP each month doing this work. Sarah has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase fish and salt for making dried fish. Sarah has been a member of PMPC for six years.

loans.use: to purchase fish and salt for making dried fish

loans.name: Sierelyn

texts.en:
Sierelyn is married and has one child. She is 35 years old and lives in Dumanhog, Siquijor, Siquijor Province. 

Sierelyn is a farmer and raises pigs to sell. She has been doing this for 2 1/2 years. She has requested a loan to purchase more pigs to raise and sell. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for eight months. In the future, Sierelyn hopes that her current business will become more productive.

loans.use: To purchase pigs

loans.name: Benelinda

texts.en:
Benelinda is widowed and has four children. She is 42 years old and lives in Poblacion Norte, Maria, Siquijor Province.  

To earn a living, Benelinda sells dressed chicken that is ready to cook. She has had this business for 12 years. Each month, she earns 12,000 PHP doing this work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase dressed chicken.  

Benelinda has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for five months. In the future, Benelinda hope to provide a college education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase dressed chicken

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a printer and a duplicator.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en: Madina has two children. Both of the children are in school. She is a married woman. She took a loan from BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She will use the profit from her business for pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks like cold water,`soda,and beer to sell

loans.name: Yeat

texts.en:
Yeat is married to Rom and has two children; they are school-aged. Presently, she is a vegetable seller in a market far away from her house, located in Siem Reap Province of Cambodia. Her good relationships and good characteristics make her sell better than others. As her sales increase, it generates more income for her. With her husband’s help, they’re all getting ahead in life.

 She says that her work requires lots of effort and she does it all so that she can provide a better future for her children and so that they don’t have to face the same challenges that she did. 

She is asking for a loan from Kiva in order to purchase a motorbike for transporting vegetables, which will help her meet her customer’s demand in a timely manner. She is grateful to the foundation for the opportunity it provides her.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for transporting vegetables on time.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
This is Elvira, 52. She is a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. Her husband is Victor, a cook. She is a mother to her three children. Her eldest child is in college and the youngest is staying at home.  She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business.

Elvira operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Elvira earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located inside her house. At the same time, she earns additional income by sewing or repairing clothes and pants. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory and for the maintenance of her sewing machine. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Elvira hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products to sell in her store

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 62 years old and married to Milcah. They are blessed with seven children. Currently only two depend on them. The rest are all grown up. He has been a dressmaker for the last three years, making a monthly profit of KES 7,000. He has been loaned KES 15,000, which he plans to use to purchase more clothes and materials for sale. 

With the anticipated profit, he plans to expand his business and educate the two remaining children to the college level. In the near future, he hopes to expand his business and build a decent house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and materials to sell .

loans.name: Muharam

texts.ru:
Мухарам честная и целеустремленная женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать 3 детей. Мухарам является учительницей, и она преподает в школе.  Зарплату, которая она получает, не хватает для семейных нужд и она решила заниматься шитьём. Мухарам более 10 лет занимается услугами шитья национальных платьев и у неё достаточно богатый опыт.  Она научилась швею у родственницы и теперь с легкостью справится сама.  Когда она уходит в школе на занятие её дочь и невестка продолжают шитьём. Мухарам хотела бы получит кредит в размере 1000$ США для покупки материалов, чтобы шить платье и продавать за хорошую цену. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Muharam is an honest and dedicated woman. She is married and a loving mother to three children. Muharam is a teacher and she teaches at the primary school. Her salary is not enough for her family, so she decided to begin sewing.  Muharam has been making traditional clothes for more than ten years.  She learned how to sew from a relative, and now easily copes by herself. When she goes to school to work, her daughter and daughter-in-law continue sewing. Muharam would like to receive a loan for $1,000 to buy fabric to sew clothes and sell them for a good price.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Serlynda

texts.en:
Serlynda is married with four children. Serlynda is 51 years old and lives in Bliss Caipilan, Siquijor, Siquijor Province, Philippines.

Serlynda is engaged in pig raising to earn a living. She has been doing this for almost 10 years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Serlynda has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for eight months. In the future, Serlynda hopes to improve their living conditions and be able to repair their house.

loans.use: To purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 35 years old. He is married to Jane, and together, they are blessed with two children who are school-going.

He owns a retail shop. He has been doing this business for the last 11 years and gets an income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month.
